Name: Business Analyst
Description: The IT Business Analyst (BA) works collaboratively with functional business areas, other IT BAs and IT internal and external partners to achieve project objectives, milestones and deliverables while ensuring the implementation of high quality solutions that support organizational goals and objectives. This includes elicitation and documentation of business requirements, recommendations and participation in solution design, business process modeling, time/cost estimating, authoring of use case scenarios and test scripts, participation in all cycles of testing, training of business leads and super users, and deployment. Projects could be enhancements to existing applications and systems, as well as implementation of major new applications. The IT Business Analyst will also assist in general application support of production applications and systems, managing relationships with business owners, software vendors, auditors, and other internal IT teams. This position will have contact will all levels throughout the company’s divisions, as well as outside vendors and auditors. This includes but is not limited to project Steering Committees which include USA division presidents and vice presidents, various IT Directors including the Director of Support and Director of Infrastructure, the CIO, IT Application Managers, Business leads, outside vendors, internal and external auditors, developers and programmers.Essential Functions & Responsibilities • Elicit and maintain business requirements and be responsible for ensuring the requirements are clear, concise, detailed, accurate, documented, testable, and traceable through the project lifecycle. • Document, coordinate and participate in testing efforts in conjunction with other IT team members at all levels (unit to integration to user acceptance). • Ability to develop comprehensive test scenarios. • Participate in the deployment of enhancements, upgrades and major implementations. • Participate in the definition of and validation efforts of conversion data for all conversions from legacy systems and applications to new applications and systems. • Work closely with the business leads to define and produce end user training documentation, online learning, and FAQs as required. • Communicate with business users in an effective manner via regular meetings, emails, and onsite visits to review functionality, status, decision points, recommendations, and increase utilization of application/system features.Competencies, Skills and Abilities • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a meticulous attention to detail. • Ability to communicate effectively to business users, internal and external functional project team members and technical team members; ability to communicate effectively with all levels within the organization. • Superior analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, assess risk, reconcile conflicts, transform high-level information into details, prioritize user requests from the underlying true needs for the business as a whole, and understand the difference between solution ideas and business requirements and to distinguish clearly between them. • Decision-making skills, to determine and recommend solution alternatives that satisfy requirements while also meeting aggressive project schedules and budgets. • Organizational and Time Management skills, to work in a fast-paced environment, on multiple projects and tasks concurrently, while also working with the vast array of information gathered during requirement elicitation and analysis and to manage rapidly changing information and priorities. • Experience with SDLC, software development methodology lifecycle, including business planning, data analysis, process analysis and design, business and functional requirements analysis, use case analysis, applications/system design, development, testing, and implementation. • Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills. • Experience in leading dynamic cross-competency teams using a structured project methodology. • Full understanding of Change Management and logical security principles. • Ability to work with minimal supervision and under aggressive project timelines and strict budget requirements. • Preferred; Negotiation skills, conflict management, adaptability, high stress tolerance level, professional business etiquetteEducation & Experience • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Systems or Computer Science required. • A minimum of five (5) years solid proven business analysis experience including facilitation skills, to lead requirements elicitation sessions and the writing of business requirements. • This includes the ability to understand business user requests, translate them into technical terms if needed, effectively organize and express technical facts to technical and non-technical users, both verbally and in writing. • Superior hands-on experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, MS Project, PowerPoint, and Visio) • 5+ years implementing a variety of software or infrastructure projects • Experienced with general business processes in areas such as finance, sales, supply chain • 1 year of experience with JDE. • Ability to travel up to 10%; this position is required to be on site five business days per week to accommodate special project deadlines.

Name: Business Systems Analyst - Workday
Description: HubSpot's Business Enablement team is responsible for building and supporting the systems used to run and grow our dynamic business. We focus on high-impact, large, cross-functional projects that improve our most important metrics or fundamentally change the way we operate. In this role you will collaborate with system owners, product managers, engineers, users and business leaders to continuously improve our business processes and the systems that underpin them.  You will join a small team chartered with enabling our employee lifecycle systems to be as intuitive, delightful, automated, and resilient as our users expect them to be. By "employee lifecycle systems," we're referring to the tools used to run our people operations (recruiting, onboarding, performance management, etc) as well as the tools that help HubSpot employees do their best work.  A few of the key third party employee lifecycle tools we use today include Greenhouse (recruiting applicant tracking system), Workday (human resources information system), Okta (single sign-on) and Looker (business intelligence platform). While we use the best third party tools on the market, we are inclined to build our own apps when we know we can do it better. In this role, you'll get to:Become an authority on all things people operations and specifically WorkdayPlan, coordinate, and communicate to deliver impactful cross-team projectsAnalyze problems to find the best available solutionTranslate business requirements into system designsConfigure, test, and implement customized solutions on our third party applicationsSpec, build, and monitor system integrationsEvaluate potential new vendorsRelentlessly focus on quality - quality of data, performance, user experience, etcObsess over data and data modelsOperate under pressure- it comes with the territory when you're in the middle of every major strategic initiative we haveBe an extraordinary collaboratorWe are looking for people who:Like solving hard problemsBecome energized in dynamic situationsWant to work with remarkable peersConfidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. HubSpot is a place where everyone can grow. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.About HubSpot HubSpot helps millions of organizations grow better, and we'd love to grow better with you. Our business builds the software and systems that power the world's small to medium-sized businesses. Our company culture builds connections, careers, and employee growth. How? By creating a workplace that values flexibility, autonomy, and transparency. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you.  You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 4M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every HubSpotter globally who has helped build our remarkable culture, HubSpot has been named a top workplace by Glassdoor, Fortune, Entrepreneur, and more.  HubSpot was founded in 2006. We're headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and we have offices in Dublin (Ireland), Sydney (Australia), New Hampshire, Singapore, Tokyo (Japan), Berlin (Germany), and Bogotá (Colombia). By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Recruiting Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot's use of your personal information.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: SUMMARY: Provides support for multiple enterprise-wide business systems including ERP (Fujitsu Glovia G2), CRM, PLM and HRIS. These system supports business processes worldwide for manufacturing, distribution, sales, service, human resources and finance operations. The resource will participate in long range planning leading to the introduction of new solutions and the management of all ancillary system integrations. The ability to work independently and possessing strong organization, communication and customer service skills is essential. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Responsible for collaborating with other departments within the organization to implement new business functionality and to incorporate process improvements via introduction of new systems, program changes and enhancements.Develop and provide end-user training on an as needed or requested basis for business processes, including the creation and maintenance of training documentation and business procedures.Respond to help desk incidents and service requests.Assist in development of programming specifications and statement of work documents that clearly identify the business problems and proposed solution while gaining acceptance from key stakeholders.Organize, define and conduct functional and integration testing.Participation in cross functional team projects.Assists with the administration, maintenance, development and enhancement of the enterprise-wide ERP system, Glovia G2. Experience with the PRO-IV/SL programming language, Oracle PL/SQL language, and basic understanding and operation of Windows and Linux operating systems as well as ERP interaction with the Oracle database solution.Support of Business to Business (B2B) transaction environment that is currently using BizTalk as the core solution.Troubleshoots application and system problems and recommends/performs corrective action.Upgrade systems routinely to maintain supportability on current software release levels.Defines, coordinates, performs and communicates business application programming needs necessary for upgrades and customizations in support of users and management.Communicates with supervisor, management, co-workers, and peers to assure cross-functional system requirements are properly analyzed and addressed.Provides consulting and education to end users of business application systems.Reviews and adjusts related job schedules to optimize system performance and ensure delivery of reports and information streams.Maintains a high level of business systems process knowledge.SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Analysis, Design, Test and provide Technical Documentation of Business Applications.Project Management Skills.Detailed analytical abilities.User Support and Customer Service Skills.Interpersonal, and Strong Communication Skills.Relational Database Knowledge.Bachelor’s Degree in a related field or technology required.5+ years of experience working with Glovia/Super Layer/Pro-IV.Advanced SQL database management and maintenance skills.1-2 years of experience working with Oracle administration and related technologies.Exposure to B2B processes using BizTalk would be helpful.Practical application ability with Microsoft Office.TYPICAL BACKGROUND: BS in Computer Information Systems, Accounting, or Business Management or equivalent experience. Three to five years’ experience supporting a business application systems environment with knowledge of ERP solutions. Required Skills Required Experience Job Location  Beverly, US-MA

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY: Working under the general direction of the Finance Director and the Sr. Project Manager, the Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for financial reporting, analysis, and forecasting including management reporting, financial modeling, financial and budget impact analysis, and budgeting and revenue forecasting. The Sr. Business Analyst must understand revenue cycle issues for the assigned practice and identify opportunities to improve overall billing performance or explain variances from budget projections. The analysis includes review of budget projections, performance data, and the revenue cycle to understand key influences on the Cancer Center's financial performance. The Sr. Business Analyst prepares summaries and reports for Administrative Management for review and comment. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Conduct analysis (performance, variance and financial) on both the General Hospital and Physician Organization performance Create/update monthly reports which include but are not limited to: financial performance reporting, budget and revenue forecasting, RVU modeling, and billing cycle reconciliation Review current performance results (charges, income, accounts receivable, collection rates) and compare these to budget projections and prior year performance Current performance may also include review of the Cancer Center's charge submission practices, interface billing issues, dictionary reviews, coding needs, unique system set-up issues, specific payer responses etc Proactively identify opportunities and key issues for the Center. This may be high-level payer analysis or more discreet analysis of particular CPT codes or payer issues. Develop customized reports to address specific questions raised Summarize findings in report or presentation format Collaborate with other areas for exchange and verification of information and present findings; this will include presentation and summary of analysis Analyze and project spending impacts on cash, depreciation budgeting and forecasting, and year end reconciliation Routinely analyzes, budgets/forecasts, enforces policies and reports on spending on capital asset funding from philanthropy, research grants, and other non-operating sources Monitor and report on capital tail activity with a particular focus on prior year tail. Uses Vision, PeopleSoft, and other information systems, as necessary, to monitor and provide management information on status of capital projects, including spending versus budget, on regular basis. Coordinates with all levels of the organization to manage capital projects, including funding, project spending and time frame and timely reconciliation and close out. Responsible for ensuring accuracy of capital-related components of operating budget and month end results. Ensures capital activity is compliant with accounting principles, policies and regulations Prepares return-on-investment analyses for proposed capital projects, special projects and strategic initiatives Maintains accurate records and databases Assists with other management, budget, and ad hoc assignments as required Assist in the management of the Cancer Center faculty compensation plan Develop understanding of network affiliations and associated contracts with the ability to quantify contract terms for budgeting and performance managementQualificationsQUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree required, MBA degree with financial analysis experience preferred, 3-5 years experience in financial analysis required Experience in a professional healthcare setting is preferredSKILLS/ ABILITIES/ COMPETENCIES REQUIRED: Excellent financial and operational analysis skills Solid understanding of healthcare billing, finance and accounting principles Familiarity with Epic billing/scheduling systems Strong analytical and presentation skills Excellent oral and written communications skills Ability to present information and respond to questions from multiple levels of staff, including but not limited to Chiefs, Executive and Administrative Directors, Managers, providers Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. Ability to read, analyze and interpret financial and operational date and/or governmental/payer regulations Expert knowledge of accounting principles and practices as applicable to health care and non-profit organizations Excellent interpersonal skills, including strong customer service orientation and problem resolution; ability to work effectively as a member of team Must be extremely well organized and have solid time management skills in order to handle multiple tasks simultaneously under sometimes tight deadlines Self-motivated, inquisitive, resourceful, organized and able to take initiative; take-charge ability, including knowledge of resources to answer questions, research data and information and display independent judgment. Interested in improving processes over time Comfortable operating in a complex, matrix organization with minimal supervision and oversight Exceptional judgment and discretion on sensitive fiscal and confidential issues. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, Access, and Outlook) required Basic SQL for extracting data from data warehouse Ability to distinguish and separate pertinent information from noiseEEO Statement Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged.  Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Description: IT Sr Specialist29-Oct-2018Auto req ID47432BRJob Code384158 IT Sr Specialist LocationUSA - MA - Boston Business TitleSenior Business AnalystSub-Unit------------ Appointment End Date30-Apr-2020Salary Grade058Time StatusFull-time Union00 - Non Union, Exempt or Temporary Basic QualificationsBS/BA degree required. 7+ years' experience in defining requirements for desktop, mobile, or web-based software applications. Advanced degree or certificate in a related educational program may be applied towards years of experience.Additional QualificationsTeam player – optimistic and collaborative; takes ownership, and embraces others’ successesImpeccable verbal and written communicator who builds rapport at all levels of the organizationTechnically competent, with excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skillsA talented negotiator who listens and generates creative solutions to complex challengesAdaptable and quick learner who enjoys tackling a large variety of problemsHandles multiple tasks and projects under competing deadlines and shifting priorities employing good follow-through and time managementSkilled with wireframing and workflow tools (Balsamiq, Gliffy, or similar) and Microsoft OfficeProficient with ticketing systems (JIRA or similar), and tools for generating design artifacts (Confluence or similar)Experience with agile methodology is strongly preferredExperience in a health-related and/or grant-based academic environment is strongly preferredMasters level degree or certification in a related field is a plusThe SMART IRB team seeks applicants who value people, customers, teamwork, trust, quality, integrity, preparedness, and product excellenceThe SMART IRB team seeks applicants who value people, customers, teamwork, trust, quality, integrity, preparedness, and product excellencePlease provide representative work samples in addition to your resume.https://open.med.harvard.edu/project/smart-irb/Funded by the NIH National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences through its Clinical and Translational Science Awards Program, grant number 3 UL1 TR002541-01S1. This is a term position, through April 30, 2020. with a strong possibility for renewal.Additional InformationThis is a grant funded term position with an end date of April 30, 2020, with a possibility of renewal. Harvard offers an outstanding benefits package including:Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with full vesting after 3 years of service.Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation, and complementary health services.Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.The Harvard Medical School is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.DepartmentHarvard CatalystPre-Employment ScreeningEducation, IdentityJob FunctionInformation Technology Duties & ResponsibilitiesHarvard Catalyst | The Harvard Clinical and Translational Science Center at Harvard Medical School seeks a seasoned Senior Business Analyst skilled in requirements elucidation, with extensive experience in workflow, business process, and user-centered design. Use your skills to accelerate research and improve patient care!Harvard Catalyst https://catalyst.harvard.edu/ and the SMART IRB program https://smartirb.org/ are developing web-based systems used by researchers and institutions across the United States to streamline the initiation of clinical research studies through Single IRB Review. Our semi-automated transactional workflow systems require sophisticated yet simple interfaces to ensure researchers can quickly and efficiently accomplish their tasks. We seek a creative, versatile, problem-solving senior business analyst who thrives in new development efforts employing user-centered design. You are equally comfortable eliciting stakeholder needs and technical solutions. Using a team-based agile methodology, and in conjunction with the senior user experience designer and director (the design team), you ensure the finished product provides a simple, intuitive, and effective user experience that achieves the business aims. You draw upon leadership’s key insights and offer responsive solutions to address researcher and administrator challenges.Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):• Engage with mid-level and executive stakeholders at a national level to determine strategy and vision for software applications• Negotiate priorities, sprint content and longer-term plans collaboratively with the design team, stakeholders and technical team, to ensure effective sprint cycles that produce a high-quality minimum viable product• Collaborate with stakeholders and design team members to define an optimal user experience• Collaborate with the technical team to elucidate and define system requirements• Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that user stories and specifications are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable• Collect, analyze, and translate requirements into user stories, workflows, business process logic, process maps, wireframes, specifications, and acceptance criteria• Triage mid-sprint bugs and issues to assess if in scope for the release• Maintain release notes and help documentation, ensure Confluence and JIRA accurately reflect the final content of the release, and maintain and groom product backlog for future sprintsPlease provide representative work samples in addition to your resume.School/UnitHarvard Medical School EEO StatementWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Who you are:Self-motivated and self-managed with a demonstrated analytical ability and curiosityTakes creative approaches to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolutionWorks independently and within a team settingStrong oral and written communication skillsFluent in EnglishLive in or willing to move to Armonk NY, Austin TX, Littleton MA, or Raleigh NC to work collaboratively in the officeHow well help you grow:This role will give you executive visibility and the chance to show that you can drive impactful change.Offer an opportunity to be a part of a hardworking team in a collaborative, borderless organization in an inspiring, empowered environmentProvide a place where youre proud to work and where you are motivated to produce the best results possible No remote opportunities exist  Must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorshipRequired Technical and Professional Expertise 10+ years of experience with IBM support or development processAbility to work with both the business and technical resources to understand and define functional/technical requirements Ability to use Agile collaboration tools (e.g. Mural, Slack, RTC, Trello)Working familiarity with Agile development conceptsMust have excellent communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Subject matter expert in Salesforce Service CloudFamiliarity with IBM brand and business structure EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Headquartered in Reading, MA and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence, deep networks, as well as national reach. For more information, visit http://www.eliassen.com.  Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Business Analyst - Fin Tech
Description: The Fintech Business Analyst role is part of a Global Agile Product Development Team delivering innovative solutions within the Investor Services domain. You will greatly contribute to create or enhance product functionalities driving operational efficiency for FinTech clients. Exceptional analytical skills combined with some technical knowledge and project management experience will enable you to design originative solutions and provide excellent client service in a fast-paced environment. The role will perform a liaison function with BBH’s clients/business units and technology teams to accomplish the agreed upon tasks within budget and agreed upon timeframes.  The Business Analyst acts under general supervision reporting to the Business Analyst Lead, and will work on projects from initiation to implementation.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Conduct business analysis efforts for a variety of Fintech online application projects and initiatives.Partner with clients, the business development team, the implementation team and client support team to identify business and systems requirements and processes.Collect, understand and document business requirements.Work closely with the Systems Development team to ensure the business requirements are met and align with the system design.Understand the product architecture and functionality which will allow you to assess the feasibility of client requests.Estimate value, develop cases and prioritize stories and epics to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value, aligned with product strategy.Facilitate and/or participate in and contribute to internal and/or external client workshops/meetings to gather, understand and document client’s project goals, workflows, complex business needs, gaps, and opportunities. Determine how changing business needs will affect the system, product, and processBuild and use knowledge of what is happening in the industry, and in technology, to drive implementation of critical functionalities into our applications.Ensure current and accurate documentation of the solution, including business requirements documents and systems design documentsOversee and/or perform testing of system changes, development of product announcements and any needed modification to client demonstrations.Be innovative and drive “outside the box” thinking. Solve difficult problems as needed through proposing insightful, knowledgeable, effective solutionsProvide cost estimates, based on input from the technology team, to the business sponsors for the proposed solutionManage and complete the deployment and implementation of new products/applications internally at BBH and externally with our clientsGain an understanding of product design and solutions to take wider responsibility for the defined product functionalities. MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS:  Bachelor's degree preferred with 3+ years experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified and/or 3+ years related business or technology experience.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to solve difficult problems with effective solutions.Strong communications skills, both oral and written. Communicates professionally with internal and external clients.Effective as a group member, wants to share knowledge, aims to achieve common goalsExperience in business analysis and project management principles, practices, techniques, and tools.Self -starter, thrives with minimal direction to create effective business solutions.Experience in product/application developmentDemonstrated knowledge and appreciation of business concepts and requirements as applicable to a multi-faceted financial services organization. Ability to grasp and master new skills quickly.Organizational skills and ability to multi-taskQuality Management experienceExperience in Corporate Actions and/or Middle Office Services is a plusSQL knowledge is a plus. Grade-7We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.Full timeBoston

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Researching and documenting vendor based solutions and hospital-wide implementations for configurable software to meet project needs.  " Provide assistance in identifying, evaluating, and designing systems and procedures that meet strategic data transformational and business requirements. " Defining tasks, setting deliverable expectations, coordinate and communicate with IT team members, stakeholders and end users.

Name: Business Analyst, Officer
Description: Enterprise Data Governance (EDGM) is a Corporate-wide initiative focused on the on-going governance of data in our Platform. The EDGM Solution Team defines requirements and design for on-going initiatives to support the Business and Compliance users across the State Street enterprise including People, Process and Technology initiatives. The EDGM Solution team is looking for experienced people with skill sets that enable us to successfully deliver our many project objectives. The team works to define requirements and define/design enhancements for multiple Enterprise Platforms including KYC, CRR, Communications Hub Platforms. This business/process analyst position will focus on defining and documenting enhancements for these enterprise platforms.  Expertise required includes subject matter expert relative to complex business process requirements and design; Gathering information from multiple sources and reconciling conflicts; decomposing high-level information into details, documentation, and use cases. Leadership of the Reporting Working Group and other working groups as needed, including creating and managing development and delivery schedule; coordinating BA, development and SQA resources; facilitating regular working group meetings; providing status reporting to senior management.Gather business requirements from data consumers including Business Units, Compliance, Shared Services, and others. Write business requirement documents and/or oversee the work of other BAs assigned to the working group.Ensure data privacy and security needs are well defined. Design and ensure the development of data privacy and security in alignment with regulatory and jurisdiction based requirements.Utilize subject matter expertise to investigate and contribute to resolution of production problems, liaising with development, support and data consumers.Participate in other initiatives in Capabilities Team as needed, providing business analysis and data expertise.

Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Name: Entry level business analyst
Description: Entry-level Business Analysts work under supervision and perform a variety of tasks including developing and maintaining various databases, generating reports, and receiving continuous training while working on a variety of projects.  The primary responsibility of an Entry-Level Business Analyst includes supporting data gathering and providing review and analysis of data. Other day-to-day duties include ensuring data integrity, participating in data quality control and validation, and producing requirements documents for various business development activities. An entry-level business analyst may also create and execute test scripts under supervision. Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: Established in 2005, LogicManager is a rapidly growing pre-IPO software company and leading provider of Enterprise Risk Management solutions located in Bostons Seaport Innovation District. This is an opportunity for an accounting professional seeking to join a dynamic company thats certified as a Great Place to Work® and recognized by Forrester as a Leader in our industry and by Gartner with the highest rank in Ability to Execute.  LogicManagers Business Development Analyst positions are a consultative sales role that requires significantly more analytical ability than traditional inside sales due to the breadth of solutions provided and the markets in which LogicManager does business. About the Position As a Business Development Analyst, youll be asked to execute and enhance the business development process. Business Development Analysts must quickly learn about complex risk and compliance challenges in industries like financial services, healthcare, and energy. Moreover, Business Development Analysts must communicate with subject matter experts in these fields, understanding their unique needs, and proposing solutions based on LogicManagers platform and services. Business Development Analysts are expected to be the face of the company, interactive with prospective customers at industry conferences, virtually, and during on-site visits. Responsibilities:Responsible for managing a portfolio of accountsProvide insights to organizations on industry trends and best practicesProduct demonstrationsContract negotiations with customersAnalyze and interpret organizational dataAssist organizations to demonstrate business value to their Board of Directors and Senior ManagementContribute to product development and enhancementsProvide insights for marketingDesired Skills & Experiences: We are looking for individuals with the drive to succeed in a dynamic, high-growth business environment. We value employees who are creative, energetic, proactive, and intelligent in their thinking and actions. The ideal candidate will have: 2-4 years of experience in a customer-facing role is preferredExcellent communication skillsStrong analytical/problem solving skillsStrong reading comprehension and critical reasoningConsultative/strategic selling experience is a plus LogicManager heavily favors promoting from within. Candidates will have opportunities for advancement to higher levels of responsibility, including supervisory positions, well ahead of industry standards. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status as defined by federal, state or local law.

Name: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst Sr
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a Senior Salesforce Business Analyst for the Enterprise CRM Program team to contribute to the success of implementation and evolution of the bank?s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms. The Senior Salesforce Business Analyst will play a vital role supporting a large-scale CRM program to ensure the timely delivery of innovative solutions to address complex business objectives across the enterprise. The position will collaborate between business groups and technology teams and will be responsible for working with cross-functional teams to assess and design business models, gather business requirements, integrate technology, develop training and implementation materials, and provide post-implementation support. *Responsibilities:** + Provide program management and conduct business and systems analysis on a variety of projects and initiatives in the Enterprise CRM Program  + Collaborate with business partners, subject matter experts and other team members to define and document high-level business needs and detailed requirements  + Define and implement improvements to business process and ad-hoc projects in the face of ever-changing marketplace and consumers.  + Create and maintain business process flow maps and diagrams to facilitate understanding of business needs and translate to technology solutions  + Define scope of projects and timelines associated with the completion of initiatives  + Develop and maintain relationships and communications with other team members and internal partners  + Conduct meetings and facilitate collaborative discussions to develop requirements and new functionality needs  + Serve as point of contact for user support and problem solving  + Lead efforts to investigate, analyze, and resolve application issues related to system functionality  + Review and validate test plan approaches as well as participate in system testing *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience  + 6-8 years business analyst experience with utilizing program management methodology  + 3-5 years? experience working with CRM systems  + 3-5 years? experience with system testing *Preferred Qualifications** + Excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem solving skills with the proven ability to communicate and influence effectively at various levels of the organization  + Proven leadership skills and ability to lead others in defining requirements and identifying solutions  + In depth knowledge of business operations and processes for multiple businesses  + Sharp focus on achieving results; persists at completing tasks despite challenges; ability to achieve results and navigate through ambiguity  + Well-organized; plans activities and consistently follows up  + Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment  + Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint  + Salesforce Administrator Certification (or ability to obtain within one year)  + Project management  + Agile methodology  + Sales processes and methodologies  + Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies  + Financial services industry experience *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** United States*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180038418*Other Locations:** Minnesota-MN-Richfield U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst/Developer
Description: The Business Intelligence Analyst/Developer serves as a technical resource for the Information Management team and entire staff within the Mass General Hospital Development Office. In coordination with a Director of Information Management and the Partners Development Application Team staff, the Analyst will assist with the management of identification, design, development, QA, support, and maintenance for all technology systems and components that are used to support the department. The Analyst will also facilitate and provide hands-on assistance, as needed, with the movement of data between systems, applications and technologies. This position will also serve as a liaison to our vendors and partners that currently provide these services.  The Business Intelligence Analyst/Developer will be the Development Office's primary developer of customizations in Blackbaud CRM, and will work with other affiliate developers and project leads to design and implement custom solutions to business needs in CRM. The Analyst will work in concert with all IM team members to advance the mission of fundraising at MGH, so a robust understanding of the business of fundraising is important.  The ideal candidate will be proficient in Microsoft Office suite with advanced knowledge of Excel and Access, and will have experience with relational databases and 2012 Microsoft SQL Server and Visual Studio Reporting tools. In addition, the successful candidate will bring superb customer service to match the required technical skills.  This role will take place in an office environment requiring professional attire and includes some travel to and from the Partners HealthCare Development Office in Somerville, MA.  All applicants must apply online via www.massgeneral.org . Applications must include a current resume and a cover letter detailing applicable experience and accomplishments.  About us Massachusetts General Hospital is one of the world's top academic medical centers. Founded in 1811, it is the third oldest general hospital in the United States and the original and largest teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, where nearly all of our staff physicians serve on the faculty.  We remain committed to the simple vow of service that our founders made in a letter seeking community support for Mass General's creation: "When in distress, every man becomes our neighbor." More than two centuries later, that promise sustains our commitment to deliver the most advanced and compassionate care to patients and their families. As home to the largest hospital-based research program in the nation, we continue to push the boundaries of what is possible in medicine. And as we strive to make a difference today in the health of communities locally and around the world, we prepare for tomorrow by educating the next generation of healthcare providers and researchers.  The Development Office The Development Office is a vibrant and collaborative team focused on advancing the hospital's mission of healthcare excellence. We are devoted to nurturing and expanding the philanthropy that makes the pursuit of this mission possible.  We offer a competitive benefits package including generous healthcare and retirement plans, an annual Development team bonus program (based on meeting the fundraising goal) and a flexible work environment. We also provide an array of professional development opportunities.  Principal Duties and Responsibilities Work closely with Mass General Development Staff and Partners Development Office's Application Team and other hosting vendors to manage, monitor, and support the technical infrastructure and system software used to run the business to ensure application and system availability. Identify and implement data efficiency and visualization improvements to existing systems to ensure end users have fast, consistent, updated and user friendly data resources available. Identify and recommend improved processes and new technical tools to fulfill the evolving application, integration, reporting, analysis and data mining needs of the Mass General Development office. Assist with the implementation of technology needed to facilitate the transfer of data within our own applications and the transfer of data integrations to and from third party applications. Coordinate with Partners Development Office's Application Team in data handling, transformation and transfer functions. Work closely with Partners Application Team and our hosting vendors to ensure all appropriate protection and security procedures are in place and being adhered to in order to secure all of our fundraising data. In coordination with Partners Application team, assist with the design, development, QA and implementation of all aspects of the technical infrastructure and system software to ensure our systems are setup and operating as efficiently and effectively as possible. Create and maintain documentation for all designs, procedures and policies that are in place for the technical infrastructure and system software used to run the business of the Mass General Development Office. Assume a leadership role for Mass General Development in the processes and procedures followed to upgrade our technology and applications across all platforms. Working with the other Development technology leaders, play a leading role to ensure upgrades are handled smoothly and successfully. In coordination with the Partners Application team, serve as primary customization developer for Mass General Development in Blackbaud CRM, including all customizations identified and designed during CRM conversion project and after CRM launch. Attend all CRM SDK trainings and be the MGH expert in SDK solutions, actively using and improving T-SQL and XML skills and knowledge to support and implement customization needs. Translate functional specifications into a technical specification, develop code, unit test custom solutions, and communicate with IM Director regarding deliverable progress and quality of Blackbaud CRM customizations. Responsible for other special projects as assigned by the Director of Development, Information Management. Participate in projects and organizational functions as assigned by the Director of Development, Information Management. Core Skills, Abilities and Competencies Demonstrated proficiency transferring data between cross platform applications over the Internet Demonstrated experience with MS SQL Server 2008/2012 and XML Demonstrated experience with SQL and familiarity with SSIS packages Demonstrated experience with OLAP cubes, Microsoft's SSAS, Excel Pivot Tables and Data Mining Basic understanding of well-formed and valid XML documents, and a strong understanding of XML concepts such as elements, attributes, schema, namespaces, and XML-style comments. Demonstrated experience with T-SQL concepts and terms including stored procedures, user-defined functions, views, triggers, and query optimization techniques Demonstrated experience with SSRS and a variety of reporting and data extraction tools Familiarity with Microsoft Business Intelligence suite of tools preferred Demonstrated experience with Blackbaud CRM, including development of reporting solutions and customizations via SDK preferred Ability to quickly evolve and adapt to new skills and changes to technical environment Proven skills as an effective communicator; demonstrated effectiveness in dealing with all levels of staff within an organization; team approach to problem solving Proven ability to deal with change, balance different constituent interest and work effectively with a culturally diverse community Demonstrated ability to make decisions based on analysis of information, sound judgment and assessment of impact on organizational resources Understanding of the Business of Fundraising Excellent verbal and written communication essential Well-organized, with the ability to plan but capable of being flexible to address evolving business needs Ability to handle multiple priorities; strong team-based problem-solving skills Commitment to excellence and to the mission of Massachusetts General HospitalQualifications Qualifications The ideal candidate should possess the following skills, abilities and attributes:  Bachelor's Degree with Computer Science, MIS, CIS or related field. Minimum of 5 years related experience, including experience with data analysis, project management and reporting (experience within a Development office preferred). Knowledge of IT environments including LAN/WAN communications, technologies and system hosting infrastructure and platforms Knowledge and experience providing support in a web development environment is desired, including knowledge of web-based networks, Internet systems, data transfer functions and web hosting infrastructure Demonstrated ability to produce quality work on a consistent basis Must be a self-starter and be able to manage assigned responsibilities with limited management input as well as design, manage, support and maintain all IT infrastructure needs Must be detail-oriented with strong troubleshooting skills, as well as communication and documentation skills Must have the ability to work productively in a mission critical team environment Proven ability to execute multiple tasks efficiently and effectively Prior experience in a fundraising/development organization highly desirableEEO Statement Mass General is committed to diversity among its employees and encourages qualified candidates from all backgrounds to apply.  By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected groups such as veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.  Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Name: District Business Manager
Description: About Dexcom: Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. provides continuous glucose monitoring technology to help patients and their clinicians better manage diabetes. Since our inception, we have focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions for people with diabetes while empowering our community to take control of diabetes.Summary: Manage/develop sales representatives to represent Dexcom, Inc. products to health care professionals and people with diabetes in assigned sales territories; close sales leads and process orders to achieve monthly sales plan. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Recruit, hire and train and develop sales representatives to achieve district and territory sales goals.Work in the field with district sales staff to develop skills, product knowledge and territory plans in order to achieve sales objectives. Identify top performers for continued development and low performers for performance improvement actions - up to and including termination.Meet and nurture relationships with key region diabetes centers, healthcare professionals, key opinion leaders and diabetes organizations.Manage district expenses and administrative requirements as specified by management.Provide timely information and data regarding sales performance to management; construct region forecasts as requested.Participate in dialogue with home office (marketing, training, regulatory, etc.) to provide up to date market intelligence and future product & program requirements.Responsible and accountable for achieving sales objectives.Responsible for ensuring district is committed to and conforms to the company quality systems procedures as documented.Local and overnight travel (up to 60%).Education Requirements:Bachelors degree (B.A. or B.S.) from a four year college or university is required.Travel Required:50 74%Supervisory Responsibilities: Directly supervises employees. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of this area. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. Language Skills: Must be able to communicate effectively in English. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. May be required to perform the following Physical Activity: Standing, walking, sitting, using hands, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, talk or hear, taste or smell. May be required to lift 0 lbs. to over 100 lbs. Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. May be exposed to the following environmental conditions: Wet or humid conditions, work near moving parts, work in high - precarious places, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, outdoor weather conditions, extreme heat (non-weather), extreme cold (non-weather), risk of electric shock, work with explosives, risk of radiation, vibration. The noise level in this work environment can range from quiet to very loud. Please note: The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The duties and responsibilities in this job description may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.  #LI-EF1 An Equal Opportunity Employer. Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Who We're Looking For  Our client is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst to join their team in Boston, MA for a direct hire opportunity.  Responsibilities:Assist leadership team in prioritization within the IT portfolio  Work across multiple teams to coordinate financial initiatives  Using formal SDLC process, implement automated solutions  Create and implement test plans for enhancements, bug fixes, functional changes, patches, and upgrades  Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or Computer Science  10+ years of Oracle ERP implementation experience, as well as 8+ years working directly with Oracle Financial modules  10+ years of experience re-engineering business processes  Strong technical and functional knowledge of Oracle data tables, data conversion, integration points, and technology processes  Troubleshooting and analysis capabilities  Understanding of PL/SQL packages and ability to write SQL queries  W2 and local candidates only  About Market Street Talent  Market Street Talent is a specialized staffing and consulting firm focused on staffing solutions for Information Technology positions. Name: Senior Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Job Requisition ID: 12568Additional Locations:The OrganizationHoughton Mifflin Harcourt is a global learning company with the mission of changing people's lives by fostering passionate, curious learners. Among the world's largest providers of pre-K-12 education solutions, HMH combines cutting-edge research, editorial excellence and technological innovation to improve teaching and learning environments and solve complex literacy and education challenges. HMH's interactive, results-driven education solutions are utilized by 50 million students in over 150 countries, and its renowned and awarded novels, non-fiction, children's books and reference works are enjoyed by readers throughout the world. For more information, visit http://www.hmhco.com/. The Information Technology organization is transforming to realize our mission: Become a leader in HMH’s digital transformation, and as a strategic partner, innovate and deliver highest value, competitive advantage solutions across all corporate and business functions. Our ambition is to be a digital leader through innovation and develop and deliver leading edge technology such as robotic process automation and artificial intelligence to solve some of HMH’s greatest operational business challenges. Our professionals will have business relevant skills to connect our HMH partners to technologies that propel the businesses to deliver the greatest value for HMH and our customers. We are building a team of IT professionals with an insatiable appetite to learn, a relentless focus on customer service, a technological curiosity toward future possibilities, and a creativity in solving business challenges with leading technologies. Our team will find ways to work together, create a sense of community where it’s safe to take risks and learn together, develop our careers, and all have an opportunity to work on new technologies. We will work together, learn together and have fun together. As a team, we will lead HMH’s digital transformation.The Opportunity – Sr Salesforce Business AnalystThe Senior Business Analyst is a key position reporting directly to the VP, Sales & Services HMH IT is evolving its organization, and this new position will play a pivotal role in establishing IT as a strategic business partner that understands, enables, and improves core business strategy, processes, and operations through technology solution design and delivery. We are looking for an exceptional Business Analyst to partner with business stakeholders to identify business needs and technology solution opportunities, and lead enhancement projects for existing applications, scope, design, build and deploy new applications, and onboard third-party SAAS solutions.The ideal candidate must have deep understanding of the business function, processes, leading practices, and application landscape. They must be able to lead cross-functional teams through the development lifecycle. The Sr. Business Analyst must have outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to drive clarity and consensus around business requirements, technology solution options across business and technical audiences. In order to be effective, the candidate must have the ability to quickly build effective working relationships with business and technical teams across multiple locations. This position will be located in Boston, MA and may require 25-50% travel to business partner locations.Duties & ResponsibilitiesBuild strong partnerships with business and technical development teams, in Boston, Dublin, other US locations and off-shore, to create business deliverables such as Requirements or User Story Backlog, Business Requirements Documents, Business Process Maps, Functional Specifications, Test Plans, Deployment Plans, User Adoption Plans, and other relevant documentationFacilitate workshops with business stakeholders to develop requirementsWork with business and technical development teams to support the translation of Business Requirements and Functional Specification Documents into Technical Requirements and oversee solution development/build, ensuring requirements/user stories are traceable and enabled by the solutionTake ownership of the Solution Manager inputs into projects, coordinating activities, managing deadlines and escalating risks and issuesDevelop process and data mapping for systemsAct as key liaison between business stakeholders and technical development team, building and managing strong relationships within the business functionsCreate and manage test plans to ensure solutions are ready for production deploymentWork closely with business stakeholders to build, refine and prioritise requirements or user story backlogsAdvise and recommend technology solution options that may satisfy business requirements and improve effectiveness of the businessApply problem solving techniques and product capability knowledge to ensure appropriate solutionsSupport change requirements through accurate impact analysis and change specificationsDrive quality through adherence to and supporting project management processes and procedures, including the maintenance of documentation on shared file systemsIdentify issues/events that could affect resources, schedule, budget, scope and/or deadline; escalate issues to appropriate parties for resolutionPrepare and deliver presentationsProvide support to business stakeholders and project managers to help drive business initiatives, including all phases of development lifecycle through user adoptionSkills & ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or an IT related technical discipline or 5+ years of industry software engineering experience5-10 years of experience in a business analyst role, directly engaging business stakeholders to design, build, and deploy technology solutionsExperience in leading technology projects (waterfall and agile) across the entire development lifecycle for large enterprise software applications, with deep experience in Salesforce.comDeep understanding of core business processes related to lead generation, sales and services operations and processes.Ability to clearly and concisely gather, interpret, analyze and document informationAbility to establish creative solutions to meet requirementsStrong project management capabilities, including managing project plans, identification and escalation of dependencies, risks, and issues.Excellent workshop/interview facilitation skillsProven experience in analytical, research and problem-solving techniquesIntellectual curiosity and the ability to question thought partners across functional areasExcellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependenciesStrong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal & written), including the ability to articulate complex processes and concepts to non-expertsExperience working in and leading cross-functional teams (including virtual teams) and mentoring more junior team membersMotivated self-starter with a proven ability to manage own work, prioritize effectively and manage-up to provide updates, escalate help needed, and ensure alignment with broader technology roadmapDetail-oriented, analytical, and accuratePhysical Requirements:Might be in a stationary position for a considerable time (sitting and/or standing)The person in this position needs to move about inside office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etcConstantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and computer printerMust be able to collaborate with colleagues via face to face, conference calls, and online meetingsABOUT US:Houghton Mifflin Harcourt (NASDAQ:HMHC) is a global learning company dedicated to changing people’s lives by fostering passionate, curious learners. As a leading provider of pre-K–12 education content, services, and cutting-edge technology solutions across a variety of media, HMH enables learning in a changing landscape. HMH is uniquely positioned to create engaging and effective educational content and experiences from early childhood to beyond the classroom. HMH serves more than 50 million students in over 150 countries worldwide, while its award-winning children's books, novels, non-fiction, and reference titles are enjoyed by readers throughout the world.For more information, visit http://careers.hmhco.com PLEASE NOTE: Houghton Mifflin Harcourt is an equal employment opportunity employer and participates in E-Verify. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of gender, race/ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status.

Name: Front Office Business Analyst
Description: We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to support a front office migration. The ideal candidate will have a background in risk on the fixed income side of the business. This is an excellent opportunity to work with a global asset manager to migrate their current US front office to an inhouse platform. The front office BA will have an understating of Monte Carlo Simulations, key rate duration, front office Screen build outs, US based asset types, Munis, securitize, etc. 7+ years' experience as a front office business analystExpert understand of risk on the fixed income side of the businessUnderstanding of US based asset typesProficient in SQL queriesSDL2017

Name: Business Analyst BISAM Upgrade
Description: We are looking for team players who can help financial services firms solve problems. As a team player and leading Business Analyst, you will be one of the senior technical BA leads for software retirements and system upgrades.  Your team will succeed by analyzing abstract technical data and user stories into business value, and helping our clients move from discovery to production. As a technical team player, you will help influence the future roadmap and play an important part in empowering our client and their staff to achieve more. Responsibilities As a team player, the Business Analyst will be responsible for the following across 3 key themes. RequirementsThe BA is the team owner of requirements documentation and elicitation. Instead of being the "liaison" between the team the product owner, you are the "glue" that brings them together.Help facilitate requirements gathering sessions, break epics into small valuable stories and identify clear and concise user acceptance tests and business rules for each story.Schedule and facilitate requirements elicitation sessions and make sure the right SMEs are invited.Ensure all scope changes have been appropriately captured and documented in the requirements backlog.Organize requirement artifacts in an easy structure and link any additional artifacts such as process diagrams, UI Prototypes so they are accessible from one location for the team. Testing Perform functional and user interface (UI) testing as required, once the Test Engineer has released code to the QA environment.Develops UAT test plans to be used by the business.Works closely with the business SME/UAT testers to track testing progress for each story.Facilitates UAT sessions with the business and capture changes as new requirements in Jira. Team Engagement Manage the backlog of stories by adding, removing, updating stories there (after Product Owner approval) and keeping it up to date as part of backlog "grooming".During the iterations, work on making sure the stories, test cases and business rules are clear, accessible and understood by the business and developers for all stories.Look ahead with the Product Owner to define stories and test cases for the next iteration and provide a clear definition of "Done" for each one.Organize the agenda for the sprint demo and records any new requirements mentioned during the meeting as new user stories.QualificationsTeam PlayerMinimum 5 years' experience working in or managing back, middle and front office implementations in the financial services industry.Experience implementing and integrating back, middle and front office functions with Accounting systems/providers (SS&C GlobeOp / Advent Geneva preferred) and Performance systems for Total Return Performance and GIPS Composite information (e.g. BiSam preferred)Experience working in an Agile environment (e.g. Scrum, Kanban) required.Experience utilizing databases with Microsoft SQL ServerExperience as a business analyst (or equivalent) in the area of data architecture, data transformation, data modeling, database design and warehousing, business intelligence, analytics, analysis, etc.Experience using Agile tools like Rally, Jira, and VersionOne (Jira Preferred)Ability to proactively identify and mitigate risks using Agile best practices and project dataIdeal candidates possess 5 or more projects in a combination of operational and IT roles.Knowledge of a broad range of investment products from equity to equities, derivatives and alternatives.Experience designing, developing and implementing complex technology solutions.Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.Experience navigating complex organizational structures and communicate with both technical and operational stakeholders.Great communication and emotional intelligence.Strong analytical and quantitative mindset. #LI-JW1SDL2017
