Name: Supply Chain Business Analyst
Description: TOOLSGROUP ToolsGroup is the worlds most experienced provider of market-driven demand analytics, inventory optimization and supply chain planning software.  Our solutions have been recognized by analyst firms such as Gartner and Nucleus research for their ability to support highly intelligent decision-making, combined with an ease-of-use that results in dramatically improved planning productivity. ToolsGroup has been successfully deployed for more than 300 customers worldwide in more than 44 countries, and we have one of the highest customer retention rates in our industry. Our experience includes manufacturers, wholesale distributors and retailers in a wide range of demand and inventory-driven industries.SUPPLY CHAIN BUSINESS ANALYSTExperiencing the fastest growth in our companys history, ToolsGroup, the global provider of Powerfully Simple" market-driven demand analytics and supply chain optimization software is seeking a Business Analyst with strong analytical skills to work with clients and team members to ensure clients achieve expected value from successful solution implementations.Working from our Boston headquarters, the mission of our Professional Services organization is to provide billable services that enhance the value of the ToolsGroup platform and enable even greater levels of customer adoption and value realization.As a member of this elite team, you will play a key role in all phases of our projects including identifying business requirements, requirements management, functional design, prototyping, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), testing, training, and supporting implementations.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESBe responsible for the creation and review of client deliverables. Participate in the all phases of implementation projects including requirements gathering, solution design, solution configuration, user training and testing. Participant and take a central role in the extraction, transformation, and loading of client supply chain source data to create planning models. Create supply chain models including forecasting and demand planning, inventory optimization and replenishment planning under the direction of a Senior Consultant or Solution Architect. Prepare and deliver User training using standard and client customized materials. Develop User Acceptance Test plans and support client users through the testing phase. Provide support through the go live and transition period to ensure smooth production start-up for the client.EXPERIENCE REQUIRED1-2 years of statistical modeling experience. A bachelors degree in a quantitative discipline (Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering) or relevant work experience. Demonstrated confidence and a business acumen. Knowledge and proficiency in SQL. A willingness to travel 30 - 50% of the time. Both The ability to work independently as well as in a team environment. The capacity for teamwork, analytical skills, creativity and willingness to acquire new skills. An advanced degree in Operations Research, Statistics, Math or an MBA. The skills to manage multiple tasks under competing deadlines. Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Office, including PowerPoint). Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment. Strong analytical skills. Knowledge of SQL Server or Oracle Database management.WHY TOOLSGROUP We are a team of people who are crazy about Supply Chain, Machine Learning and Success! We are driven to help our customers do: grow their businesses by making it possible and Powerfully Simple for them to use their data to meet the demands of their customers.  Working at ToolsGroup means youll work on things you never imagined you would; youll grow in ways you didnt consider possible; and youll do the best work of your career with people who are just as motivated and talented as you are. OUR CULTURE Our culture is all about Attitude, Aptitude, Accomplishment, Appreciation, and Adaptability. Groupies are upbeat, positive, might not have all the skills needed but have the ability to learn new things quickly; can show success with the skill set they already possess, show appreciation for their past experiences and use it to direct their future; and most importantly, the willingness to change to meet the ever-fluid needs of the company and our customers.OUR BENEFITS Our benefits don't stop with competitive salaries, 401K matching with immediate vesting, comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life/disability insurance. We also provide our employees with an annual performance bonus, commuter reimbursement, on-site fitness center, fancy coffee in tiny cups, lots of groupie grub, flexible work schedules and most importantly. the opportunity to surround yourself with the very best and brightest from around the globe. LOCATIONS Located in the heart of Boston, ToolsGroups North American headquarters is easily accessible by public transportation or on foot. We also have offices in Spain, Italy, Germany, and the Netherlands.

Name: Associate Analyst
Description: Title: Associate AnalystLocation: preferred Boston, New York, San Francisco 451 Research is a leading global analyst and data company focused on the business of enterprise IT innovation. We are seeking a curious, bright, analytic, and hardworking individual to fill the newly created Associate Analyst position that is both a qualitative and quantitative research role.  The selected candidate will be a part of our industry analyst team that provides actionable data and insights to our clients on software and technology topics including mobile, IoT, AI/ML, Digital Transformation, and Customer Experience. You will work directly with the Research Vice President shaping our coverage in these markets to analyze our survey data and write reports for our 451 Research clients. Person Profile We are looking to recruit an Associate Analyst with a good mix of data analytical, written, interpersonal skills. Top priority is the ability to analyze data and write clearly and succinctly. As an Associate Analyst, you will be expected to work diligently within a geographically dispersed, global team. Daily activity will involve reviewing results from surveys, participating in vendor briefings, helping with client inquiries and creating reports. Key skills include data analysis skills using spreadsheets, charting data in PowerPoint and writing advisory reports using insight from data. Responsibilities: Assist Research Vice President in analyzing data from surveys Write spotlights based on key insights from the data Respond to internal and external requests for additional data cuts and analysis Assist the Research Vice President in the research topics for Customer Experience and Commerce channelLearn and expand survey development skills to cover new topics and support new data productsRequirements: Bachelors in related field; or two years of experience Experience with the collection, analysis and synthesis of data Writing short content pieces of under 2,000 words Using PowerPoint to create client deliverables Using SPSS to run data analysis Strong analytical skills Keen attention to detail and a passion for accuracy Excellent communication and organizational skills Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Self-motivated with a willingness to learn

Name: Analyst

An analyst will gain exposure across a broad variety of paid, earned and owned channels, digital data sources, analytic techniques and marketing challenges. Aspiring candidates should have a passion for data-driven storytelling, and a desire to apply this practice in helping brands produce meaningful marketing results. Name: Product Analyst
Description: Fuze is a high-growth, venture-backed Boston-based company with more than 650 employees and worldwide operations which was recently named one of Inc Magazine's Best Places to Work for 2018. Our core values drive the way we conduct business every day and define our company culture. We're growing at lightning fast speed to meet the demands of the evolving Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) market and we are currently searching for a Product Analyst to join our team.  As a Product Analyst, you'll be a part of the Manager Experiences team which, among many things, is responsible for delivering products that enable our customer administrators and partners to deploy, manage, and report on their Fuze services. You will work with senior members of the product team to help drive key initiatives by researching new opportunities to invest in, developing requirements and designs for engineering, and creating enablement materials for stakeholders. You will report to the Director of Product.  This role offers a great opportunity to develop and hone your product management skills while contributing in a meaningful way to our Fuze product strategy. We are a small, nimble, and fast organization that's dedicated to empowering every product team member to be as successful as possible. What you get to do:Work with customers and cross-functional stakeholders to identify their business objectives, pain points, and ways to drive new value to themAnalyze trends and opportunities in the market from analyst materials, trade shows, competitive intel, internal data (e.g. win/loss reports, usage metrics), etc.Present research findings and recommend new product ideas to product leadershipCollaborate with the Design UI/UX team to conduct product user researchProvide requirements and designs to engineeringDevelop and deliver key product enablement documents including release notes, user guides, sales presentations, etc.Evangelize our experience portfolio internally and externallyWork with Marketing to communicate features and benefits of Fuze experiences to consumers and partnersWhat you'll need to be successful:Self-starter, leader and motivator with high energy levelBA/BS preferably in Business or Marketing2+ years of B2B work experience, preferably in Technology or SaaSExperience working cross-functionally with sales, marketing, operations, customer service, etc.Excellent organizational, presentation and writing skillsAbility to successfully interact across functions at all levels of the organization and with customersPropensity to question, explore, challenge, and buildData-driven, knows how to look at user data and metrics to make the best decisions for the product

Name: Data Movement Business Analyst
Description: The Data Movement Business Analyst, Sr works with both technical and business groups to support an enterprise-level focus on data movement. The individual is responsible for analyzing the business and technology environment to understand and monitor data movement in order to increase transparency on what data is moving, where data travels to/from, for what purpose and whether appropriate controls are in place. The Analyst will be responsible for evaluating current processes to determine opportunities for improvement and as well as develop new reporting processes. S/He will work with Controllers and other key stakeholders to develop a model on the “cost” of data movement. The Systems Business Analyst applies effective project management skills and works closely with PMO teams in the areas of project planning, execution and reporting. including: preparation of meeting agenda materials, presentations and written communicationsDevelop, maintain and promote adherence to best practices that support continued Program maturityReview and business and systems groups and conduct independent research to maintain an accurate current stae analysis of the data movement environment across all enterprise information assetsDevelop processes to lines of the “cost” to move dataAnalyze existing technology inventories and capabilities and research alternative technology solutions/workflow processes in order to drive discussions and make recommendations for risk mitigation solutionsAssist in prioritization activities by analyzing and documenting risk drivers and current state in order to support recommendations to senior business and systems leadersDefine and document business systems requirements for projects that support the Data Loss Prevention Program or other Enterprise Data activities as neededProvide oversight functions for professional services/consulting resources as required Qualifications : BA/BS degree and/or related work experience.8+ years of Business Analyst experience including writing business systems requirements, preferably at a financial services company.3+ years of project administration work and project planning/managementData Movement technologies experience a plus (FTP, eFax, SWIFT)Experience building new analytics and reporting processesProficiency with project methodologies and project administration practicesFamiliarity with budget planning and financial reporting/administrationAbility to analyze current workflows and identify opportunities for improvement.Knowledge of all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle.Familiarity with Systems presentations using software such as Microsoft PowerPoint.Ability to use standard desktop tools effectively (Lotus Notes, Microsoft Office). #LI-POSTWe are an equal opportunity employer and all Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Located in a city known for its rich technology and innovative leadership, our Boston Research Center sits adjacent to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). The center conducts research in computational reservoir modeling and nanotechnology and develops advanced materials science and separation technology systems. Basic Function Provide technical expertise to department on computer systems. Manage a high performance cluster and Linux-based workstations to support the development of numerical modeling software. Duties & ResponsibilitiesDevelop, or assist with the development of, solutions to operational problems and design/modify systems to improve department operationsCollaborate with researchers and ITD colleagues to identify clients software requirements, evaluate possible solutions, present recommendations, and implement the solutionsEnsure that applications are developed/deployed in a manner that is satisfactory to the clients and in compliance with architectural standards, established practices, and company policies and proceduresEnsure department data, computer hardware, and software are secured in accordance with corporate policyCreate and maintain documentation as appropriatePerform other duties as requiredEducation and ExperienceMust hold a degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering or closely related field with four (4) years experience in Systems Analysis, feasibility studies, or business systems development; exemplary candidates with less than four (4) years of professional experience may be consideredMust have demonstrated the ability to analyze and resolve problems efficientlyMust work well with people from many different disciplines and varying degrees of technical experienceMust be able to communicate and comprehend accurately, clearly and concisely in English at a level required to perform the job as outlined, have good interpersonal and communication skills, and be proficient technical writingMust possess good work habits, a strong work ethic, and be able to adhere to company work hours, policies, and standard business etiquetteNO THIRD PARTY CANDIDATES ACCEPTED

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Reporting to the Lead Business Analyst, the Business Analyst will play a key role in building out Bullhorn's internal business application ecosystem. You will consult with internal stakeholders across the company on business needs relating to Bullhorn's internal business applications. You will analyze various Bullhorn departments' business processes and requirements to deliver successful solutions. You will be involved in evaluating potential new solutions and fine-tuning existing ones. You will leverage your analytical skills and strong knowledge of Bullhorn's systems and processes to understand stakeholder requests and translate them into functional and technical requirements. You are flexible, collaborative, and a team player, and you are comfortable operating as a key liaison between stakeholders across the organization and the Bullhorn's Operations team.  As a Business Analyst, a typical day might include: Working with leaders from Sales, Marketing, Finance, Product, Support and Services to analyze their business and functional needsDocumenting the requirements and working with developers and subject matter experts to establish a technical solution for the stakeholder needs and help deliver it successfullyManaging expectations, proactively communicating any potential issues, and delivering great solutions across the organization. This job might be for you if: A Bachelor's degree, preferably in IS, MIS, Computer Science, or a related discipline2+ years' experience as a client- or stakeholder-facing analyst working through business needsDemonstrated experience in data science and analysisDemonstrated experience in Requirements Sourcing and Business Process AnalysisGood understanding of Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC)Ability to work on multiple projects working under tight timelinesExperience working with cross functional teams, leading and following as and when neededExcellent verbal and written communication skills, strong presentation skillsPassion/aptitude for problem solving and figuring out the right solution for a clientStrong customer focused attitudeBonus points for:Knowledge of cloud or working in a SaaS environmentExperience with or knowledge of cloud-based quote-to-cash systemsExperience with or knowledge of sales, customer service, and/or billing & accounting business processes Strong culture makes Bullhorn a great place to work! Weekly breakfasts and lunches, monthly social events, annual summer and holiday parties, and volunteering outings all add to Bullhorn's incredible office culture.  You might be a fit for Bullhorn if: You are energetic and enjoy working in a fast-paced environmentYou love working in an agile environment and can roll with the punchesYou take ownership of your work and continuously strive for improvement #LI-CR1SDL2017

Name: Key Account Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst is responsible for successfully managing the mutual goals of our client and ATG.ESSENTIALFUNCTIONS&RESPONSIBILITIES• Accountable to the successful execution of the Agreement and Service Level Agreement between ATG and our client.• Ensure that plan is developed, executed and maintained to a mutually agreed upon business plan and will thereafter meet and discuss the business plan on a quarterly basis, and make agreed-upon changes thereto.• Makes recommendations and supports to implement self-service travel technologies and to help reach our client’s adoption goals.• Act as implementation leader, collaborates and compiles necessary reports to provide updates and monitor success during new implementation of global accounts, implementation of new technologies including proprietary systems.• Review and assess policy compliance factors and traveler behavior; makes recommendations for improvement to policy and/or improvement to traveler behavior in adhering to the policy; suggestion of possible process orientations and/or technology applications to improve both.• Oversees the coordination and calibration of the ATG travel operation to client’s strategic initiative.• Ensure service level commitments are tracked and reported appropriately.• Ensure service level agreement is successful; manage Regional efforts to continue to adjust and calibrate the service level agreement based on client’s long-term initiatives and short-term activities.• Conduct an annual Structural Evolution process to ensure process and technology design continues to be in sync with client’s strategic initiatives/goals.• Evaluate and resolve issues that are escalated to second level. Track all issues to identify any service level concerns and/or trends. Manage Regional collaboration with operations staff to meet client’s needs.• Manage the Financial Pro Forma, ensuring its accuracy and personal delivery to client’s travel management. Support Regionals to deliver and review the Financial Pro Forma in person on a monthly basis to client’s travel management.• Ensure TS24/ATG Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity Plans are calibrated to client’s needs and requirements.• Develop and implement creative crisis management plans addressing industry changes or crisis developments.• Oversee and manage all deliverables specific to the Regionals: track and report on supplier performances, savings generated, track and report quarterly on travel policy non-compliance metrics to client’s travel management team, track and trend enterprise air travel patterns to assist with contract negotiations.• Prepare and gather data for RFP analysis.• Consult with client’s travel management regarding supplier trends, relationships and potential negotiations.• Identify areas in which ATG can continue to provide value to the client’s travel management initiatives.• Strategically manage central communication amongst the Travel Operations Team, client travel management and ATG; identify trends relating to the industry and keep abreast of changes, updates and communicate to Travel Operations Team and to our customer management.• Provide leadership and direction to the Travel Operations Team as it relates to the expectations of our client.• Display flexibility and teamwork assistance to achieve corporate objectives.• Special projects assigned by CEO or requested by our client.This is a Virtual Position

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Take a walk around our offices and you’ll see a dedicated group of professionals who care about improving health care. Our team thrives on collaboration and sharing ideas, whether in a cross-functional meeting or at one of our office events.  While we're diverse in our backgrounds and skills, we have much in common. A passion for our mission. A strong sense of integrity. A belief that we're making a positive impact and a commitment to having fun.  The Imprivata Information Technology team is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to become part of an exciting analytics team to support enterprise-wide analytics initiatives in Lexington, MA.  Reporting directly to the Manager, Business Applications & Business Intelligence, this individual will be responsible for bringing together various data sources of customer and product data to then analyze and present findings to the business. This role goes beyond simply building reports and dashboards, we want an individual that can help identify trends, gaps, and process improvements. We are looking for an individual that can help empower the business to make decisions with insightful analysis of data.  As a member of the analytics team, this person will work cross-functionally with all departments and levels of leadership to determine best practices and solutions for any current data quality issues. This person will play an integral role in developing data-driven business solutions using advanced analytical tools and techniques.  This person will be joining the current team of two, which is a high-energy group that often will need to work closely as a team to complete large initiatives. Looking for a fun and passionate person that is excited to help build out this new team. Duties and ResponsibilitiesPartner with IT architects to help define system architecture in support of data analysisWork with business teams to design and develop high performing data solutions, which include structured reporting, ad-hoc reporting and dashboard generationStays current with the needs and operations of the business; provides recommendations on the availability of existing reports and suggests opportunities to improve reporting solutionsRemains technically fluent with new and existing BI tools, process and development techniques. We highly encourage attending or leading user groups to help understand industry trends and opportunitiesActing as a subject matter expert of the organization’s BI software applications and toolsAssess new data sources (internal and external) as well as coming up with new metrics and KPIsHelp build and maintain data dictionaries that is consumable for end users as well as IT architectsHelp to assist end users to best leverage our portfolio of existing reports, dashboards and data analysis to avoid recreating existing assetsHelp to identify manual or ad-hoc processes that could be turned into standardized, reusable BI resources that encourage self-serviceQualificationsBA/BS degree in statistics, informatics or related field1-2 years of experience as a data analyst that interfaced with multiple departments within the businessWillingness to learn. Candidate should be comfortable tackling projects in areas with little familiarity. Might need to learn new tools, processes and metrics, and looking for people excited by the challengeThe ability to adapt to rapidly changing priorities in a positive mannerExpertise with data visualization tools (Einstein Analytics (Wave), Power BI, Tableau, etc.) and techniques. Previous experience with Salesforce Einstein Analytics (Wave) is highly desirablePrevious experience working with Salesforce and ERP data is desirableDeep expertise and passion working with data – all kinds, clean, dirty, unstructured, semi-structuredComfortable analyzing, summarizing and presenting complex data (qualitative and quantitative) in a clear and compelling mannerLooking for candidates comfortable in a visible role. You will be working across various departments of the business and have the ability to present and discuss your findingsA passion for problem-solving, comfort with ambiguity and creativityAbout Imprivata:Imprivata, the healthcare IT security company, provides healthcare organizations globally with a security and identity platform that delivers ubiquitous access, positive identity management, and multifactor authentication. Imprivata was launched in 2002 with the goal of making it easier for clinicians to access health information. Today, over 6 million clinicians around the world use Imprivata for secure and convenient access. We enable healthcare securely by establishing trust between people, technology, and information to address critical compliance and security challenges while improving productivity and the patient experience.  At Imprivata, we have a top notch work environment, developmental opportunities, a competitive total rewards package, and the desire to have fun. If you have the skills and qualifications as we have described above, we want to hear from you!  Imprivata provides equal employment opportunities to minorities, females, veterans, and disabled individuals, as well as other protected groups.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Enel X, a leading provider of technology-based energy management solutions, has an immediate need for a Business Analyst to join our product management team.  This position reports to the Manager of Product Management. The Business Analyst is accountable for ensuring that the team delivers value to Enel Xs customer base. The Business Analyst turns the Product Managers roadmap into small incremental deliverables and releases, and is responsible for all artifacts and work lists to that end. The Business Analyst prioritizes those work lists (product backlog), and ensures that the Scrum Teams understands the work.  At Enel X North America, we understand that todays energy consumers face an equal amount of opportunity and uncertainty. The emergence of new technologies, regulations, and market dynamics have blurred the lines between energy consumers and producers, creating a New Power Economy that puts large energy users in an unprecedented position to create value. At the same time, the complexity and pace of innovation in this market make it difficult for businesses to navigate their options and capitalize on their biggest opportunities. Required Qualifications:Experience in software product management preferred and/or relevant experience within the product development life cycle2 to 5 years of energy industry experience preferredKnowledge and experience with data visualization, analysis, data mining and data collection/processing a plusWorking knowledge of API ecosystems, management and subscription model concepts a plusBusiness acumen, leadership potential, and the ability to drive tough decisionsExperience with Agile/Scrum and other software development methodsAbility to work in a fast paced exciting environmentBachelors degree or equivalent; MBA with Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Math, Science, Economics or related field preferredCreativity and a sense of humor a mustKey Responsibilities:Understand Enel Xs offerings and how they can be applied to address specific customer needsWork with a team of Developers, Test Case Writers, Quality Assurance Analysts, Project Managers, UX Designers, and Business Units to develop new productsWork with Product Managers to translate market requirements in the form of epics, user stories and acceptance criteria and communicate them effectively to the engineering teamsCreate plans to assure internal and external readiness for new product and feather releasesWork directly with our engineering teams and represent the voice of customer in the development processEnsures that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the Scrum Team will work on nextDevelops written acceptance tests and acceptance criteria, reports findings, and helps problem-solving in instances where acceptance criteria are not metCommunicate and receive feedback from key stakeholders-including Sales, marketing, client services, product management, clients, and prospective clientsMonitor the design and development of the new product to ensure that it continues to meet the specification

Name: Business Systems Analyst

Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: Job Title Senior IT Business Analyst  08-Nov-2018 Requisition ID21869BRBusiness UnitCORJob Description Exciting opportunities exist within CDM Smith's Business Technology organization for highly motivated and dynamic minded individuals. Ground-breaking innovation and a pioneering spirit are driving a number of cloud-based automation and virtualization projects that are transforming our technology landscape.  Under general supervision, the Senior IT Business Analyst designs, develops and implements basic to moderately complex Information Technology (IT) business systems. Provides user and application support for escalated IT issues.  As a member of the Business Technology – Project Management Office, you would contribute to CDM Smith's mission by: IT Architecture Projects: Under light supervision, plans, designs, develops and implements basic to highly complex single unit and firm-wide IT architecture projects. Executes project tasks against an established project schedule, reviews ongoing project status with IT management and identifies unexpected key events. Maintains client relationships. Business Support: Provides user and application support of escalated IT issues as defined by the group’s incident and prioritization processes. Business Analysis and Requirements Gathering: Performs requirements gathering, system design, prototyping, system integration testing, system installation and deployment of business system(s) Specializes in a specific, large program/system or provides general support for a wide variety of programs/systems, if required. Technical Guidance: Provides technical guidance and training to more junior staff. Mentors more junior staff and develops them for future growth within the discipline and firm. May supervise the work of junior staff on project work. Provide advice in area of expertise outside of the business analysis group.  Performs other duties as required. GroupCORCDM Smith Employment Type Regular Minimum Qualifications Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Information Systems.  Experience: 5 years of related experience. Environmental Factors: Daily exposure to computer screens for extended periods of time. EEO Statement We attract the best people in the industry, supporting their efforts to learn and grow. We strive to create a challenging and progressive work environment. We provide career opportunities that span a variety of disciplines and geographic locations, with projects that our employees plan, design, build and operate—as diverse as the needs of our clients. CDM Smith is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Why CDM Smith? CDM Smith provides lasting and integrated solutions in water, environment, transportation, energy and facilities to public and private clients worldwide. As a full-service consulting, engineering, construction, and operations firm, we deliver exceptional client service, quality results and enduring value across the entire project life cycle. Name: Business Systems Analyst (ERP)
Description: About the Client: Our client is one of the world’s leading multi-asset alternative investment firms in Boston.They are looking for a Business Systems Analyst with ERP project experience to join them for a full time role. Job Description: The Business Systems Analyst will be involved with technology related initiatives across Corporate Finance, Human Resources, Compliance/Legal, Corporate Communications, etc. You will be involved with documenting business processes, requirements gathering & analysis, developing functional & technical specifications, facilitating system & user acceptance testing, and liaising with functional business users and technical development and testing staff. You will provide ongoing evaluations of technology solutions and capabilities to ensure alignment with business objectives. Identify areas of risk, while monitoring the current environment, potential improvement areas, and the financial implications of those decisions. Gather, validate, document, and facilitate implementation of business requirements for technology initiatives (includes business/data requirements, data flows, data modeling, workflow context and design, and user interface designs). Participate in user acceptance testing and support system training / documentation. Responsible for project leadership and project reporting standards. Form strong working relationships with internal users - both business and technical. Ability to balance responsibilities related to production support and project tasks simultaneously. Name: Workday Business Systems Analyst

Name: Business Analyst- Process Documentation
Description: DescriptionBusiness Analyst- Process Documentation?  3 Month Contract  Boston, MAOverview: The purpose for this work is to document the data sources, processes, tools / systems and other key information related to managing the data that is used for sales channel reporting and wholesaler compensation. Very little formal documentation exists today and most of the knowledge expertise is in the heads of our subject matter experts.  Subject matter experts will provide the information and content to the contractor through various forms (verbal, written documents etc.) who will then create cohesive process documentation consistent with our requirements.  We have a hard deadline to complete this work by November 30th.  The position is responsible for documenting key data management processes, including written narrative, process flow charts, description of risks and controls etc.  Advanced documentation skills are required. Experience with audit and / or SOX controls also important. Will need to be able to interview team subject matter experts and write a process narrative / document. Documentation Requirements:The overarching goal of documentation is to mitigate risk in the event an employee leaves.Describe key steps of the processCover process holistically from inputs to outputsLeverage flow charts or other visual aids to support the narrativeDescribe key risks at each of the process stepsDescribe key controls in place to mitigate those risksWritten at a level of detail that a VP level leader of the group could followWe do not expect step by step desk top procedures outlining in grave detail steps 1 -1,000. We intend to update/ refresh the documentation annually so there needs to be a balance.Required Skill Set: (Possible Title: Business Process Business Analyst)Seeking person with skills and ability to interview the business SME to understand the business process objective, approvals, oversight, controls and opportunities.Seeking person to create a process flow of the day to day operations based on the interview showing all inputs, outputs, handoffs, approvals, security, and decisions.Seeking a person with skills and ability to draft a process narrative of the day to day operations based on the interview walking the reader through the process flow documenting the step by step activity focusing on the controls of the inputs, outputs, handoffs, approvals and decisions.Process documentation specialist.Experience working with technical / data processes #KRT#Low  #LI-RT1Horizontal Integration is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. e-commerce, retail and distribution, high-tech and industrial companies.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Work with internal and client technical teams to create technical specifications Design, develop, and deploy decision support applications Maintain and support business-critical BI platforms Create tools to store data (e.g. OLAP cubes) Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting Evaluate and improve existing BI systems Collaborate with teams to integrate systems Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses Create visualizations and reports Develop and update technical documentation valueEXPERIENCE REQUIRED Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline 3-5 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Developer dimensional modeling) and data mining In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) frameworks Familiarity with BI Name: ServiceNow Business Systems Analyst
Description: ServiceNow Business Systems AnalystCambridge, Massachusetts - Posted on November 29, 2018Published By Amy JaimesServiceNow Business Systems Analyst needed in Cambridge, MA. Job DescriptionThis individual will work closely with business partners in the CLIENT’s community and analysts and engineers in Information Systems & Technology (IS&T) on the analysis, design, configuration, and support of digital business process implementations in the ServiceNow platform. At CLIENT, the ServiceNow platform is broadly used in IT Service Management and several other key business areas outside of IT. Projects for this role will focus on end-user and community facing functionality, so a breadth of experience covering the basics of a design-centric approach and developing an effective user experience, especially in ServiceNow’s Service Portal application using modern web frameworks, will be an important success factor. In addition to the essential functions itemized below, this role will focus on designing, implementing, and enhancing business solutions in the ServiceNow platform with a focus on IT service management and service delivery, but with the ability to incorporate non-IT business areas and processes for business partners in the CLIENT community for whom ServiceNow is determined to be an effective solution. We are looking for an individual with both a strong general business systems analyst skillset and the experience and ability to apply and further develop deep expertise in the ServiceNow platform. Qualifications• Minimum 5 years of relevant experience. • Working knowledge of ServiceNow, IT and non-IT service delivery business operations, systems requirements, and IT processes and technologies required. • Working proficiency with one or more coding languages and system configuration; specifically, experience in the following or a demonstrated ability to quickly learn the following is strongly preferred: -Working proficiency and recent experience in JavaScript, especially in the context of the ServiceNow platform. -Working proficiency in Bootstrap 3 and AngularJS 1.5 web frameworks. -Expertise in HTML and CSS, especially in the context of developing customer-facing experiences in ServiceNow’s Service Portal framework. -Experience with, or ability to quickly come up to speed in ServiceNow configuration, administration, change and application packaging. • Working proficiency in business analysis and systems design principles and best practices. • Familiarity with fundamentals of effective project management and ability to directly manage small to medium projects as part of BSA and ServiceNow implementation role. Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: About the Technical Business Analyst Position The Technical Business Analyst role is a highly collaborative position with insight into and collaboration with all roles within the organization. This position serves as a primary facilitator for cross-team communication and collaboration. The Technical Business Analyst must familiarize him/herself with scope, objectives and architecture of each project to gain a cohesive, detailed and accurate understanding. Technical Business Analysts must have focused attention to detail and must work well in teams or on solo tasks.  The Technical Business Analysts primary responsibility is gathering and analyzing detailed functional requirements. As a result the Technical Business Analyst will produce functional specifications for client approval that clearly denote scope and requirements to aid user interface, engineering, and quality analysis teams in project development. The Technical Business Analyst owns/organizes all project-related documentation. The Technical Business Analyst is responsible for answering scope and functionality related questions, as well as to provide oversight to the successful completion of the project.Approximately less than 20% travel required per year.Responsibilities Documentation Follow a repeatable methodology to successfully develop applications on time and on budget using the latest web technologies and build applications according to best practice standards.Work alongside Team leads to develop necessary Technical Architecture and make key technology decisions to make individual projects successful.Stay apprised of the latest technologies and innovations in web application technologies (in general) and ASP.NET (in particular).Actively participate in the project planning process and bring that background knowledge back to the engineering implementation team.Enhance development standards and introduce new technologies to maximize efficiency and turnaround within the Engineering department.Work very closely with Team leads to maintain the highest possible level of communication surrounding the engineering and the project development process.Communication/Collaboration Facilitating cross-department communication is key to this role.The Technical Business Analyst leads project handoff and retrospective meetings with members of the Engineering, Quality Analysis, Project Management and Creative teams. Will be responsible for capturing & following-up on any action/blocking items.The Technical Business Analyst will be the main information resource for project functionality and scope specific questions.Must be able to effectively communicate and document complex user interaction scenarios.The Technical Business Analyst is client facing role. Frequent communication with the client is necessary for gathering requirements and making recommendations. Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY Working under direct supervision, provides routine day-to-day operations and administrative support for a business unit or large department. Assists in coordination of budget, process improvement, controls for specialized software and other functions enabling the department to meet objectives in an effective and efficient manner. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Analyzes monthly department budget reports to maintain expense controls. Prepares commentary and explanation of variances for management review.  Assists in systems administration for specialized software utilized by the business group to support its operations. Researches and resolves routine support issues. Follows-up to ensure open issues are resolved. Assists in preparing user reference material.  Troubleshoots and resolves simple inquiries and requests from internal and external clients.  Reviews and monitors department processes and procedures to identify opportunities to improve service delivery to internal and external customers. May network with external contacts to research and recommend best practices.  Coordinates budget preparation. Researches and collects input from multiple internal and external resources.  Compiles a variety of operating, financial and statistical information as needed to respond to management requests. Coordinates work with other departments. May add commentary to complete analysis reports and proposals.  Assists in communication of best practices, policies, procedures and initiatives to support operations. Helps to facilitate process improvement by engaging appropriate resources in issue identification and resolution.  Assists in developing project plans and costs, including personnel and fiscal requirements to achieve defined objectives. May provide periodic updates relative to project resource and fiscal plans.  Performs other duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May lead project teams and/or plan, and supervise assignments of lower level employees.QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE Bachelor's Degree (BA/BS) or equivalent from four year college or university plus a minimum of two years related work experience to include budgeting, finance and or business analytics; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Work experience related to specific department or business unit function preferred. CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES None COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills. OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite. Spreadsheet skill set to include advanced functions such as graphics, pivot tables. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Name: Private Markets Fund Analyst – US Buyouts & Growth Equity (Location: Norwalk, CT)

We conduct a broad range of research, consulting, and implementation support services across alternatives, encompassing Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Private Credit, Real Assets, Real Estate, and Dynamic Beta (alternative risk premia). Albourne was founded in London in 1994, and now has 11 offices worldwide. We are defined by our independence, by our fixed-fee pricing model, and by our non-discretionary stance.The Role:We are looking for a sharp, talented and energetic analyst to join our Private Markets team covering US Buyouts and Growth Equity Strategy in our Norwalk, CT office. upkeep.Responsibilities:Fund Investment Due DiligenceThe Fund investment due diligence process includes the initial screening of investment managers; participating in meetings with the managers; diligence reportsProvide ongoing monitoring of funds in client portfolios or on fund lists in the given strategy to ensure accuracy of existing research and ratingsTo the extent possible help build relationships between Albourne, the client and covered managers to assist with client access to fundsStrategy AnalysisProduce up-to-date and accurate Forward Calendar for the assigned strategyProduce strategy forecasting for assigned strategies within Private MarketsProduce and maintain asset class/industry research outlining the key attributes, trends and drivers of a given strategyIdentify and recommend any additional tools or analytics which will enhance the overall accuracy of our researchAdditional ResponsibilitiesEnsure internal database is maintained with up-to-date informationMeet deadlines set by management and clientsParticipate in weekly internal group callsSupport business development activities, including involvement in client marketing and portfolio construction as neededCommunicate with clients as requiredAny other ad hoc projects as assignedWhat we’re looking for:University graduate or equivalent with 1 – 3 years’ experience.Excellent written and oral communication skillsRelevant work experience with knowledge or experience of private markets preferred but not requiredProactive self-starter, proficient time management and multi-taskingProfessional demeanor and strong interpersonal skillsSystems literacy (Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)Travel (frequent)(Optional) Possession of or advanced progression towards relevant professional qualifications (i.e. CFA, CAIA)Regulatory registration (dependent on regional requirements)Benefits & Perks:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits PackageFully paid Medical and Dental PPOFully paid Basic Life and AD&D401k & FSAEveryday Wellness, onsite weekly yoga, fitness and meditation30 days paid time off each year including Vacation and HolidaysBiennial International company retreat with Name: Business Analyst- Sales Ops
Description: *Business Analyst- Sales Ops***Preferred Qualifications** The Key Account Operations Analyst is a part of the Sales Operations organization supporting multiple Key Account VPs. This Key Account Operations Analyst drives programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's business, financial and tactical objectives. The role will work closely with Key Account VPs on a daily basis, acting as a trusted business advisor on all aspects of Key Accounts. Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 5 plus years relevant work experience. *Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.***Job:** Business Operations*Location:** US-TX,Texas-Austin*Other Locations:** US-VA,Virginia-Reston, US-CO,Colorado-Broomfield, US-MA,Mass-Burlington, US-CO,Colorado-Colorado Springs*Job Type:** Regular Employee Hire*Organization:** Oracle

Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: Duties & Responsibilities  Harvard Medical School Information Systems seeks a seasoned Senior Business Systems Analyst professional skilled in leading requirements elicitation, journey mapping, business process redesign, and user-centered design.  The Information Systems team is responsible for the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) from project inception through implementation through ongoing support of the Harvard Medical School systems that support core functions related (but not limited to) Human Resources, Finance, Research Administration, Facilities Management, and Faculty and Student Affairs.  The ideal candidate will be energized by solving problems in new and innovative ways. You are comfortable working in an ever-changing environment and have the ability to engage with stakeholders to identify minimal viable product for frequent delivery of new technology solutions.  Lead research, design, documentation, implementation, configuration, and validation of solutions to business needs. Solve large, highly complex and multi-faceted technical problems. Will manage multiple projects simultaneously  Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business needs into technology strategies, systems requirements and scoping of IT projects  Lead definition of system requirements, gap analysis, user journey mapping and identification of feasible alternative solutions that meet defined business objectives  Document and refine current state and future state system processes, design and review prototypes to meet key gaps and processes, and build support from technology stakeholders in solutions  Define Agile user stories that meet business requirements and application features, data conversion, systems integration, security, or customizations  Negotiate user story prioritization, sprint content and longer term plans collaboratively with the stakeholders and IT team to ensure effective delivery of IT projects  Advise unit/school to consider business implications of technology applications and the impact on current and future business environment. Recommend process, practice, or policy changes based on input from stakeholders, comprehension of the subject area, and awareness of current or new system’s potential capabilities  Responsible for business transition management to ensure that systems are understood and adopted by users. Develop training materials and work with change agents and trainers on training approach and delivery  Contribute to development of long term strategy, plans, and policies for a unit/school, assess technology investment options as they relate to budget planning and financial investments  Partners with HUIT, School officials, and internal IT as an application owner and/or project lead  Basic Qualifications  BS/BA degree required. 7+ years’ experience in defining requirements for desktop, mobile, or web-based software applications and relational databases  Experience working in a higher ed setting and/or familiarity with Oracle Financials, Peoplesoft HR, Student Information Systems  Familiarity with the agile methodology and experienced working with agile frameworks and tools  Troubleshooting skills, problem resolution, project management and technology evaluation to meet business requirements  Additional Qualifications  Demonstrated team performance delivering technology solutions with a service mindset approach and the ability to act as a trusted advisor  Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to solve complex issues  Strong ability to communicate both verbally and in writing with internal and external teams  Ability to prioritize and multitask, deadline and detail oriented  Strong detail, quality troubleshooting and solution orientation

Name: Business Analyst / 40 Hours / BWH/Pathology
Description: General Overview: The Financial Business Systems Analyst will serve as a staff member of the Pathology Administrative team, responsible for supporting daily processes including month end, quarter end and year end trended financial reports.  The position will be focus on financial analysis and reporting, working with large data sets and closely with local finance staff, to provide in-depth analysis of operating budget and operating performance for assigned areas.  Responsible for identifying, querying, analyzing, and presenting through reports and presentations, a variety of data to support quality and performance measurement initiatives throughout Brigham and Women's Pathology department. Principal Duties/Responsibilities:Gather, update, track and analyze data for department trend vendors analysis used for performance measurement . Work with Finance Manager in design, maintenance, data gathering from variety expense sources (Accounts Payable, ledger entries) and distribution of reports.Analyze, review, report and monitor budgeted variances for expenses, investigate differences and follow through whenever necessary. Review submitted data for accuracy and integrity; addressing discrepancies and adverse trends as necessary.Assist in the preparation of presentations by providing diverse financial data.Apply financial/accounting experience to ensure quality reporting are delivered and will cover department's need. Provide operational analysis and data Support. Effectively and accurately update, communicate and distribute relevant reports.Support the analytic needs of Pathology Administration especially in the areas of volume growth, expense reduction, increased operational efficiency.Work closely with the Finance Manager to develop tools for trend vendors analysis, reporting and monitoring expenses for all clinical lab budgets within the department of Pathology to track variances from budget plan around supply expenses, other expenses.Understand user requirements; translate them to functional requirements and assist end user with reporting.Assist in preparing and reporting of monthly and year end close activities, including analysis and distribution of monthly, quarterly and yearly financial reports to our lab departments.Develop, analyze and prepare regular and ad hoc operational reporting analyses and projects related to management inquiries.Assist the Finance Manager with financial or other data analysis related to efficiency enhancement or process improvement opportunities across the department, as requested.Assist local finance and operational clinical lab staff in the preparation of creating purchase orders as necessary, working with local finance and operational personnel to capture all necessary information and working with Partners Purchasing to comply with all policies.Maintain established department policies, procedures and objectives; identify ways for process improvements.Performs comprehensive quality assurance, ensuring that database and reports meet end user specifications and data are accurate and reliable.Perform data cleansing and data entry tasks as necessary to support data analysis and reporting.Create and run reports as needed.Complete other duties as required or directed.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, or technical discipline. Healthcare experience preferred.At least 2-3 years of experience, preferably in a related analytics position.Experience with PeopleSoft, Vision and Epic systems Reporting.Solid analytic skills, detail oriented with the ability to collect, compile/manipulate large data sets from multiple sources and interpret trended data.Proficient in MS Access and prior Database Access application development experience a plus.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint. SKILLS · Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.  · Experience in end user management, preferably in a healthcare setting.  · Ability to effectively translate business requirements to functional requirements.  · Must be detailed oriented and highly organized.  · Ability to work independently in a complex, fast-paced environment  · Self-motivated and resourceful attitude; proactive in identifying issues, prepared to address concerns/questions, makes recommendations.  · Ability to effectively respond to time sensitive issues and meet deadlines.  · Solid understanding of the health care environment.  · Ability to work effectively both individually and as a member of a team.  · Ability to prioritize and resolve critical issues efficiently and effectively. Working Conditions: Busy office environment with a large number of multiple projects needing to be completed, under tight deadlines. EEO Statement Brigham and Women's Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Name: Business / Data Analyst, Officer
Description: Enterprise Data Governance is a Corporate-wide initiative focused on the establishment of master data sets and on-going governance of data in our Platforms. The Enterprise Data Governance & Management (EDGM) team is looking for experienced people with skill sets that enable us to successfully deliver our many project objectives.  We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst / Data Analyst with an objective to assist with the continued implementation of a master data program for the organization with strong data management and governance practices.  The individual will be working collaboratively across the organization including business teams and IT to create and manage master data sets including the establishment of data standards, data models, data quality measures, metadata management, data integration with traceability, etc. Key roles and responsibilitiesAssist in the establishment of key data sets for the enterprise including reference data, customer data, contract data, legal entity data among other data setsUnderstand the business process flow and technical integration for each data set, detail requirements and perform data analysis to identify the data requirements and support the migration and implementationFacilitate the documentation required to operationalize the support and / or maintenance of master data sets post implementationEnsure data privacy and security needs are well defined and implemented and data access controls are in place for business useCollaborate with Data Governance and support their objectives with data architecture and delivery oversight and documentationAssist in the administration of the MDM and contract management governing bodies overseeing master data domains and sub-domainsAssist in the development of overall data strategy, data architecture, associated procedures and processes required to fulfill Global Process Owner responsibilitiesApply data management best practices across the end-to-end implementationRequirementsBachelor’s degree and relevant project, data / business analysis work experience (3-5 years, preferably)Reference data and/or entity data experience a plusAttention to detail and accuracy is essential and ability to prioritize in a dynamic environmentExcellent verbal, written, analysis and presentation skillsAdvanced proficiency with MS Office including Excel, Power Point, Word and MS AccessExperience with State Street applications is preferred , but not required

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: About Iron MountainFounded in 1951, Iron Mountain Incorporated (NYSE: IRM) is the global leader in storage and information management services. Iron Mountain is committed to storing, managing and transforming what our customers value most, from paper records to data to priceless works of art and culture. Providing a full suite of solutions – records and information management, data management, digital solutions, data centers and secure destruction – Iron Mountain enables organizations to lower storage costs, comply with regulations, recover from disaster, and protect their data and assets from a complex world. Visit the company website at www.ironmountain.com for more information. Iron Mountain enables 94% of the Fortune 1000 to smartly and securely manage their physical and digital information assets. With unmatched innovation and collaboration, our teams create information management solutions for our customers’ data, no matter what format, location or lifecycle stage it’s in and no matter where it’s kept. We are more than 17,000 people strong and growing. We’ve been a trusted records management leader since 1951. Iron Mountain is an equal opportunity employer, and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity characteristics or expression, disability, medical condition, U.S. Military or veteran status or other legally protected classifications in making employment decisions.  Iron Mountain Canada is an employer broadly committed to providing an inclusive work environment that welcomes all people. Globally, we believe it is our diversity that contributes to our companies’ shared success. We work hard always to avoid discriminating on any grounds other than capability to perform the requirements of the job.  Iron Mountain complies with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.Job DescriptionThe Senior Business Analyst serves as a subject matter expert on particular domains or target user functions, as well as appropriately engaging other subject matter experts internal and external to Iron Mountain. Key responsibilities include eliciting and documenting assumptions, requirements, business rules, and workflows; writing use cases; and tracking and resolving issues relative to specific new products or product features. The Senior Business Analyst generally contributes meaningfully on complex projects or leads the analysis effort for projects that are relatively self-contained. Name: Business Analyst 3-Ops
Description: **Business Analyst 3-Ops****Detailed Description and Job Requirements**Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. Attention to detail critical. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 5 plus years relevant work experience.**Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.****Job:** Business Operations**Location:** US-TX,Texas-Austin**Other Locations:** US-MA,Mass-Burlington, US-CA,California-Santa Monica, US-California**Job Type:** Regular Employee Hire**Organization:** Oracle

Name: Business Analyst (Finance)
Description: The Business Analyst (Finance) (Boston, MA) will report directly to the Technical Project Manager – Finance. They will work with Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, and other departments within Year Up to gather, analyze, and validate requirements and assist in reviewing, analyzing and evaluating business systems and user needs. They will work as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit and understand the structure, policies, and operations of an organization, and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.To be successful in this role, you will thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy leading efforts to improve the financial organization’s technical performance. You are someone who is skilled at anticipating the needs of others and proactively takes on new challenges to support business needs, with a continued focus on planning, documentation, analysis, and preparing for growth. As an ideal candidate for this position, you will have a technical background in Financial and Accounting systems, and strong communication and business analysis skills.  As part of their work, the Business Analyst (Finance) (Boston, MA) will also have the opportunity to interact with students as a mentor, group facilitator, and advocate, participating in Year Up’s mission.  We understand that people gain skills through a variety of professional, personal, educational, and volunteer experiences. We encourage candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications below. If you believe you have the transferable skills necessary to fulfill the responsibilities of this role, we encourage you to apply. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:Systems and StrategyCommunicate effectively with business partners in collaboration with IT Project Manager to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutionsWorks independently to document requirements, business processes, and data modelsWorks in collaboration with IT Project Manager to formulate recommendations to support project scope and objectives and ensure mutual expectations with business partnersCreate requirements, specifications, business processes, data mapping, and test cases related to proposed solution(s)Develop and partner with IT colleagues to develop complex functional requirements and system design specifications to enable integration and automation across platforms, including NetSuite, Salesforce and other systemsManage backlog of platform enhancements across Finance applicationsHelp drive business partner satisfaction by providing regular updates on active work, proactively identifying ways to improve services, and developing action plans needed to address improvement areasProvide Tier 1 support for various financial systems applications as needed; System administration is a portion of this roleTeamworkAssist the project team with platform release testing and application maintenance activitiesFacilitate periodic meetings with Finance platform support vendors including setting agendas, publishing support meeting minutes, and tracking of open vendor platform casesSite Team/Learning Community MemberServe as a coach/mentor for a small number of current studentsJoin and sometimes facilitate weekly group sessions with studentsParticipate in staff meetings and trainingsQUALIFICATIONS:2-4 years of experience with Financial Systems required2-4 years of Business Analysis experience preferredFamiliarity with Oracle NetSuite, Concur Expense, Invoice & Travel, and / or Adaptive Insights preferredFinancial system/application certification(s) a plusAbility to critically evaluate complex information gathered from multiple sources, create detailed specs from high-level information, abstract up from low-level information, and distinguish user requests from the underlying business needsExperience in enterprise-wide ERP and Financial requirements definition, management systems, and methodologiesExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a matrix organizationStrong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirementsFamiliarity with application programming, database and system designCommitment to continued professional development and growthComfort with change in a fast moving environmentA passion for working with urban young adults, an unshakable belief in their potential and a strong commitment to the mission of Year UpUnderstanding of the Opportunity Divide and its driversCommitment to diversity and inclusionCOMPENSATION & BENEFITS:Salary: Competitive and commensurate with education and experienceBenefits: Competitive package including 100% healthcare coverage, dental, and 401(k) matchVacation: Three weeks paid vacation in first year of employment; four weeks after initial yearProfessional development: Funds available to support staff in achieving career objectivesORGANIZATION DESCRIPTION: Year Up is an award-winning national 501(c)3 organization with a mission to close the Opportunity Divide by providing young adults ages 18-24 with the skills, experience, and support that will empower them to reach their potential through professional careers and higher education. Through a one-year intensive program, Year Up utilizes a high support, high expectations model that combines hands-on technical and professional skills, educational stipends, college-level coursework, and corporate internships at more than 250 top companies. Its holistic approach focuses on students' professional and personal development to place talented and motivated young adults on a viable path to economic self-sufficiency.  Year Up has served more than 19,500 young adults since its founding in 2000, and will serve more than 4,000 young adults in 2018 nationwide. Year Up currently serves 21 U.S. cities across 16 markets, including Arizona, Baltimore, Chicago, Dallas/Fort Worth, Greater Atlanta, Greater Boston, Greater Philadelphia, Jacksonville, Los Angeles, the National Capital Region, New York City, Providence, Puget Sound, San Francisco Bay Area, South Florida, and Wilmington.  Voted one of the Best Nonprofits to Work For in the country by The NonProfit Times for eight consecutive years, Year Up is a rewarding place to work. Our staff is passionate, supportive, mission-driven, and committed to positive change and continuous learning. We set high standards for both ourselves and our students, and live by a set of core values that reflect an unshakable belief in the talent and full potential of our young people. The work we do is life-changing, and we know that our team is the greatest asset in achieving our mission.  Year Up participates in E-Verify.  Please visit http://www.yearup.org/careers to learn more about working at Year Up, and to see a list of current opportunities. COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY: Year Up actively engages individuals from all backgrounds. We are committed to embracing diversity within our organization because we firmly believe that diverse employee teams help us to achieve our best organizational outcomes and provide the most effective support to our young adults as we work to close the Opportunity Divide. We are deeply dedicated to creating and maintaining an inclusive and supportive work environment. Learn more about our commitment to diversity:http://www.yearup.org/about-us/careers/commitment-to-diversity/ As an equal opportunity employer, Year Up is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified individuals and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information or characteristics, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Name: Business Analyst/Consultant
Description: Aras is an innovative, global software company that provides advanced Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software solutions to business customers worldwide including General Motors, Airbus, BMW, Microsoft, Gulfstream, Motorola, General Electric, Honda, and more.  We are looking for PLM Business Analyst / Consultant who will play a key role in successful customer deployments of internal business solutions. You will lead an implementation team in the planning, elaboration, design, construction and transition of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements.  Responsibilities  •Lead the analysis and documentation of business user requirements through the delivery of workshops, one-on-one discussions, and actual usage  •Document business requirements, user stories, use cases, and functional specifications and liaise with software development team to implement  •Transform business user requirements into technical solutions that satisfy the needs of users  •Utilize knowledge and experience by incorporating rapid implementation best practices in proposed solutions and deliverables  •Participate in the creation of project deliverables including both technical and business elements  •Assist project teams in other aspects of implementation including: solution configuration / tailoring, preparation / execution of testing and/or training, project management, etc.  •Position may involve project management, communications management, and production testing  Skills  •Professionally interact and communicate with business constituents and internal team members  •Clearly demonstrate the ability to work with minimal supervision  •Have a basic understanding of enterprise application deployment methodologies, preferable PLM applications  •Must be able to write clear, understandable Requirements, SOW’s, Specifications documents, and Use Cases.  •Technically self-sufficient; familiarity with Jira, Microsoft Visual Studio Team Services or similar is a plus  •Ability to execute utilizing Agile implementation methodologies  Experience/Education  •Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering  •Minimum of 5 years of software industry experience  •Experience with Agile frameworks such as SCRUM, SAFe, Feature-Drive Development, or Lean Development are a plus
