Name: Business Analyst-2
Description: As a Business Analyst within State Street Global Advisors OCIO Business, you will be responsible for building and delivering outstanding client service across the full lifecycle of an institutional client’s experience. You will also be part of and collaborate with a talented team responsible for handling the day-to-day needs of our clients. To be successful, you will need to develop an understanding of State Street Global Advisors investment and operational capabilities, the OCIO service offering, culture and vision in order to efficiently diagnose issues and solve problems that inevitably arise in the course of a client relationship. Due to the complex needs of our clients, you will need to build collaborative relationships across our sales, investment, product, marketing, operations, finance, legal, compliance and other internal teams critical to the end-to-end client lifecycle, from initial contact to on-boarding to (hopefully infrequent) off-boarding. You will also partner with your colleagues on client engagement initiatives to ensure global consistency and the successful implementation of newly developed engagement strategies and processes. In particular, you will be closely integrated with our OCIO Executives daily as they work to meet our clients’ objectives. These interactions take many forms, including participating in projects and strategic initiatives related to complex client deals and issues as well as broader, more thematic initiatives designed to continuously improve the overall experience clients have in working with State Street Global Advisors. This role will be located in either Boston, MA or Stamford, CT and is part of the OCIO Business.In this position you will be focused on the following:Construct and maintain account plans collectively with OCIO Executives and Client Engagement ManagerAttend client calls and/or meetings (as required)Attend all Client Panels and Investment Panels related to book of business managedClient Onboarding (Note: You will work in conjunction with the new implementation team on this)Client IMA/ SIP Amendments (Note: You will need to coordinate with OCIO Executive and Legal)Client Reporting:Performance validation & reportingAsset Allocation and attribution validationStatement of assets and changesRisk analysis (Note: work with Risk organization)Client commentary (Note: in partnership with OCIO Executive)Market commentary (Note: in partnership with Investment/ Markets team)Liability Analysis/ commentary (Note: in partnership with Strategy team)Other items as requiredAccount OpeningsTrade/Implementation Support: Client Audit SupportClient Invoicing, BillingClient Prospect Support (As required – To be scoped out)Reviewing 10Ks; 5500s; other publicly available dataAssist in maintaining Salesforce with updated information (e.g. next steps; key information/ contacts)Position Requirements:BS or BA required; MBA and/or CFA a plusMinimum 2-5 years of experience, preferably (but not required) at an OCIO firm, top-tier investment consultant and/or plan sponsor.Undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting, or another quantitative discipline (preferred, but not required).Basic familiarity with finance and investments, particularly with an institutional mindset.An interest in contributing to multiple segments of an institutional investment business.Analytical thinker with a self-starter mentality, strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.High attention to detail with a client-centric mentality and cognizant of deadlines.Competency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment where priorities can change regularly.Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Name: Business System Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce's client in Cambridge, Massachusetts (MA) is looking for a Business System Analyst to join their project. The nature of the work is focused on the company's computer and telephony technology tools used to create, store, exchange, and use all forms of information. Name: CRM Business Analyst
Description: As a member of the Information Services (IS) Team, and under the direction of the Business Systems Manager, the CRMBusiness Analyst will assess and capture requirements with internal customers, develop user stories, and work with external consultants in order to help deliver technology solutions that help the organization meet strategic and operational goals. This position will also act as a Project Manager effectively managing resources, schedules, and quality of deliverables through the full project life cycle.  The CRMBusiness Analyst is a key liaison between business users and IS Team members, helping to define and manage technology projects in terms of scope, time, budget, risk, resources, and customer satisfaction. The person in this role will be a leader in project management discipline, helping drive project management methodologies and practice through the IS Team. Additionally, this position will provide excellent technical support for all applications and processes assigned, becoming a Subject Matter Expert (SME). This is a hybrid role combining and technology business analysis, project management, and application support. ResponsibilitiesBusiness AnalystUnder the direction of the Business Systems Manager, works with business stakeholders to capture, organize, and document high-level business requirements and translate them into detailed functional requirementsWorks with the IS Team and external consulting resources to design, develop, and implement solutions and actionable development plansDrives projects end to end from creative concept through final implementation and deploymentDevelops a deep understanding of the technology business systems and processes integral to the businessWorks with business stakeholders and the IS Team to coordinate and manage application design, unit testing, user acceptance testing, QA, implementation, training, and supportProvides ongoing user support, including troubleshooting and resolution of issuesProject ManagementPartners with the business and IS Team members to create and structure a coherent and actionable delivery planMonitor and summarize progress of projects to ensure that projects remain on track and on budgetDevelops and maintains project resource plans and milestone schedules as the primary project scheduling liaison for internal and external resourcesPromotes common understanding of project timeliness, deadlines, milestones, and reporting in order to align project stakeholders and team membersManages project change control in terms of scope, schedule, costs, quality, and riskDevelops and promotes the use of Project Management tools, disciplines, and standards in the IS TeamMaintain timely and accurate project and technical documentationSkills and Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in CS, MIS, CISM, Information Technology, or related fieldMinimum of 2 years of experience: Working as a Business Analyst delivering solutions for Microsoft Dynamics CRM ANDWorking in Project Management, delivering projects for technologyFamiliarity with current Project Management Body Of Knowledge (PMBOK) standard methodologiesPrior experience should include: Gathering and documenting professional service project requirementsExperience with a SDLC (Assess, Design, Development, Test, Deploy)Experience with an Agile methodology is a plusProcess mapping/ process flow/ process modelingPMP certification is a plusExcellent organizational, time management and problem solving skills, with an emphasis on innovative and creative solutionsProfessional, self-starter, highly motivatedExcellent communication skillsStrong interpersonal, multitasking and relationship building skills that promote collaboration and positive, professional work environment At Bridgespan, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because we are passionate about helping our clients achieve breakthrough results. An organization that reflects the diversity of our clients and their beneficiaries will produce deeper relationships, engagement, and insights. Bridgespan is committed to providing equal opportunities. We serve diverse organizations, and are committed to non-discrimination. Bridgespan will not discriminate against any employee with respect to any term or condition of employment, including but not limited to less favorable treatment, exclusion from employment or employment opportunities (including hiring, assignment, performance assessment and promotion) on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, gender (including pregnancy), gender identity, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, expression, veteran’s status or other protected characteristics or status. We actively partner with organizations representing minority concerns and interests to build high-performing teams that mirror the communities we serve.  All company sponsored programs including training, job, social and recreational activities are required to be nondiscriminatory and all human resource practices are monitored to ensure equal opportunity.

Name: Business Analyst - Commercial Operations
Description: SHYFT was founded on a simple yet powerful idea – through powerful analytics find meaningful patterns in complex data that impacts and shapes the future of healthcare. Over the last decade our technology has played a critical part in changing how companies connect and visualize healthcare information. As a leader in this quickly evolving industry, a career at SHYFT offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing company.The Business Analyst role at SHYFT is a high growth potential role on the Commercial Sales team reporting directly to the VP of Commercial Operations. The Business Analyst will perform activities including Sales systems management, KPI reporting & analysis, and contract process management. The Business Analyst will provide analytical support on new business initiatives and special projects as assigned. The position is expected to understand financial principles and apply working knowledge of descriptive and predictive analytics.ResponsibiitiesMaintain and oversee CRM process and managementProvide high-level analytics to drive business thought and decision making.Support the design and management of business specific reporting.Govern cross-functional contract process workflow.Prepare weekly and monthly operational reporting, ensuring reporting data integrity and on-time delivery.Willingness to perform data collection and mining.Ability to learn and understand internal data systems for report and analysis generation.Work with other departments to identify and execute reporting needs.Document and improve existing processes.Support with other assignments and ad hoc analysis as assignedRequired3+ years of relevant work experience.4-year college degree required.SalesForce CRM experience required.Advanced skills with MS Office Suite.Experience with Business Intelligence tools.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Excellent problem diagnosis and analytical skills.Ability to be adaptable and flexible to changing priorities.Understands process improvement and focus on quality integration in process design.Programming language knowledge a plus.Masters degree a plus.BenefitsCompetitive compensationGenerous rewards programMedicalDentalUnlimited PTOHoliday payVision401KAD&D and Life InsuranceCompany Outings/Social EventsSHYFT Analytics is a full service solution company that delivers next-generation sales insights to the global life sciences industry. Our agile analytic solutions and services are re-defining the way commercial data drives brand performance. We are an innovation and service-driven organization with deep life sciences expertise, and our customers include large pharma, established and emerging biotech, and medical device companies. We are continually growing, and rewarding opportunities exist for exceptional individuals to join our high–quality team of experts.WE NOTE THAT THE ABOVE JOB POSTING IS NOT INTENDED TO BE A COMPREHENSIVE JOB DESCRIPTION. IT IS A BRIEF SUMMARY OF THE SALIENT FEATURES OF THE POSITION OFFERED. A COMPREHENSIVE JOB DESCRIPTION WILL BE PROVIDED SHOULD THE CANDIDATE RECEIVE A JOB OFFER FROM THE COMPANY.

Name: Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager

Name: Business Analyst - AVP
Description: Senior Business Analyst to lead the business analysis for new software initiatives. The candidate will be responsible for defining business/system requirements by facilitating user meetings and interviewing users, developing use cases, and researching and resolving issues. Candidate should have 6+ years of experience as a business analyst. The candidate MUST be able to complete the following job responsibilities: 1) Researching and gathering business/system requirements through the facilitation of end user meetings and user interviews 2) Analyzing current processes to identify gaps and improvement opportunities and solutions 3) Developing conceptual modeling and process workflows to illustrate current and future states (must be able to use Visio to produce process flows diagrams) 4) Developing detailed business and functional requirement documents 5) Developing UI design requirements 6) Decomposing abstract and complex details/concepts into business and functional requirements that can be understood by the stakeholders (i.e. end users, developers, testers, etc.) 7) Responsible for disseminating (verbal and written) subject matter knowledge, project details and concepts to various audiences and levels of management 8) Preparing end user documentation and facilitating end user training 9) Defining the business deployment strategy and facilitating the business deployments 10)Leading the end to end SDLC – this includes participating and directing as needed the entire project from initiation to implementation to ensure business objectives are met - this includes actively participating in technical design and architecture reviews and test case reviews, etc. Suitable candidate must have experience working as a business analyst on financial service applications that deal with transactional processing and reporting associated with front-end trading and middle/back office processes – knowledge of Custody/Market and Settlement processes is a must; Securities lending knowledge is plus but not required. Other skill sets include: - Knowledge of CUSIPs and common industry asset identifiers - Knowledge of depositories, custodians, and subcustodians. - Knowledge of market/settlement process concepts – Use of data query tools such as SQL is a must.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Customer Portfolios is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst (SBSA) to join our Boston, MA office. In this role, you will have the opportunity to be an integral part of the design and implementation of marketing database solutions for external clients. This position is responsible for acting as a liaison between clients, the Delivery team, Analytics and IT associates. The SBSA captures business requirement documents and provides guidance and technical documentation for all data processing and software solutions. This position also reviews and analyzes database solutions and is an integral part of project design and delivery. Key Responsibilities Client On-Boarding and Development: Lead planning, gathering and documentation of business requirements. This will involve both interfacing with clients as well as the development team. Guide peers to best possible solution, utilizing existing processes where possible.Consult with clients and Delivery team to identify current processes, clarify business objectives, and to establish technology requirements.Conduct initial data analysis on input files to verify content.Participate in system/database design or enhancement and communicate results effectively. Collaborate with Technical Lead on data model.Documentation will include: Technical Specs, Business Requirements, Process Flows, Change Requests, and Data Audit Reports.Become a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on your clients database. May be called on to answer questions and work on best practices for database builds as well as data usage.Prepare high-level system flow for the proposed solution and review with the Delivery team and client if necessary.Guide clients in business rule development. Implement business rules in database. Client Operations: Test, maintain, and monitor data and list prep processes for building and maintaining the client database.Perform high level quality assurance on data processing, data loads, reports etc.Support client in UAT process.Assist Project Manager to develop initial project plans and subsequent updates.Work with clients, Delivery team and all related IT departments to achieve solution-oriented results.Analyze client issues.Be proactive with the client guiding them to their next solution.For stabilized customer database implementations, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for ongoing minor change requests.Experience and Skills Required4 to 6 years experience in business systems analysis, process improvement, database development, data process engineering, CRM solutions, software development, or master data management.Ability to interface with both external and internal personnel at all levels.Direct marketing or prior experience in implementing marketing database solution a plus.Proven technical, analytical and problem solving skills.Strong project coordination skills and decision making skills.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Ability to write and use T-SQL, PL/SQL, etc.Knowledge of ETL tools.Experience in implementation of CRM solutions.Professional and interpersonal skills.Self-initiative and leadership skills.Ability to work within a team environment.Bachelors degree in a related field of study.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: About the Client: Our client is a leading private investment firm in Boston. They are currently seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst with strong data management background. This role will report in through the IT department so the candidate must have be a Business Systems Analyst in technology setting preferably in an investment management firm. They offer a competitive salary, bonus based on personal performance and profit sharing from day one of employment. This is a full time role and no sponsorship, transfers or C2C candidates can be considered. Job Description:As a Senior Business Systems Analyst you create business/data requirements, data flows, data modeling, workflow context, and user interface design by working with the business and technology count parts. You will participate in UAT and system support training. The successful candidate will have at least 4 years of experience with reporting, data visualization or analytics tools such as Tableau, Qlik or Cognos and prior experience with AWS or Azure data management would be a big plus. You should be familiar with and have used relational databases including reporting schemas, data transformations as well as SQL skills (reading and understanding). Prior experience with Salesforce or other CRM is a big plus. Knowledge of Private Equity systems is a plus. Qualifications:Master's Degree with a concentration in finance, technology preferred. Bachelor’s degree is required.4+ Years of experienceExperience with private equity, venture capital and alternatives investment / finance concepts / terminology and systems a plusKnowledge of data management and analytics is requiredHistory of developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures, and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines within an Agile environment.Please note that there will be no C2C, No sponsorship and no visa transfers considered for this role. Candidates must have a GC or be a US Citizen to be considered at this time. If you are interested in learning more about this client and opportunity please send your Word resume to afagin@daleyaa.com

Name: SAP FICO Business Analyst

HTC assists clients across multiple industry verticals, offering turnkey project lifecycle in, e-business, data warehousing, embedded systems, ECM, SCM, CRM, and ERP solutions. HTC Inc. offers ConnectIT, our Global Delivery Methodology that enables seamlessly delivery of outsourced IT services. HTC has global delivery centers across the globe. About the Job We are currently looking for SAP FICO Business Analyst . We will consider relocation for candidates with exceptional skills. U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. Project Details: SAP FICO Business Analyst to streamline business processes. Senior to expert level FI and CO functional experience. Advanced to senior level project management experience. Advanced to senior level logistics, warehouse, or transportation experience. Relevant degree or its foreign equivalent is required. EEO/M/F/V/H - provided by DiceSAP, FICO, General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Fixed Asset Accounting

Name: Senior Technical Business Analyst
Description: Senior Business AnalystOne of our clients is looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst. This person's focus will be on improving user experience for the Factset RMS system. If you are interested in this position and would like to be considered, please submit a copy of your resume today. Document business processes and translate business needs into technology requirements.Work with the team to evaluate solutions and make objective recommendations for process improvements.Collaborate with the support team to analyze and resolve production system issues, take on ad hoc user requests, analyze data and generate reports.Create and maintain a backlog of user requests and work with the team lead to prioritize work itemsQualifications5+ years of experience as a business analyst working in collaboration with software development in finance and investment domain.Excellent communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively in both formal and informal contexts in a fashion tailored for the audience.Ability to deliver under stress in a fast-paced environmentStrong process analysis and problem-solving skills.Able to work independently with minimal direction and guidance from manager.Practical understanding of relational database design and thorough familiarity with SQL server programming using T-SQL.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Take a walk around our offices and you’ll see a dedicated group of professionals who care about improving health care. Our team thrives on collaboration and sharing ideas, whether in a cross-functional meeting or at one of our office events.  While we're diverse in our backgrounds and skills, we have much in common. A passion for our mission. A strong sense of integrity. A belief that we're making a positive impact and a commitment to having fun.  The Imprivata Information Technology team is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to become part of an exciting analytics team to support enterprise-wide analytics initiatives in Lexington, MA.  Reporting directly to the Manager, Business Applications & Business Intelligence, this individual will be responsible for bringing together various data sources of customer and product data to then analyze and present findings to the business. This role goes beyond simply building reports and dashboards, we want an individual that can help identify trends, gaps, and process improvements. We are looking for an individual that can help empower the business to make decisions with insightful analysis of data.  As a member of the analytics team, this person will work cross-functionally with all departments and levels of leadership to determine best practices and solutions for any current data quality issues. This person will play an integral role in developing data-driven business solutions using advanced analytical tools and techniques.  This person will be joining the current team of two, which is a high-energy group that often will need to work closely as a team to complete large initiatives. Looking for a fun and passionate person that is excited to help build out this new team. Duties and ResponsibilitiesPartner with IT architects to help define system architecture in support of data analysisWork with business teams to design and develop high performing data solutions, which include structured reporting, ad-hoc reporting and dashboard generationStays current with the needs and operations of the business; provides recommendations on the availability of existing reports and suggests opportunities to improve reporting solutionsRemains technically fluent with new and existing BI tools, process and development techniques. We highly encourage attending or leading user groups to help understand industry trends and opportunitiesActing as a subject matter expert of the organization’s BI software applications and toolsAssess new data sources (internal and external) as well as coming up with new metrics and KPIsHelp build and maintain data dictionaries that is consumable for end users as well as IT architectsHelp to assist end users to best leverage our portfolio of existing reports, dashboards and data analysis to avoid recreating existing assetsHelp to identify manual or ad-hoc processes that could be turned into standardized, reusable BI resources that encourage self-serviceQualificationsBA/BS degree in statistics, informatics or related field1-2 years of experience as a data analyst that interfaced with multiple departments within the businessWillingness to learn. Candidate should be comfortable tackling projects in areas with little familiarity. Might need to learn new tools, processes and metrics, and looking for people excited by the challengeThe ability to adapt to rapidly changing priorities in a positive mannerExpertise with data visualization tools (Einstein Analytics (Wave), Power BI, Tableau, etc.) and techniques. Previous experience with Salesforce Einstein Analytics (Wave) is highly desirablePrevious experience working with Salesforce and ERP data is desirableDeep expertise and passion working with data – all kinds, clean, dirty, unstructured, semi-structuredComfortable analyzing, summarizing and presenting complex data (qualitative and quantitative) in a clear and compelling mannerLooking for candidates comfortable in a visible role. You will be working across various departments of the business and have the ability to present and discuss your findingsA passion for problem-solving, comfort with ambiguity and creativityAbout Imprivata:Imprivata, the healthcare IT security company, provides healthcare organizations globally with a security and identity platform that delivers ubiquitous access, positive identity management, and multifactor authentication. Imprivata was launched in 2002 with the goal of making it easier for clinicians to access health information. Today, over 6 million clinicians around the world use Imprivata for secure and convenient access. We enable healthcare securely by establishing trust between people, technology, and information to address critical compliance and security challenges while improving productivity and the patient experience.  At Imprivata, we have a top notch work environment, developmental opportunities, a competitive total rewards package, and the desire to have fun. If you have the skills and qualifications as we have described above, we want to hear from you!  Imprivata provides equal employment opportunities to minorities, females, veterans, and disabled individuals, as well as other protected groups.

Name: Associate - Finance & Business Operations
Description: The Team The Finance & Business Operations team serves as a Strategy and Finance partner for WeWorks on-the-ground Territory Leadership Team, which includes the General Manager, Sales Managers, and Directors of Operations spanning several major cities in the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic Territories. This team, which is based in Boston, also has the unique benefit of working across functions company-wide to coordinate local initiatives with global efforts. The Role The Finance & Business Operations Associate will report to the Senior Manager of Finance & Business Operations and will play an instrumental role in supporting strategic decision-making at the local level with data-driven insights, while helping to refine key business processes internally to help WeWork achieve sustainable growth and profitability at a scale few businesses have ever achieved. If a front-row seat in helping to drive a business at hyper growth and massive scale excites you, look no further and buckle up. Responsibilities: Strategy: Serve as a trusted, strategic finance partner to our leadership team in the areas of capital spend, ROI, operational efficiency, revenue growth, and profitability and help define and develop the regions 3-5 year operating plan.Analytics: Serve as the analytics hub of the Territory to advise leadership of the impact of business decisions and opportunities for financial improvement. You will collaborate across the organization, especially with our regional teams based in NYC, which includes analysts in real estate, sales, marketing, pricing, and operations.Planning: Serve as a key stakeholder in the development of the territorys annual operating plan, budgeting, forecasting, and review.Reporting: Provide visibility, governance and timely reporting of financials and key performance indicators (KPIs).Capital: Serve as a steward of capital by identifying opportunities to drive higher returns and ensure the consistent and universal application of strategic, ROI-based decision-making.Leadership: You will live the mission and values of WeWork at all time and model the leadership behaviors you expect to see in your territory.Scale: Identify and champion process improvements to ensure scalability of financial operationsQualifications: Bachelors Degree in Finance, Economics, or other quantitative field2-5 years of experience in a rigorous analytical role - defining analytical/ research projects, analyzing data, modeling, and generating practical insights and recommendations (Consulting, Investment Banking, or related experience at a high-growth company preferred)Highly-proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPointResourceful and relentless. Combines creativity, problem-solving skills, interpersonal skills, and a can-do attitude to seek information, corral resources, overcome obstacles and meet tight deadlinesHighly proficient in Excel; Workday financials and Essbase a plusExperience in (or a strong interest in learning) advanced analytics (DAX, Python, Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, Power Pivots) a mustValues: Inspired - We do what we love and are connected to something greater than ourselves.Entrepreneurial - We are creators, leaders, and self-starters. We try new things, we challenge convention, and were not afraid to fail.Tenacious - We never settle. We get shit done and we get it done well. Be persistent and knock down wallsliterally if you have to. You have our permission.Authentic - We are genuine to our brand, mission, and values. We're not perfect, and we don't pretend to be. We are always honest and as transparent as we can be.Grateful - We are grateful for each other, our members, and to be part of this movement. We don't take success for granted. Were happy to be alive.Together - We are in this together. This is a team effort. We always look out for one another. We have empathy, we know we're all human, and know we cant do any of this alone.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Alternate Locations: Boston, MA \(Massachusetts\); Greensboro, NC \(North Carolina\)  Relocation assistance is not available for this opportunity\.  Requisition \#57241 *About the Company** Lincoln Financial Group, a Fortune 250 company with over 10,000 employees, provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence\. Our core business areas ? Life Insurance, Annuities, Retirement Plan Services and Group Protection ? focus on supporting, preserving and enhancing over 17 million customer?s lifestyles and retirement outcomes\.  Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation \(NYSE: LNC\) and its affiliates\. The company had $253 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2017\.  Ranked one of the Best Large Employers in America by Forbes magazine, Lincoln Financial Group makes a serious investment in our employees? futures through a broad range of wealth accumulation and protection plans, health and wellness programs, and career development resources designed to help each individual reach their personal and professional goals\. *The Role** Join Lincoln?s Life Solutions? Business Intelligence team in leading innovation with business analytics, visualization/dashboarding, and data storytelling\. As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work with business partners to gather requirements, build dashboards, and perform analysis to derive insights that will enhance business decisions\. Additionally, this position will serve in a high\-profile role guiding users? growth in both self\-service environments and purpose\-driven dashboard design\. *Responsibilities** + Collaborate with the Life Solutions business partners and the broader analytics organization \(Advanced Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Governance\) to create value\-driven data insights aligned with the firm?s strategic priorities\.  + Design, build, test, and maintain stable and scalable semantic layers, dashboards, reports, and complex metrics to meet business needs by transforming data into meaningful information\.  + Identify and analyze complex developments, variances, and trends in financial and business operations then formulate and communicate recommendations to support business initiatives and management decisions\.  + Educate and mentor both team members and business partners on Business Intelligence concepts and best practices\.  + Maintain an understanding of how the data contained in various systems are utilized, and marry various aspects of the data into a usable format to support decision making\.  + Ensure data integrity within dashboards and reports, and develop procedures for increasing the quality and accuracy of information from multiple data sources\.  + Communicate \(verbal and written\) regularly with team members and business stakeholders to gather requirements and champion business analytics\.  + Identify and recommend process improvements that significantly reduce workloads or improve quality for assigned areas of responsibility\. *Education** + 4 Year Bachelor's degree or 4\+ years of equivalent work experience \(Required\) *Experience** + 3 \- 5\+ Years of data analytics and/or reporting experience that directly aligns with the responsibilities of this position\. \(Required\)  + Advanced business analysis skills and demonstrated experience in the use of data and its transformation into information\.  + Ability to evaluate trends in data by applying concepts such as probability, statistics, modeling, percentages, ratios, and proportions\.  + Ability to work with and rationalize variable data from multiple systems, including both relational databases and data warehouses, and generate competitive intelligence and knowledge for decision making\.  + Expert in Data Analytics software, preferably Tableau\.  + Demonstrated strong relationship management skills with internal clients \(e\.g\. management, peers, and colleagues\); proven ability to develop collaborative approaches\.  + Confident, comfortable communicator with strong written and verbal communication skills\.  + Demonstrated excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workload in a time\-sensitive environment and balance multiple projects while maintaining strict attention to detail\.  + Ability to work with others in a team environment\.  + Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite \(Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook\)\.  + Demonstrated ability to identify and recommend processes improvements\. \#LI\-CA1 This position may be subject to Lincoln?s Political Contribution Policy\. An offer of employment may be contingent upon disclosing to Lincoln the details of certain political contributions\. Lincoln may decline to extend an offer or terminate employment for this role if it determines political contributions made could have an adverse impact on Lincoln?s current or future business interests, misrepresentations were made, or for failure to fully disclose applicable political contributions and or fundraising activities\.  Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e\-mail accounts of employees of Lincoln Financial Group are considered property of Lincoln Financial Group and are not subject to payment of agency fees\.  Lincoln Financial Group \(?LFG?\) is an Equal Opportunity employer and, as such, is committed in policy and practice to recruit, hire, compensate, train and promote, in all job classifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex \(including pregnancy\), age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, veterans status, or genetic information\. Applicants are evaluated on the basis of job qualifications\. If you are a person with a disability that impedes your ability to express your interest for a position through our online application process, or require TTY/TDD assistance, contact us by calling 260\-455\-2558\.  Lincoln Financial Group ("LFG") is an Equal Opportunity employer and, as such, is committed in policy and practice to recruit, hire, compensate, train and promote, in all job classifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, veterans status, or genetic information. Opportunities throughout LFG are available to employees and applicants and are evaluated on the basis of job qualifications. We have a drug free work environment and we perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Name: Salesforce Sr. Business Analyst (remote
Description: Job DescriptionCompany Overview  7Summits is an Online Community Solutions Company driven to unleash people's potential to create, innovate and compete in entirely new ways. This grounding purpose has led the firm to create a suite of solutions, managed software products, and services focused on creating online community experiences that transform businesses. 7Summits is focused on the very forefront of the market we serve. We start with the best enterprise social technology platforms, create our own Managed Software Products on top of them, and then extend those with the specific modules to address the industry, business-process, and feature specific needs of our customers. This model provides our customers with enterprise-class solutions that can deliver measurable business value with great speed. Responsibilities Key responsibilities this role is expected to effectively demonstrate are as follows: Understand clients needs and translate into social business and digital solutions.Work with clients to identify, validate, and document business objectives through workshops, interviews and company research.Align client requirements to 7Summits products and platforms.Interpret business requirements to identify technology and operational implications.Provide best practice knowledge on business processes integrated with communities.Review, develop and execute plans to address user requirements, increase adoption and engagement on communities developed on Salesforce Community Cloud.Create business process flows, use cases, user stories, and test cases.Support senior strategist on sales calls, proposal development, and resource estimating.Assist in change management and community activation activities. Skills and Requirements  Basic skills and requirements needed to perform in this role are as follows: Bachelors degree in Business, Communications, Marketing, Technology (MIS) and/or equivalent work experience.5+ years experience in a Business Analyst or Strategy related role.Experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Community Cloud and/or Marketing Cloud.Experience leading projects in process improvement, change management, organizational transformation, requirements management, and/or facilitating workshops.Experience with agile development tools such as JIRA.Familiarity with data analysis tools and methodologies.Strong consulting, problem solving, and critical thinking skills.Collaborative and consultative work style.Strong written, verbal and presentation communication skills.Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint).Prior experience w/ Salesforce Community Cloud (preferred).Travel requirements are in the range of 10-50%.This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Company overview  We are a Boston-based investment manager that provides global and international equity investment strategies and fund products to institutional investors such as pension plans, endowments, foundations, and registered/unregistered commingled investment funds. We are a registered investment adviser with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), and a registered commodity trading advisor and commodity pool operator with the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC). Our firm manages over $95 billion for over 165 client relationships in North America, Europe and Australasia. Our offices are located at 200 Clarendon Street, Boston, Massachusetts.  The Investment Processes Team  The Investment Processes group is responsible for the automated processes used in investment decision-making and trading. Our systems are the backbone of our highly automated portfolio construction process. Our software generates our trading program. It assembles client data, holdings, benchmarks, and a security master, and feeds this information to portfolio construction algorithms. Our software provides tools for portfolio managers and other investment professionals to validate the data and implement the trading program.  The IPG is part of the investment team, and interacts directly with portfolio managers, traders, and client-facing investment professionals. We partner with the IT group to develop software solutions to business problems.  Typical responsibilities Work with portfolio managers and other investment professionals to identify deficiencies in our investment process and design improvements.Translate business requirements into functional specifications that can be given to software developers.Work with users of varying degrees of technical sophistication. Develop documentation, interfaces, and reports appropriate to the user.Become a trusted partner to the IT group. Provide guidance to developers and QA engineers.Play an active role in the design of automated systems. Use your experience and judgement to deliver robust solutions that will scale with our growing company.Pro-actively identify inefficiencies in our investment process, and initiate projects to address them.Qualifications A strong candidate will have these qualifications: A bachelor's degree in business, economics, computer science, or related concentration is required.3+ years experience in the investment management industry.A mindset that emphasizes automated solutions to investment problems. One of our goals is to shrink manual workflows as much as possible.Strong verbal and written communication skills are essential to be successful in this role. Communication with business users and IT professionals is a large part of this role.Strong organizational and documentation skills are required.Experience writing queries and analyzing data with SQL.Experience with a scripting language such as Python, or with a statistical computing environment such as Stata, R, or SAS. Qualified candidates should submit a resume to recruiter@arrowstreetcapital.com. Please include a cover letter detailing your short and long-term career goals and copies of transcripts. No telephone calls please. Arrowstreet Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Department: Investment Processes Location: Boston, MA

Name: GRC Business Solution Analyst
Description: The GRC Solution Analyst reports into the Business Controls organization and is responsible for supporting the implementation and maintenance of GRC solutions and functionality in support of the corporate Risk Excellence mandate. General Roles and ResponsibilitiesSupport the implementation of RSA’s Archer platform as a membership of the business solution ownership teamThis individual must be able to both work well with a group and also be able to work independently. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Overview  Mimecast is a global leader in cyber resilience for email, offering cloud services for email security, continuity and archiving. The Analytics team at Mimecast is an exciting blend of business, data, and technology. Using a high-powered technology stack that includes Tableau, Alteryx and Salesforce, the Analytics team designs and develops enterprise-wide reporting, visualization and analytic solutions. We turn raw data into actionable insight and enable our stakeholders to make smarter, data-driven decisions. This individual will be part of a fast-paced, team-centric environment committed to delivering strategic and operational insight to key business executives and decision makers across the organization.  The primary focus of this role with be to support the reporting and analytical needs of the Finance (Accounting, FP&A, IR) function at Mimecast. You'll work very closely with senior leadership across the Finance team to identify high priority, strategic needs, capture those needs as requirements and ultimately deliver effective solutions that drive efficiency and accurate forecasting. This role will require outstanding data analysis skills, a working knowledge of Finance and Accounting principles, strong business acumen, a great deal of self-sufficiency, excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively with co-workers across the US and around the world.  The ideal candidate is someone looking to make an impact, driving business decisions through data and analytics, based on detailed understanding and interpretation of business partners' pain points. You have the intellectual curiosity to gain a full understanding of Mimecast's business, along with the inner workings of the Global Finance organization. You will provide the analytical horsepower to tackle complex cross functional challenges by using advanced modeling and analytical skills, with the ability to convert data into action. With an absolute commitment to accuracy, you're comfortable working with datasets including Deferred Revenue, BVA, DSO, AR, and AP. ResponsibilitiesWorking closely with the FP&A and Accounting teams to help them analyze trends in our Financial data to drive efficiency and accurate forecastingPresentation of analytics to senior management, up to and including C-level executivesSupporting and automating external reporting and audit data requirementsOwnership of global commission calculation and forecastingWorking with the Finance function to surface the need for data-driven solutions, design those solutions through data, and support them from their genesis right through to launch and beyond.Working closely with our data warehouse team to precisely define data requirements to enable you to build the analytics and dashboards you've designed with your business partnersManage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, own deliverables end to end, and establish a consultative partnership with key stakeholders to achieve their goalsIdentify and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentationContinually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers.Qualifications Requirements for this position include strong expertise in requirements gathering, Financial concepts, database/systems, and project management. Qualified candidate must be able to deliver on multiple projects over multiple timelines in a fast-paced environment. Bachelor's degree; Master's is a plus5+ years of proven Business Analyst experience, ideally with background in supporting Finance teams3+ years report and dashboard development experience using Tableau (or similar BI tools)Outstanding Excel skillsExperience working directly with data engineers and developersStellar communication skills: You're articulate and concise both verbally and in writingAbility to work effectively in a highly demanding environment with multiple competing priorities both independently and as part of a team. You will be confident partnering with other departments, and leaders within the business to achieve your objectives. Reward  We offer a highly competitive rewards and benefits package including private healthcare, dental and life coverage. Mimecast is an entrepreneurial and high growth company which will provide the right candidate with a wealth of career development opportunities. All Mimecasters strive on being high performers, problem solvers, and team players with passion and integrity.  Mimecast is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status. EEO is the Law.SDL2017

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Application Instructions Qualified applicants should complete the online application and attach a resume and thoughtful cover letter in the \"Resume/CV\" field on the \"My Experience\" page in the application. Internal applicants should apply through cyresource. Position OverviewThe Business Systems Analyst will work with internal business owners to interpret and actualize continual process improvement requirements as they surface. This role coordinates department requests for functionality, typically obtained through deeper or broader implementation of the Enterprise Resource Planning systems. This person will be the key supporting member of the “go to” team for requirements post-deployment. Enterprise Resource Planning is the focal point for business process management generally and is the system of record for all Human Capital Management functionality as well as Finance and Accounting systems.  City Year Headquarters seeks a skilled, experienced, and well-organized Business Systems Analyst to provide ongoing support of enterprise resource planning systems here at City Year. We have chosen Workday as our solution. This role is pivotal to the successful rollout and adoption of software and other automation tools for operations. This position is part of a team of 7 Business Systems Managers and Analyst positions covering core systems deployed here; Constituent Relationship Management (CRM), Enterprise Content Management (SharePoint), our services layer (Schoolhouse), and our data management and integration work.Job DescriptionContribute to the user experience with Workday’s products, tools, and services in a way that results in high customer satisfaction.Work closely cross functionally to create schedule and deliverables by defining the scope, objectives, metrics, and plan for both business process improvements and specific projects.Support third party to drive solutions to business process issues and successful completion of specific projects.Manages the operational aspects of the application interfaces, user access, and application security.Effectively communicates relevant project information to business process owners and resolves issues in a timely fashion.Complies with and helps to enforce standard policies and data security procedures.Qualifications1+ years Human Resource, Payroll, or Financial software application experience.Experience with cloud solutions, data modeling, database concepts, and data management.Ability to communicate effectively both written and verbally.Preferred QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Information Systems.Ability to translate technical specifications into customer/business requirements.Experience in PeopleSoft, SAP, Oracle, SalesForce, NetSuite, Taleo, or other Enterprise Resource Planning systems.Experience troubleshooting and finding multiple solutions to a complex problem.Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment.Experience working within both a team environment and independently.Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.Ability to synthesize and interpret technical data.Compensation and Benefits Full time employees are entitled to compensation commensurate with experience. Benefits for full time employees include health insurance with Flexible Spending Account, paid vacation, holidays, parental leave, 401K, and more.  City Year is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse workforce. Individuals from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply, including persons with disabilities and veterans.

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Business Analysis The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for participating in all aspects of the SDLC as part of Kayem’s implementation of Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 R3. This individual will work closely with end users to document business and system requirements and create As-Is and To-Be BPMs of Kayem-specific business processes. They must have strong business to technology translation skills to be able to interpret stated requirements, perform fit gap analysis against a COTS solution and come up with the most ideal configurations to meet business needs. This individual will write business cases when recommending customizations and create design documents with screen mockups and detailed specifications for UI customizations, reports and integrations to other systems. The IT Business Analyst will author test plans, test scripts and training materials. They will be responsible for testing all configurations and customizations, documenting test results and working with developers to resolve bugs. The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for overseeing CRPs, training end users on new functionality, supporting Go Live efforts, and participating in post- go live activities including providing IT Help Desk support for end users and tracking defects & enhancement requests on Kayem’s SharePoint portal. This individual will be expected to perform tasks and drive them through to completion independently with minimal supervision. They will be expected to take full ownership of deliverables they are assigned to work on, becoming SMEs on both the business and the software, able to identify cross-functional impacts of requirements and design decisions. They should be results driven and highly analytical, with strong attention to detail, exceptional verbal and written communication skills and an ability to work effectively with a multitude of internal and external stakeholders. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Work closely with IT Project Manager, IT Department Staff, Subject Matter Experts and end users across the organization to implement Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 R3, and other systems as needed Elicit system requirements from SMEs, document requirements, perform fit gap analysis to identify areas for customization and maintain a traceability matrix throughout each phase of the project to ensure that all requirements are met Work with the project implementation team to document system and user interface requirements, data requirements and report requirements Create As-Is and To-Be BPMs using Visio Create comprehensive design documentation including OOTB configurations, customizations and integrations to other systems Write business cases and make presentations recommending system enhancements or other alternatives Assist in the configuration of AX Write test plans and test scripts; create test data, execute test scripts, document bugs, and work with developers to resolve issues Work with all members of the project implementation team to ensure that the acceptance criteria are met and the software meets project objectives and Kayem’s expectations as defined by the internal business units Play a primary role in CRP sessions, providing guidance and assistance to end users Write training materials and train end users on AX Play hands on role in Go Live efforts, jumping in and assisting the IT Project Manager, other IT department staff members and end users wherever needed Provide technical and analytical guidance to the project team Provide regular updates to the IT Project Manager on status of assigned tasks Assist IT Project Manager with implementation of detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans and status reports Run meetings independently; prepare meeting agendas, capture meeting minutes and action items Help identify issues and risks on the project and work with the IT Project Manager to develop & implement mitigation strategies and resolutions Assist IT Project Manager with tracking of project issues, action items and risks; documenting each one and its resolution Assist in the evaluation of CUs and KBs for MS Dynamics AX; review new functionality and impacts to existing functionality, making recommendations on what to implement Become a Subject Matter Expert, whose intersection of knowledge on both the business and the software make them a go-to person within the organization Provide IT Help Desk support for AX end users, tracking defects and enhancement requests on Kayem’s SharePoint portal Work with internal teams and end users to evaluate and select potential systems, develop and implement new systems or enhance existing systems. Build and maintain working relationships with internal and external parties including SMEs, end users, stake holders, implementation partner and ISV partners Work with various internal and external resources to resolve technical problems Act as a liaison between Kayem team members and implementation partner Act as an ambassador for AX to the organization, generating excitement around the benefits of the software to the end user, and helping to mitigate change management issues with each Go Live QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:  To perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily and with some direction. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be able to maintain confidentiality and work with all levels of employees in the organization  EDUCATION/or EXPERIENCE:  Bachelors Degree and at least 4 years related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience.  LANGUAGE SKILLS:  Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals or governmental regulations. Must possess the ability to write reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, employees, vendors and governmental agencies.  MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:  Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as commissions, ratios, proportions and percentages.  REASONING ABILITY:  Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.  COMPUTER SKILLS:  Must be proficient with Office and other MS applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project, SharePoint and Outlook. Snag It, or other screen mock-up / wireframe creation software skills are required. Must have general knowledge of and experience working with ERP applications. While Microsoft Dynamics AX experience is not required, it is strongly preferred. Candidates with AX 2012 R3 experience in advanced warehousing and manufacturing are encouraged to apply. Experience with SSRS Report design and creation, Atlas templates, Transform AP (TAP), VantagePoint EDI, Precision Forms, Arbela Security Manager (ASM), FullScope Catch Weight, NiceLabel, Print Suite Bridge and other ISV solutions desired. Must be able to perform research independently, utilizing appropriate online resources such as industry publications.  PHYSICAL DEMANDS:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and arms to handle documents and operate a computer keyboard and telephone. While the job normally requires sitting at a desk, frequent walking to other areas of the building for meetings will be required, as well as occasional visits to the production and warehouse floors. Occasional travel to Kayem’s Woburn, MA facility will also be required.

The team conducts regular reserve reviews; ensures adequate tools and methodologies are in place; provides internal/external audits support as well as reporting support under multiple regularly bases; and keeps management informed. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.Job: Analytics Primary Location: United States-Massachusetts-Boston Schedule: Full-time Salary: $75,000-$90,000 Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (±16 years) Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

Name: Senior Business Analyst - 157535
Description: Veritude is seeking a Senior Business Analyst for Fidelity Investments. This position is based in Boston, MA.  Fidelity Labs incubates internal startups—made up of product managers, designers, developers and marketers—that are tasked with creating new business that drive growth and deliver on Fidelity's mission. Our teams' passion combined with human-centered design and agile methodologies are responsible for driving industry transformation and customer impact at scale.The Expertise We’re Looking ForBachelor’s Degree and minimum 3 to 5 years’ experience working in an agile environment on business analysis, getting requirements documents to signoff, managing change, and working with QA to review test plans and test casesAbility to produce clear and concise business requirements, business process documents and support documentation using a flexible and adaptable approach, emphasizing creative/ innovative strategiesExperience with Lean Startup, Design Thinking, and Agile Methodologies and tools (Jira)The Purpose of Your RoleThe Senior Business Analyst (BA) role is a core team member at Fidelity Labs, working with Product Managers on one of our incubators for a particular new business opportunity. You will contribute to the project success by providing high quality analysis for a Fidelity Labs incubator, documenting business requirements, developing system requirements and/or process solutions to address business, technology and customer needs.  In this role, you will explore major market and technology themes to build product concepts that help us imagine the possibilities for the future of our business. You bring to the table a unique blend of business and technical savvy—big-picture vision with the drive and knowhow to make that vision a reality. A passion for FinTech and investing, and the ability to find innovative solutions for the broader market is essential.The Skills You BringCollaborate with stakeholders and technical resources to create user stories and translate those stories into features that can be built by the development teamCreate workflow diagrams to visually represent business processesIdentify problems in terms of business requirements and recommend modifications to the functional solution which could impact the system designParticipate in design sessions to translate customer needs into business requirements and anticipate use cases and user storiesSupport to test the process in order to ensure business needs are metAnalysis of research and data to derive insights and solutionsLeverage state of the art analytical tools and technology to proactively analyze data sets to support business decisions and optimize the operating environment.Provide insights to better understand trends in customer behavior and to provide recommendations to improve operational efficiencies.Maintain a process for design and content change controlDevelop a general documentation management process and guidelines for the teamCreation of process/data flow diagramsLeadership and high productivity in an agile project delivery environmentStrong consultative, listening, communications and analytical skillsCritical thinking with excellent judgement and initiativeExcellent written and verbal communication skills with business and technical team members across the organizationDiversity of functional business experiences (e.g. client, operational, systems, marketing, investments, customer service) ideally in a start-up or early stage venture environmentFinancial Services experience or experience in an industry that is complex, multi-channel and/or regulated; regardless of background passion for finance and investing a must The Value You DeliverA passion for products and for technology that cross the spectrum of desktop, web, mobile and more.A love of solving complex problems; comfort with not always knowing the answer, but knowing how to engage in a process to figure it out; love of innovating on processes and a belief that nothing is sacredAbility to analyze complex information and data, using the latest data analytics tools, and translate learnings and insights into actionable learnings for the rest of the teamSelf-starter with strong work ethic who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can set pace in a large organizationAbility to thrive in teams; highly inclusive and collaborativeComfort working in an undefined process or actionRelationship management with a skill at developing and maintaining strong relationships both inside and outside the organizations of which they are a partHighly resilient and optimistic mentality; ability to keep long term in mind and guide organization through short term obstacles; uses organizational complexity as leverage and not as an impediment Apply

Name: Business Analyst II or Senior Business Analyst, U.S. Analytics Data and Reporting

The team develop data and reporting capabilities that enable the effective monitoring of Business Lines KPIs. We closely partner with Profitability, State Mgmt., and Portfolio Mgmt. teams to ensure that our product offerings support growth and profitability goals.  As a Senior Business Analyst on Product Economics Data and Reporting team you will own the data assets and reporting dashboards for Business Lines Products. Primary focus is on the optimization of information flow, data architecture, and delivering business insights. Develop complex data automation as well as perform large data mining for relevant insights that can drive profitable growth in BI. To address the business priorities for your assigned toolkits, data assets, and processes, you will collaborate extensively with stakeholders and partner teams to ensure end-user requirements for reporting are satisfied across all users. You will design and build a robust library of flexible analytical tools and dashboards, retire low value reports, and consolidate redundancies. By leveraging technology SAS/SQL/VBA/Tableau/Essbase and best practices, you will standardize, automate, and institutionalize data and reporting solutions through a centralize distribution platform. Works with business leaders and end-users to understand the organizations reporting and data needs; participates in requirement and report design sessions with cross-functional teamsPartners with stakeholders on the design, development, testing, implementation, and evaluation of data assets and business process changes to improve business outcomes. Leads implementation and evaluation of business process changes or a portion of a larger initiative (e.g., major area within a function).Produce accurate, consistent and timely reporting by extracting information from various applications and systems, manipulating data and developing user friendly final outputs leveraging SAS, SQL, VBA, Excel, Tableau, MicroStrategy etc.Identify reporting processes that are inefficient and create/change processes that will lead to measurable gains in data quality and processing timeWork in partnership with other groups to develop automated reports in the most effective medium; Provide appropriate communication to stakeholders related to the teams work productLead cross functional analytical projects and manage life cycle of new analytics from assessment, initiation, development, staging, production, and institutionalization.Owns report development for reports/dashboards considered complex in nature. Develops, modifies, and distributes standard and ad hoc reports/dashboards to better understand the overall business performance.Receives, evaluates and responds to data-related inquiries by applying knowledge of data and business operations and obtaining information from various sources.Provides guidance to less experienced staff.Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in business, economics, or other quantitative field. Minimum 3 years, typically 5 years or more of relevant work experience. Must have good planning, organizational, analytical, decision making and communication skills. Strong business acumen. Experience with databases and the ability to manipulate and query large data sets required. Proficiency with SAS and/or SQL is strongly preferred. Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, VBA, Tableau or other business intelligence tools required. Benefits: We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. Name: System Analyst
Description: Hello Everyone, Please find the below Job Description and let me know youre interest. Job Role: Application System Analyst Location: Boston, MA. Duration: Long Term VISA: USC, GC The selected candidate must be comfortable with SDLC and Agile methodologies, be proficient with SQL, and be proficient with Microsoft Visio, Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with the GIRO HASTUS application is preferred but not required. Coding client, server, and web applications a plus but not required. The selected candidate will also assist in implementing and supporting future HASTUS related functionality, as appropriate. Minimum Requirements / Qualifications: A Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in Computer Science or related field. Three (3) years of experience in software application support. Experience in enterprise system and/or application administration Experience with application development, database design or database administration using Oracle or an equivalent enterprise-level database platform. Experience with Transit Service Planning / Transit Scheduling / Transit Daily Operations Management systems strongly preferred. Experience with HASTUS application suite (especially the Geo, vehicle, Crew, Bid, and daily modules) strongly preferred. Knowledge of GIS a plus. Ability to write SQL queries Advanced Excel skills This position will perform the following activities and examples, as well as other related tasks as the needs arise Duties & Responsibilities: Serve as SMEs for all technical aspects of the HASTUS application Interface with technical resources from the software vendor (GIRO, Inc.) Troubleshoot technical and functional issues with users Administer HASTUS User Permissions (new user establishment and user permission updates) Migrate data from lower regions to Production Release installations & promotion to Production Maintain existing technical specifications and help determine need for all change requests Create and Maintain HASTUS application support technical user documentation Manage and Maintain foundational HASTUS data elements/definitional items Create database snapshots / simulations for testing / training purposes Develop and Support of HASTUS OIGsIOIRsIControl Files for integrations Develop and Support of integrations using HASTUS Connect / Web Services I Batch Processing Gather/document business and functional requirements from business line stakeholder for monthly/quarterly application enhancements Maintain version control of schedules, HASTUS OIGsIOIRs/Control Files, reports & HASTUS data element Regards, Sai Deepika Talent Acquisition | Vuesol Technologies Inc. +1(678)568-2696 | deepika.s@vuesol.com - provided by DiceTransportation, Applications

Name: Business Analyst (Orthopedics)
Description: The Business Analyst will serve in a new position as the key support to the Administrative Director to help manage the departments clinical operations, finance, strategy, research, and personnel management. They will be responsible for many aspects of department management including preparation of spreadsheets, charts, correspondence, and onboarding, preparing documents, following up on meeting-generated tasks, contract management, budget review, and clinical process improvement projects. Works autonomously, sets priorities and makes independent decisions of a complex nature.*Serves as the key support for the Administrative Director of the Department of Orthopedics to ensure the department operates in an effective, efficient, and professional manner.  *Conducts complex data analysis to understand nature of department operations and identify opportunities for improvement.  *Oversees/coordinates specific and complex performance improvement related projects; provides leadership in project management; gathers deliverables from required constituents; tracks, analyzes, and makes recommendations or raises concerns on status reports, issue resolution, and program actual against project charter, budget, and/or plan.*Provides administrative support to the Department of Orthopedics including following up on meeting-generated tas  ks, preparing documents, spreadsheets and presentation slides.  Independently composes high level correspondence and documents with professional quality. Edits and proofreads written materials and verifies the validity of data for documents and reports prior to submission/distribution.  *Prepares meeting agenda; prepares and distributes information packages required for meetings. Takes and prepares minutes of meetings. Ensures that minutes and other written documents are professional and accurate.  *Deals discreetly with highly sensitive, confidential written, electronic, and oral communications concerning staff, department, and hospital matters. Exercises discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance to the department and the institution.  *Assists with monitoring budgets, analysis and account balances and helping managers to stay within approved budgets  *Provide support for M.Ds and/or senior management as necessary.  *Maximizes use of training resources to accelerate or advance ones own productivity and Identifies additional opportunity for improvement.  *Develops and documents competencies as related to position. Team Building and Participation *Adheres to department and hospital standards, including the following:  *Adapts to changes in the departmental needs including but not limited to: offering assistance to other team members, adjusting assignments, etc. Utilizes hospitals behavioral standards as the basis for decision making and to support the department and the hospitals mission and goals. Provide general clerical support including: filing, making appointments, photocopying, faxing, preparing and sending bulk mailings and express packages, coordinating conference calls, and maintaining contacts database.  *Promotes project team efforts and shares sense of purpose so that work is synchronized and concurrent, knowledge is shared, and seamless services are provided.  *Fosters an environment of camaraderie.  *Conforms to hospital standards of performance and conduct, including those pertaining to patient rights, so that the best possible customer service and patient care may be provided.  *Utilizes hospital's RESPECT values as the basis for decision-making and to facilitate the hospital mission.  *Follows established hospital infection control and safety procedures.  *Performs other duties as assigned or as necessary. *Must adhere to all of the principals of RESPECT
