This is a permanent opportunity with full-time benefits and a competitive perk package for the right candidate. As the client relations coordinator, it will be vital to be able to work various different departments and work as a liaison with high ranking company officials to ensure all client needs are serviced. The client relations coordinator will be reporting to the Relationship Manager overseeing a current team of 4 analysts. Name: Business Systems Analyst, Research Technology Solutions
Description: Join bluebird bio's enthusiastic and collaborative team by contributing to the overall success of our novel gene therapy approach. We are seeking a highly motivated individual with strong technical skills in implementing and supporting laboratory informatics systems in a biotech research and development environment. Reporting to the Director of IT R&D, this role will support R&D business units including, but not limited to, Quality Control, Process Development and Manufacturing Systems and Technology (MSAT.) Key tasks include investigating laboratory related business system requirements, identifying options for improving laboratory business systems, and meeting the needs of the business through the use of Information Technology solutions. You will act as a liaison among internal stakeholders across the science organization in order to understand the structure, processes, and operations of each group, and will recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its business goals. About the role:Partner closely with R&D, Process Dev, MSAT, and QC business stakeholders/users to elicit and understand their business processes and in turn analyze, document and translate them into requirements to drive the identification and selection of appropriate software vendors and solutionsWork in concert with the Sr. Information Systems Architect in the implementation of Lab Informatics related initiatives and projects.Manage initiative/project portfolio and meet regularly with Business Sponsor/Owner to review initiatives and their respective budget/timeline/resources for prioritization.Work with stakeholders to identify and engage potential vendors, drive the vendor selection process, and oversee the negotiation of contracts and statements of work.Implement projects in accordance with the IT System Development Lifecycle (SDLC).Develop project plans to allocate and manage the necessary resources for the successful implementation of appropriate solutions. Apply project management skills and employ the necessary tools to track project tasks and deliverables. Provide post-implementation support as required.Provide administration support of various solutions or platforms, including but not limited to various laboratory/research applications, LIMS, ELN, and SDMS.Work in concert with the business owners/business admins to actively manage and optimize solutions through their lifecycle, including changes, upgrades, and enhancements.About you:8-10 years of industry experience is requiredExperience in life sciences, biotech, and/or biopharma is highly desirable, including experience with IT and business operations solutions for nonclinical and translational R&D functions, project and portfolio management, and reporting.Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field; additional background in life sciences will be favorably consideredExperience supporting and implementing the following systems: Laboratory Information Systems (LIS) - experience with Sapio Exemplar a plus; SDMS experience with Waters Nugenesis a plusFamiliarity with GxP systems and CFR part 11 complianceStrong analytic thinking and problem solving skills, proven track record for tackling complex issues and problems, and ability to manage them to successful conclusionsStrong vendor management and project management skillsIndependently motivated, detail oriented, and good problem solving abilityExcellent organizational skills, capable of multi-tasking in an extremely fast-paced environment with changing prioritiesExcellent communication skills and ability to influence across multiple functionsAbility to work effectively in a collaborative team environment, where results are achieved through influence and the incorporation of multiple points of viewBe ready to embrace the principles of the bluebird bio culture: b colorful, b cooperative, and b yourself

Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Analyst, Sr., Business Intelligence  02-Aug-2018 Work Location Southborough GYR ACMI Inc Job Description Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? At Olympus, we help make people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling, every day. We’re currently looking for a Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst to join us in our Brooklyn Park, MN office. Let’s inspire healthier lives, together. The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is required to support Business Intelligence activities for OSTA (and globally as needed). The incumbent will support the OSTA sales analytics, managing global trends that affect the business, and supporting intelligence monitoring efforts. He/She will play a pivotal role in ensuring data is delivered in an accurate and user friendly mechanism to the user/requester and that it is later available to the OSTA and Olympus teams with a format that can be accessed and understood by individuals that did not conduct the research (summary of approach, all sources cited, assumptions, etc). The incumbent will also play a primary role to fulfill requests from assigned BU Strategy Committee. This is a new position and the result of his/her work will fill knowledge gaps for the BU, MBC’s and International SBCs. The incumbent will report to the Business Intelligence Manager and will be responsible for supporting research and analysis activities required for product development and launch activities, strategy development and lifecycle management. He/She will work together with the Upstream Leader to define the right customer input plan for each project or initiative requested and they will help the teams/requestors plan and budget for these activities. He/She will drive the outlining and fine tuning of the scope of work of all major customer input initiatives utilizing outside firms and provide direction for smaller scale activities as needed. The Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for all BI deliverables that are part of the new Business Requirements process with minimal support. In this position, the he/she will need to be a strong collaborator and make recommendations and drive research initiatives that help the business make strong, data-driven decisions. The incumbent should be able to review large amounts of data from primary and secondary sources and distill them into actionable insights. The Senior Analyst must Develop a very good understanding of the clinical usage, market needs, market trends, competitive forces and existing and future technologies for the clinical disciplines supported by the role. The incumbent will develop and maintain a deep understanding of tools and resources available to support global research, customer input and strategy development initiatives. He/She will work closely with Upstream Marketing, but also collaborate with Downstream Marketing, Global BI teams and other stakeholders as needed. Job Requirements:REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Marketing Research, Finance, Accounting, MIS, CIS, or related field is required.Minimum of 6 years of total business experience is required.Minimum of 3 years of proven experience in a research/market intelligence/Business Intelligence role within the Medical Device field is required; Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst is preferred.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence software platforms, e.g., Microstrategy.Proven Experience managing primary research projects, selecting & working with research agencies.Expert knowledge of Excel and other database management systems.Strong presentation skills.Ability to lead and report on all assignments.Significant ability to balance service aspects of role while simultaneously drive to self developed solutions.Strong command of the English language to proofread and write as needed.Ability to thrive as independent worker or in a team environment as a valued contributor or an influential leader.Expert knowledge of MS Office software applications, and proven experience building presentations tailored to different level audiences.Knowledge of Marketing Research principles with ability to become internal expert.Demonstrated writing and business correspondence skills, written and verbal.Strong analytical skills and ability to analyze spreadsheets and reports.Excellent spelling, grammar and proof-reading skills.Proven experience building market models at different stages of research projects.Project management skills and the ability to multitask with detailed follow-through on deadlines.Self-starter with a sense of ownership and urgency.Above-average creative problem solver.Good relationship building skills.Ability to learn and grasp medical procedures and related technologies.Flexible, team player.We realize work isn’t just a job to you. It’s a big part of your life, but not the only part. That’s why we offer competitive salaries, a robust 401(k) program, annual bonus program and comprehensive medical benefits, as well as tuition reimbursement, flexible schedules, parental and adoption leave, on-site services and Colleague Affinity Networks — so you can be ready for where life can take you. Company URL Olympus Surgical Technology America Auto req ID3998BR

Name: Budget Analyst
Description: The position reports to the Budget Director in the DAmore-McKim School of Business (DMSB). The incumbent is responsible for the management of a portfolio of DMSB expense budgets, including operational, grant, scholarship, and restricted accounts. The incumbent will monitor the development, analysis and usage of the operational budget; track transactions on all accounts; review and resolve budget related issues, maintain expense controls, review monthly expenditures and projections with various department heads, ensure appropriateness and accuracy of expenditures, and conform with College/University policy and procedures. The Budget analyst also acts as the gatekeeper for all DMSB contracts and creates related purchase orders.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Reporting & Business Intelligence
Description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.Job Description Reporting to the Director, Reporting and Business Intelligence, the Senior Business Analyst is responsible for providing analytical support, managing regular and ad hoc reporting and BI solutions, and providing insights and recommendations to the business. The Business Analyst will analyze complex problems, gather, transform, and explore data, visualize data using various BI tools, and effectively communicate analyses to various audiences. Be fully independent in reporting and data analytics.Support the transformation of legacy tabular reporting to strategic Business Intelligence reporting and analytical solutions.Innovate reporting and BI solutions to evolve our client service offering.Perform ad hoc reporting and BI analyses to support our Sales and Service organizations.Responsible for entering, refining and testing user stories for our Agile team.Discern trends and drive insight generation to support our product development and thought leadership initiatives.Ensure data and reporting is accurate and delivered in a timely manner.If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.  Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI) has an exciting opportunity for a junior to mid-level IT professional to join their Boston team as a Business Intelligence Engineer. The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of insurance experience and data warehousing skills to assist with the strategy and associated implementation of the global data warehouse as we are in the initial stages of defining and implementing a long-term analytic and reporting platform strategy.The Business Intelligence Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, maintaining, monitoring and extending the data warehouse and analytics architecture to meet BHSI’s reporting needs. The design and development focus includes, but is not limited to: dimensional data model design, Extraction Transformation Layer (ETL) frameworks and processing, metadata management, operational data integration, master data definition and data quality, data auditing and profiling, and business intelligence reporting solutions.  The new team member will partner with data architects and various business partners to map the technical vision for applications in the Enterprise Data Warehouse employing SSIS, SSRS, SSAS and SQL server. Additionally, they will be responsible for reviewing, analyzing, modifying, and creating ETLs, utilizing SSIS, testing, debugging, integration and implementation processes. Responsibilities also include documenting technical needs for ETL processes and databases, and ensuring optimal technical infrastructure is utilized. Essential Functions:Collaborate with multiple business teams to review and prioritize deliverables.Translate and communicate technical requirements into well designed solutions that meet the business and technical goals defined by business stakeholders.Design, develop and optimize enterprise level reporting, OLAP and other business intelligence solutions, and cross train others in the use of the tools.Debug and troubleshoot data quality problems using SQL tools.Develop test plans and test scripts to ensure alignment with business objectives and overall BHSI testing strategy.Coordinate upgrades and rollouts of moderate scope including specific duties related to training and monitoring performance.Coordinate interdepartmental activities and assist in problem resolution to ensure that BHSI meets internal and external customer requirements.Requirements:3-5 years of P&C insurance experienceMinimum 5 years’ experience using SQL Server 2012 or higher preferred.BA/BS degree or equivalent experience.Extensive experience in data warehouse reporting and ETL tools.Experience in handling technology projects/programs in Insurance Domain.Experience with P&C Solutions such as Duck Creek, Guidewire or similar.Experience with managing on shore/off shore teams.Experience with SSRS, Power BI, and other visualization tools.Strong analytical, problem solving, and conceptual skills with ability to work across business areas.Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express business concepts in technical terms, and complex technical solutions in business terms.Passionate and professional demeanor that supports a collaborative and team-oriented environment.Ability to articulate basic project methodology concepts using either SDLC or Agile. NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Team members may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job purpose The Technical Business Analyst is a highly collaborative role that will act as a partner with the business to facilitate and implement technology solutions. This position serves as a primary facilitator for cross-team communication and collaboration. The Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for writing system requirements that will ensure the technology solution will meet the needs of the business. This job requires a high-level understanding of systems, data management, industry, project management, and end-user requirements. You will apply specialized domain knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. You will make judgements and recommendations based on analysis and knowledge. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Reporting directly to the Administrative Director of Finance (AD of F) for the Department of Pediatrics, the Project & Finance Analyst is responsible for monitoring the finances and professional billing processes for the Pediatric Department and preparing regular reports related to expenses, payroll, and revenue for all department GH, MGPO and sundry funds. The finance analyst prepares detailed compilations and analyses of financial data, identifies variances and/or problems and follows them through to resolution. The analyst will also look to implement technical solutions and complete ad hoc analysis, as needed. Analyze data to identify opportunities to improve income and makes recommendations related to specific issues/opportunities by reviewing details of practice operations and developing standard reports.Assists with implementation and monitoring of the Pediatric Specialty & Primary Care Physician compensation plans, including monthly WRVU reporting, annual salary planning, annual dashboard preparation, performance monitoring, plan component analysis and benchmarking as well as detailed analysis of variances, as needed. Future responsibilities may include development of and maintenance of reporting WRVU activity via a WRVU reporting database.In conjunction with the MGPO billing office, implements and monitors processes/procedures to maximize collections. Updates and sends monthly financial dashboards to divisions to assist in monitoring overall actual performance to budget. Performs comprehensive monthly financial analysis of the Departments operating revenue & expenses to budget, and financial metrics and key performance indicators to evaluate performance. Analyzes monthly financials of all funds to review revenue and expenses while monitoring variance and trends. Identifies errors or areas of concern and works with relevant parties to resolve issues, or give recommendations based on analysis Assists with monitoring the Department sundry funds, Grand Rounds & Clerkship expense reconciliation and monitoring of Chief of Service's commitment spending; analyzes and tracks spend and remaining balances on the Department salary budgets, sundry funds and chief package; reconciles expenses and revenue to fund statements to ensure accuracyRuns/Develops/implements reports for various initiatives/projects, as neededAssists with business plan development to determine cost/benefit and financial impact of various proposals, recruitments and initiativesActs independently to resolve financial discrepanciesParticipates in special departmental projects and initiatives as they are identified.Prepares finance tools and worksheets, as neededDevelops any necessary presentations, as neededCreates, designs and maintains various spreadsheet applicationsPerforms ad-hoc analysis, as neededEffectively interacts with all levels of management throughout the organization as well as the Chief of Service, Vice Chair of the Department and Division Chief'sProperly handles and maintains confidential informationAdditional duties as assignedQualifications Effective interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Excellent problem solving, analytical and organizational skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team Meticulous attention to detail Ability to analyze complex financial information Ability to maintain databases and spreadsheets Ability to multitask, meet deadlines, follow-up on, and quickly re-prioritize issues. Extensive knowledge of computerized software program and graphical presentation of data: Microsoft Excel/Access/Word/Power Point/Vision/Insight/iPort/EPIC/HMS Crew Ability to make decisions quickly and independently. Ability to appropriately handle and maintain sensitive/confidential information Bachelor's degree, Master's preferred 2-5 years experience in a similar role Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Workable is changing the way companies find and hire great people. With thousands of enterprise users and millions in venture funding, we have built the best SaaS recruiting software in the world. With offices in Boston, Greece and London, Workable doubled in size the past year and continues to grow at a rapid pace.  To support this growth and make sure that we can scale from thousands to hundreds of thousands of users, we are expanding our teams. This is an opportunity to join a world class software company and a great team that passionately believes in what it does.  For our Boston office, located in Financial District, we are looking for a Financial Analyst to join our Finance Team and manage all aspects of compensation (base, variable, and equity). We want to be able to attract the best of the best and make sure they keep getting better. Name: Business Systems Analyst 3
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst with requirements gathering and functional design experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Partners with the business line to develop requirements. Works with the application development team to create functional designs. Participates in testing, training, and implementation of applications. Analyzes and evaluates user needs. Develops and maintains a complete and accurate understanding of how a business unit impacted by an assigned application conducts their business. Assists in developing and maintaining detailed knowledge of the business's current technology and infrastructure from a functional perspective. Assists business lines in use of new and existing capabilities of a system. Works with internal business groups to document, analyze, and redesign business processes. Partners with business representatives to identify, refine, and document detailed business needs. Joins clients and technical staff to investigate, analyze, and resolve application problems related to system functions. May be point of contact for user support and problem-solving. Occasionally manages small projects. Frequently interfaces with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. Works with technology and application development teams to design functional solutions that appropriately meet the business needs. Reviews, coordinates, and executes test plans for multiple projects and ensures that test cases and results meet requirements.Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship.**Qualifications:****Basic Qualifications**-Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience-At least 5 years experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications.**Required Skills/Experience**- 5 years SEI Trust3000 experience- 5 years SEI Trust3000 BIS experience- 5 years finance experience**Preferred Skills/Experience**Basic understanding in:-IT project management-Information managementWorking experience in:-IT environment-IT standards, procedures, policy-Business assessment-Business process modeling-Modeling: data, process, events, objects-System testing-System development life cycle-Workflow analysis-SQLExtensive experience in:-Problem Solving-Writing Skills-Communication Impact-Requirements analysis-Drive and Results Orientation-Listening-Teamwork and Collaboration-System Testing**Job:** Information Technology**Primary Location:** United States**Shift:** 1st - Daytime**Average Hours Per Week:** 40**Requisition ID:** 180039485U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Wayfair Analytics is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. We move fast, iterating quickly on big business problems. We work smart, applying technology to accelerate unlocking insights and providing outsized value to our customers. We swing big, knowing our customers won’t benefit from micro optimizations. We treat data as a resource; making information globally accessible and eliminating silos. If you want to join a team with these traits in their DNA, read on.  Each Business Intelligence Analyst is aligned with one or more groups, such as Marketing, Logistics, Finance, or Customer Service and partners with those teams to help them achieve their goals. Whether you’re measuring site performance, analyzing customer behavior and trends, data mining, or optimizing SQL queries, you will be working with cutting edge technology and multi-terabyte datasets.  At their core, Business Intelligence Analysts at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy SQL coding but also want to balance that with their interest in business. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new BI team members to emerge as leaders, taking on additional projects and responsibilities with strong performance. Responsibilities include:Consulting with internal customers (e.g., Marketing, Logistics, Finance, or Customer Service) to develop analyses that lead to actionable insights that accelerate profitable growthWrangling data from multiple sources including sales, inventory, product, and customer databases to create integrated views that can be used to drive decision makingWorking with several large and complex SQL and Vertica databasesDesigning and building reports, dashboards, and analyses in both Excel and TableauQualifications:2+ years of experience in a business intelligence, data science or engineering rolePositive, people-oriented, and energetic attitudeAnalytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problemsStrong written and verbal communicationEntrepreneurial spiritExperience with VBA/macros, a plusBA in computer science, economics, or other quantitative discipline with strong academic recordAbout Wayfair Inc. Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 10 million items across home furnishings, décor, home improvement, housewares and more. Committed to delighting its customers every step of the way, Wayfair is reinventing the way people shop for their homes - from product discovery to final delivery.  The Wayfair family of sites includes: Wayfair, an online destination for all things homeJoss & Main, where beautiful furniture and finds meet irresistible savingsAllModern, unbelievable prices on everything modernBirch Lane, a collection of classic furnishings and timeless home décorPerigold, unparalleled access to the finest home décor and furnishings Wayfair generated $5.2 billion in net revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2018. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with operations throughout North America and Europe, the company employs more than 8,700 people.Tag: ANLT-BIDS

Name: Consulting Analyst, Business Process Reengineering
Description: As a Consulting Analyst in the Advanced Process Solutions (APS) organization, you will be part of a team responsible for leading the successful delivery of operational improvement engagements. These engagements are often referred to as Business Process Reengineering, Lean or Six Sigma projects; however, the scope of these projects tends to be much broader and often includes Change Management and Organizational Development (OD) activities. Our enterprise-wide engagements aim to significantly reduce cost while improving the end-to-end customer and associate experience. Your information gathering experience, problem solving skills and ability to become a trusted business partner will help shape the future of Fidelity. In addition, as an integral member of the APS organization, you will help strengthen the groups adoption and use of business process reengineering approaches & frameworks.The Expertise We are Looking ForEducation:A bachelors degree is required (preferences to science or engineering)Experience:You have 2-3 years of experience in operational improvement, financial services or consulting with a track record of collaborating on cross-functional initiatives that resulted in significant value-add.You demonstrate knowledge in one or more operational improvement frameworks, methodologies or toolkits such as Lean, Six Sigma or Business Process Reengineering.You have experience in taking risks and learning from failures.The Purpose of Your RoleThe primary purpose of your role is to provide analytical and consulting support for a team of business process reengineering leaders who are driving operational improvement engagements that demonstrate significant business value. As part of your role, you will consider all aspects of people, process and technology as you document processes and issues, analyze and synthesize data from a variety of sources, offer new and innovative ways of doing work and quantify the value of recommended and implemented improvements. You will also be expected to become a trusted business partner.In addition to your engagement responsibilities, you will serve as a vital member of the APS organization. When appropriate, you will leverage other members of APS to help achieve your engagements objectives. You will also be responsible for continuously improving the Process Engineering and Consulting group that you are a part of and the APS organization as a whole.The Competencies You BringLeadership: Youre a self-starter and have the ability to: challenge the status quo, take risk, envision the future, enable and empower others to act and encourage/motivate others.Information Gathering: You know how to creatively collect information from a wide variety of sources. You have experience researching best practices. You have demonstrated the ability to take large amounts of information, cull the information and then quickly target critical information.Analysis & Synthesis: You know how to analyze and synthesize information using a broad set of tools, frameworks and methodologies. Youre able to provide fundamental business insights from the information that is not obvious to others and leads to actionable, value-add recommendations.Process Modeling: You have the ability to facilitate and document end-to-end process mapping sessions (people, process & technology) that identify issues, foster creating innovative solutions and enable implementing future designs that significantly improve operations.Problem Solving: You are comfortable with ambiguity and have the ability to take complex problems and simplify them into fundamental issues that are driven by a limited set of root causes. You can provide creative, practical solutions that can be implemented in the short term and in the longer term.Communication: Youve successfully demonstrated the use of a variety of communication approaches to foster transparency and collaboration; you can build solid relationships with professionals within an organization and become a trusted business partner.Technical Aptitude: Youve demonstrated the ability to construct high quality client deliverables with applications such as Visio, Minitab, SQL, Excel and PowerPoint. You also have a strong ability to learn new tools, applications and systems quickly. VBA and RPA programing skills are a plus.The Value You DeliverAnalysisCollect and analyze relevant data, research and summarize best practices and benchmarks, synthesize findings; formulate and present recommendations.Use standard methodologies to conduct root cause analysis, formulate cogent problem statements, quantify opportunities, perform cost/benefit analysis.Create process maps that are a means to an end: realizing significant business results.Project SupportDevelop and revise processes, procedures, presentations and lessons learned ensuring final deliverables meet standards for order, clarity, conciseness, style and terminology.Assist management in implementing process improvements, developing implementation plans, preparing training materials, monitoring the implementation and recommending refinements.Supporting and integrating efforts across APS to help establish an enterprise organization known for its best practices, standards, tools, frameworks and methodologies.Professional EngagementContinuously improving ones own skills and competencies to become a respected business process analyst across the enterprise: striving to always be better.Developing and maintaining enterprise-wide relationships to foster alignment, collaboration and the sharing of best practices.Your Performance CriteriaMeasured project impact on business results based on relevant financial & operational indicators.Business feedback regarding engagements and requests for additional help from the Businesses.APS feedback on your ability to improve APS and the Process Engineering and Consulting group.How Your Work Impacts the OrganizationAdvanced Process Solutions is an organization focused on addressing Fidelitys most critical business operations and driving significant improvements in those operations. This role is critical to the success of APS by identifying, diagnosing, designing and delivering significant business results. This role is expected to help transform Fidelity into the new era.Company OverviewAt Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com

Name: Business Analyst Front Office Solutions
Description: We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to support our front-office implementations. This is an exceptional opportunity to help build our future state business architecture to support and expand the capabilities of our Long/Short strategies. The Senior Business Analyst reports to a Project Manager and is a member of the Information Technology team. Responsibilities:Function as a liaison between multiple groups: Portfolio Management, Trading, Operations, and Information TechnologyAssist with defining the future state business models to strategically enable the long/short portfolio management team to gain efficienciesDefine business workflows to support asset classes such as Equities, ETFs, Futures, Options, Structured Notes, FX, Total Return Swaps, Interest Rates Swaps, and Volatility SwapsManage the delivery of order management systems and integrate the system master and position dataWork with the project team to perform bi-directional integration with security master, trading, and accounting systemsWork with the team to design appropriate data models for strategic data stores in the area of Account Master, Broker/Custodian Master, and Position MasterPerform data analysis, define data governance and quality checks, and define process controlsQualifications:Bachelor of Science degree in economics, finance, statistics, mathematics, computer science or a related field; master's degree or CFA preferredAt least 5+ years of experience in the asset management business, ideally with a buy-side multi-asset focusRecent experience managing and implementing multi-asset class front office solutions with the following security types: Equities, ETFs, Futures, Options, Structured Notes, FX, Total Return Swaps, Interest Rates Swaps, and Volatility SwapsExperience implementing and integrating middle and back office functions with Accounting systems/providers (SS&C GlobeOp / Advent Geneva preferred) and Performance systems for Total Return Performance and GIPS Composite information (BiSam preferred)Experience delivering software as part of an Agile delivery teamStrong knowledge of enterprise data management and business process modelingOutstanding analytical and quantitative skills; Strong written and verbal communications skillsSDL2017

Name: Clinical Business Analyst
Description: About Us As a not-for-profit organization, Partners HealthCare is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women's Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.  We're focused on a people-first culture for our system's patients and our professional family. That's why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Partners HealthCare is committed to aligning our employees' personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development-and we recognize success at every step.  Our employees use the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration. General Overview The Senior Clinical Business Analyst for Radiant reports to the Radiant Manager and is responsible for providing end user support, eliciting business requirements and working with the system build teams to implement enhancements and improvements to the Epic end user community with a primary focus on Radiology related workflows and associated areas. This person will also have responsibilities of facilitating application changes, executing user acceptance testing, training and supporting IT initiatives and applications for Medical Imaging IT (MIIT). They will also be responsible for leading small to large scale projects.  The position entails IT support and working closely with the Clinical and Operational Leadership to diagnose system issues, optimize workflows, and implement requested changes in a highly matrixed environment. They will work to support and evaluate workflow process with software and interface configuration, design and implementation for the Epic Radiant application. A history of working with Radiology scheduling, ordering and resulting systems, as well Network/Technical basics will benefit the candidate. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & CollaborationOther duties as assignedQualificationsBachelor's Degree in Business, IT, Healthcare, or related required;Must have 5+ years of healthcare IT experience with a knowledge of clinical systems3+ years of Business Analysis and/or Project Management specific to Enterprise Health Records (EHR) or Information Technology Implementation preferredA combination of education and experience may be substituted for requirementsRadiology systems background desiredEpic Certification (Radiant or other) desired or must obtain Epic training as outlined by program requirementExperience providing customer and/or end user support, preferably in a healthcare settingSkills, Abilities and Competencies RequiredStrong ability to provide excellent customer support, preferably in a healthcare settingKnowledge of Clinical workflowsAbility to effectively translate business requirements to functional requirementsPossess strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with cross functional teams including staff at all levels of the organization including both technical and non-technical personnelStrong problem solving and negotiation skillsOutstanding business process analytic skillsAbility to effectively conduct meetings, both formal and informalRequires minimal direction from leadership and possesses the ability to learn quicklyAbility to prioritize and manage various tasks and timelines for both operational and project workAbility to successfully negotiate and collaborate with others of different skill sets, backgrounds an levels within and external to the organizationAbility to cooperatively and effectively work within a teamStandard office environment with local travel to Brigham Health radiology and Partners sitesFrequent travel to radiology operational areasTravel for training likelyParticipation in rotation for on-call support as assigned (may include nights, weekends and holidays) coverage likely as business needs dictateAs projects and priorities dictate, must be available to work occasional non-standard hours such as evenings, nights, weekends and holidaysEEO Statement Partners HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer & by embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, military service, genetic information, and/or other status protected under law. Name: Senior Business Analyst, National Insurance
Description: Advance your career at Liberty Mutual - A Fortune 100 Company!Commercial Insurances National Insurance Actuarial team is seeking a Business Analyst II or Senior Business Analyst to support the National Insurance Specialty Construction & Energy Divisions. The NICE actuarial team actively contributes to the overall strategic direction of the division and of National Insurance. We provide training and support on pricing models and day-to-day advice and support on the pricing and profitability of the divisions large accounts. This position will primarily provide support for both home office and field. The analyst will work in close partnership with underwriters to provide analyses and recommendations on pricing both for internal Liberty Mutual needs and external customer requests. The analyst will be a direct contact for underwriters and should have strong communication skills and desire to work in an outward facing role.  Although the majority of the analyst's time will be spent on account work and support, the role may also involve responsibility for other National Insurance projects, depending on current needs and individual interests.Responsibilities:Direct Underwriting SupportComplete analyses and provide guidance on pricing of large accounts through use of the Loss Forecast, Excess, Aggregate, NPV, Corridor and other pricing models. Understand and answer questions pertaining to Portfolio Models (WCPA, CAPA and MAP).Calculate and communicate results relating to rate and plan changes as used in monthly operations reporting. Complete security and collateral reviews both for current customers and as required for Buyouts, Loss Portfolio Transfers and Bankruptcies on former accounts.Models and TrainingCollaborate with Product Management on model updates and new model implementations.Improve processes and models by working as a liaison between the field and Product Management, collecting and providing feedback.Provide training and model support to the field as necessary, as well as to rotating students and new team members.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree and at least three years of relevant experienceEffective communication skills for explaining pricing proposals and making presentationsAdvanced analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to work independently and as part of a groupKnowledge of business practices and processesStrong proficiency with spreadsheets and data manipulationBenefits:We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/BenefitsOverview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.Were dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.Job: Analytics Primary Location: United States-Massachusetts-Boston Schedule: Full-time Salary: $67,000-$117,000 Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (±16 years) Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

Name: Infrastructure Business Systems Analyst
Description: In January 2018, we launched one of the industry’s largest technical transformation projects, in effect building a new bank from the ground up. This project isn’t greenfield in the way most banks claim projects are; we’ve started with a blank sheet of paper both operationally and technically. We’re using the same technologies that Silicon Valley giants are using: aggressive use of multiple public clouds, building our own private cloud to achieve even better performance, pushing out microservices into what will be one of the largest Kubernetes installations in the world, leveraging immutable storage to process and store hundreds of terabytes of data a day, transforming our industry through application of distributed ledger technology and cognitive computing, aggressively participating in open source communities driving our systems.Who we are Although not a household name, State Street is one of the world’s largest and most important financial services institutions, providing round-the-clock services to the global investment community. We touch $33 trillion in assets every day, and are the world’s third largest investment manager with over $2.8 trillion in assets under management. To do this we manage as much data as one of the internet giants on nearly as large a technical footprint.  This isn’t a traditional banking role. This is a chance to push your technical skills with people more comfortable in a technology firm than an investment bank, but solving real problems that affect anyone with any form of savings worldwide (not just trying to get people to click on ads). We don’t expect you to wear a suit, we don’t expect you to not be able to tell your friends what you’re working on, we don’t expect you to sit in meetings 5 hours a day. What you will doYou will work with architects and process specialists to shape the toolchain necessary to build an end to end No-Ops flow, enabling seamless interactions across SDLC ‘moments of truth’You will help us automate key ITIL processes and monitor for infrastructure configuration driftYou will define end user ‘journey maps’ through process specifications and interaction points, using ITIL processes in alignment with public cloud based capabilitiesYou will author design specifications and test cases with input from developers to aid configuration and development in a verifiable mannerWho you areYou have an understanding of DevOps principles (e.g., continuous integration and continuous delivery concepts) and comfort with the latest technologies used in the development, testing and monitoring of custom applications within a cloud environmentYou have familiarity in journey mapping concepts and developing process flows focused on addressing pain pointsYou are able to clearly translate business requirements into technical requirements, analyze and document complex business processes and identify areas for improvementYou have demonstrated ownership of test plan development and iteration-level testingYou have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or a STEM related field, and over 3 years of experienceApplicable certification(s) preferred State Street appreciates the value diversity (in all its forms) brings to our firm.  SSTGTS18

Name: Oracle Financials Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Exciting opportunity with Oracle eBusiness Suite Release 12 (12.1.3) environment including Financials (AP, AR, GL, PO, FA) Project Costing, Project Billing, Project Contracts and OTL modules. Experience with Release 12.1 required. Desired skills include functional knowledge of Oracle Financials (AP, AR, GL, FA, CE) and Projects (Cost & Billing), eBusiness Suite Business Processes, Oracle Application schema and SQL. Additional knowledge of Project Contracts and Shipping modules a plus.  This IT position will be the "liaison" between IT and corporate business units.  Will be responsible for providing support and enhancements for Oracle Financials including Project Cost and Billing, and Project Contracts. Function as the major interface between the IT organization and their customers. Work with the customer to identify and define in detail the customer requirements for information systems solutions. Then, you will work with the IT Software Engineer to translate customer requirements into detail technical requirements that are used as the beginning point in the software solution development process. The Business Analyst (BA) also is involved in creating requirements based software test plans and in performing testing of software. Often the BA is involved in identifying, analyzing and streamlining the customer business processes associated with software solutions. The BA provides ongoing post implementation customer support of the use of the software applications. This position combines understanding of customer requirements and business functions, breadth and technical expertise, and multi-discipline knowledge to recommend innovative ways of implementing technology to support business processes. Name: Senior Business Analyst, Operations
Description: Job Description We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our Enterprise Operations team located at 150 Royall Street, Canton, MA.  As a key member of our Enterprise Operations team, you will have an opportunity to work on an Agile team and be valued as a major contributor of a large scale project. Your role as a Senior Business Analyst is to work with customers, stakeholders and other team members to identify and understand business requirements and processes in order to recommend and support the delivery of quality business and technical operational solutions. Responsibilities:Responsible for gathering, compiling and synthesizing information related to business processes, systems capabilities and end user needs. Demonstrates strong understanding of core business processes and the ability to understand new concepts.Responsible for eliciting, analyzing, documenting and validating business requirements and recommending solutions in support of business needs and overall IT Business strategies. Recognizes improvement opportunities and effectively presents recommendations to stakeholders or implements if within the span of control. Accurately identifies, defines and communicates business problem and solution scope.Collaborates with other team members to produce business requirement documents, diagrams, and use cases for complex assignments.Leads requirements elicitation gathering and review sessions with customers and IT Business stakeholders. Works closely with development team members to analyze requirements and evaluate possible solutions. Ensures questions/ issues are addressed proactively by seeking information from internal/ external users. Manages approval and estimation process. Manages requests for change and ensures proper change control procedures are followed.Serves as one of the primary liaisons between IT and assigned business and/ or service units. Uses knowledge of business products, workflow and processes and service unit objectives to assist the business and IT team members in solution development. Maintains a strong understanding of business priorities and objectives. Uses this knowledge to prioritize work while managing multiple complex assignments.Complies with all related SOX testing and test documentation storage enabling a positive SOX outcome.Understands the OneBeacon organization and business environment. Maintains current knowledge of insurance industry developments.Communicates effectively with team members, customers and stakeholders, both verbally and in writing.Responsible for working with project teams and end users to coordinate systems testing, document training and provide support. Assists with review of test strategies, test plans, test cases and expected results. Performs post implementation evaluation of effectiveness of solution and works with team members to continually improve processes.Monitors and reports on progress against plan, escalating issues to IT management as appropriate.Decision-Making Authority/Accountability Level: Performs complex work under limited supervision. Exercises independent judgment in accordance with specified policies and guidelines. Possesses strong procedural and/ or technical knowledge developed through comprehensive experience as a business analyst. Performs analysis of all issues to ensure accurate receivables and timely collection. Requirements: Demonstrated proficiency with computer software including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Visio. Strong communication skills required for interaction with business partners and IT team members. Education and Experience: The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree with 5-7 years of related business/ systems analyst experience. Certificate in business analysis or comparable technical designation(s) preferred. Knowledge of policy writing system functions and backend financial consolidation a plus. Supervisory Responsibility: May provide mentoring to lower level positions and can provide input into junior and peer performance evaluations.

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Business Operations AnalystJob Description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise is an innovative, dynamic company with a rich past and a promising future. Originally Hewlett-Packard Company, HPE has continuously reinvented itself. Today, HPE is one of the world's leading technology companies and provides wired and wireless networking, servers, storage, IT and Cloud services for the next generation of IT infrastructure.  This role is responsible for planning, scheduling and coordinating demand/supply management, business processes and/or manufacturing/delivery of products and services to the company policy and country regulatory requirements. Partners with stakeholders to identify/implement opportunities for business process improvement to effectively manage costs, integrate new and existing businesses, and adapt to changes in the business and regulatory environment. Time horizon is typically focused on less than six months for forecasting/planning. Leading and working with cross-functional teams, creates and implements plans that enable the execution of business strategies. Participates in the process by which demand signals are developed, validated for alignment with transition plans, supply constraints identified, and an executable plan defined that meets financial and market share goals. Scope includes business execution processes related to lifecycle planning; order management (including allocation management, Available to Promise (ATP) / commit processes, business attainment tracking); logistics management (including inbound/outbound coordination and consolidation of domestic and international systems to support shipments); and inventory management (including analysis, optimization and velocity). Partners cross-functionally to develop, track and manage business metrics for the organization (may include customer availability, service levels, on-time delivery, supplier response time (SRTs), supply chain costs and inventory. Responsibilities:Responsible for supply chain processes, such as inventory analysis, order fulfillment, import/export operations and shipping, for a regional or global business unit.Produces reports using IT systems and analyzes data to develop trends for supply and demand activities; articulates findings to management.Analysis of backlog management.Gathers demand data from country, region, and account managers to contribute to demand planning.Collaborates with regional and global business unit planning teams to maintain and enhance current business processes.Reviews performance metrics on a regular basis, identifying opportunities for improvement.Researches and analyzes priority projects within established guidelines.Communicates requirements and guidelines to the regional and global business unit planning teams.May provide training or general direction for junior staff members.Education and Experience Required:First level university degree or equivalent experienceTypically 2-4 years of experience in a supply chain function.Knowledge and Skills:Demonstrated understanding of supply chain processes (plan, source, make deliver).Strong analytical and data modeling skills.Strong written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.Strong interpersonal skills.Developed Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) and other analytical aids to help manage the operation.Developing Project Management Skills.Demonstrated business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.Proficient understanding of the company's overall supply chain strategy.Strong understanding of Material Requirements Planning (MRP) and ATP.Developed understanding of import/export regulatory requirements and compliance.Moderate level of knowledge of inventory analysis.Demonstrated leadership skills.Job:Supply Chain & OperationsJob Level:IntermediateHewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities. HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

Name: Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAre you interested in research and data analysis? Does working for schools, colleges, and universities at all levels appeal to you? Do you like working with data to gather insights and make decisions? Do you work well in a team environment? What we want you to do Maguire Associates is looking for Analysts who will help our clients succeed. This is a full-time position where you’ll use your research and data skills in a range of assignments that support our two main business lines, which include research-based consulting and predictive modeling. To be more specific, here are some of the things that you’ll do: Help design and analyze custom research that provides insight on stakeholder perceptions and needsCreate statistical models that help colleges and universities decide how to spend millions of dollars in financial aid in order to meet their enrollment goalsDesign predictive models to help institutions understand the factors that predict student application, enrollment, and retentionRefine and shape data files to maximize their ability to answer research questionsUse secondary data to advise colleges and universities with new academic program offeringsTalk to clients and advise them on research insights and strategyWho you are You are someone who has interests in education, quantitative research, and statistical methods. Qualifications:Master’s preferred in social science or another field where data analysis has been an important part of your educationProficiency in Microsoft Office and quantitative statistics packages like SPSS, SAS, or R; or knowledge of any programming languageExperience with multivariate data analysis, such as multiple regression, logistic regression, or machine learning algorithmsWho we are Maguire Associates is based in Concord, MA, and is a premier research-based consulting firm that serves the education industry. Since our founding in 1983, we have served more than 600 private and public colleges and universities, K-12 schools, educational consortia, educational service providers, and government organizations focused on education. We offer a highly collaborative, intellectually interesting, casual environment where you’ll have an immediate impact on our work for our clients. What to do next To apply, submit your resume and cover letter to jobs@maguireassoc.com. In your cover letter, tell us how you’ve used research to test a hypothesis or inform a decision. Maguire Associates offers competitive compensation and employee benefits, and is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer.Company DescriptionMaguire Associates is based in Concord, MA, and is a premier research-based consulting firm that serves the education industry. Since our founding in 1983, we have served more than 600 private and public colleges and universities, K-12 schools, educational consortia, educational service providers, and government organizations focused on education. We offer a highly collaborative, intellectually interesting, casual environment where you’ll have an immediate impact on our work for our clients.

Description: Do you love solving complex analytical problems? Are you excited about helping use data and metrics to raise capital for rapid growth and maximize profitability across the organization? Do you have the skills to interpret market trends and explain your assumptions to the CEO? If so, read on…CIC is looking for a Corporate Finance Analyst to join our team. This is a great opportunity for someone with an analytical framework and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment to grow their skills.ABOUT THE ROLEWith rapid growth in mind, CIC seeks a Corporate Finance Analyst to help support the corporate finance team and the greater organization use data analysis to make sound decisions about launching and operating new projects and new products. You will be the primary owner of executing analyses for key company decisions by developing work plans, gathering and synthesizing relevant data, building models and developing final recommendations for management.The role is based in Boston, Massachusetts, with the possibility of travel around the US and to Europe. It will report to the Director of Global Finance.RESPONSIBILITIESIn this role, you will be expected to:Execute analyses for key company decisions by developing work plans, gathering and synthesizing relevant data, building models and developing final recommendationsAnalyze financial results to identify revenue and cost trends at both the site and company levelSupport deal/capital raising efforts with landlords and investors during the presentation creation and due diligence phasesUse financial analyses as a platform for further discussions and decision making with senior managersWork closely with CIC’s finance team to integrate financial projections into the accounting and operational management systemsPrepare a variety of ad hoc financial analysis as requiredIDEAL CANDIDATECIC seeks highly capable, self-directed individuals who employ a high level of autonomy in their work. If you are a creative and critical thinker and thrive in fast-paced environments, you would probably enjoy working with us.In addition, we are looking for candidates with the following characteristics:Commitment to transparency and accountabilityAnalytical and naturally inquisitive in natureAbility to actively participate in problem resolutionWork well under pressure with tight timelines;Have a humble approach with a willingness to roll up one’s sleeves and pitch in as necessaryDemonstrated passion for supporting innovationExperience working collaboratively and comfortable with a flat organization where you will be working directly with senior executives of the companyAn interest in a long-term role - we are a growing company, and we like to hire people who can grow with us over the yearsAn optimistic outlook and the humor, integrity, and patience necessary to work within a constantly changing environmentREQUIREMENTSBachelor’s degree in a related field (e.g. Finance, Business, Economics, Quantitative Methods, Statistics, Mathematics)1 to 2 years of experience in financial modeling and analysis and a strong proficiency with Excel, preferably with some real estate experience (although not required)Demonstrated excellence in academic studies or past positions in using data and financial metrics to effectively solve problems and communicate solutionsATTRACTIONS OF THE JOBIn addition to helping our clients achieve great things, we work to ensure that our employees are healthy and supported. Some of the benefits of being here include:Fun people in a dynamic space. We pride ourselves on finding driven and bright collaborators who are eager to lend their own unique skills to the team, as well as to our inspiring clientele. The number one reason CICers say they like working here is because of their colleagues!Personal growth. This is a great opportunity to learn and develop skills within the epicenter of the innovation community at a growing companyRegular massages, access to a nursing room, access to Venture Cafe, secure bicycle parking, a game room, a gym, shower rooms with towels, stocked kitchens, a host of discounts towards local business and well-being memberships, and great health benefits (see below!)Central location. CIC Boston is centrally located in downtown Boston and is within walking distance to the Blue, Green, Orange, and Red line.Compensation is commensurate with experience and includes 100% of the cost of a premium healthcare and dental package, long and short-term disability, life insurance, 401k matching after the first year of employment (must be 21+), and two weeks vacation from the start (more with seniority). Annual reviews with raises significantly above the national average every year for those on track with strong performance.CIC is committed to building teams that reflect the fabric of the cities we support. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, ancestry, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know.ABOUT CICFounded in 1999, CIC’s mission is to improve the world by helping exceptional entrepreneurs innovate better and faster. We offer carefully curated working environments that combine private, secure offices alongside shared amenities in locations across Boston, Cambridge, Miami, Philadelphia, Rotterdam, St. Louis, and Warsaw and are growing into other cities, within the US and abroad. We currently serve 1800+ startups, growth companies, and branches of larger organizations, representing for-profit, mission-driven, and non-profit sectors across a wide array of industries. The spaces are purposefully designed and built for innovation, featuring tailored workspaces such as biotech and robotics laboratories, and bring together frequent, large gatherings of the best and brightest innovators and entrepreneurs.CIC currently has over a million square feet of space under lease and is actively pursuing campuses in five additional cities globally, including Dublin, Tokyo, Bilbao, Providence, and Sydney, with plans to grow to 50 cities over the next 10 years. We pride ourselves on displaying a high degree of care and accuracy in everything that we do, and we work to ensure that our clients thrive every day that they are in our space. We believe that our ability to support world-changing entrepreneurs is only as good as the people who make up our teams, and as such we are looking for people who are interested in contributing to--and improving--the way we work.We invite you to explore all our openings here and learn more about us here.

Name: Quality Assurance Analyst
Description: Quality Assurance AnalystBoston, MA or Woodbridge, NJ We are currently looking for Quality Assurance Analysts to join our team. Positions are available in either our Boston or New Jersey locations. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Based on project requirements and technical design, develop & execute software test casesPlan test schedules & strategies in accordance with project scope & delivery datesDocument test cases, results and defects utilizing MicroFocus (formerly HP) Quality Center/ALMCreate and manage test data, including data for use by automated scripts where applicableDocument and communicate project quality over the course of testing, including readiness for releaseProvide feedback and recommendations to developers on software usability and functionalitySupport User Acceptance Test (UAT) phase - largely through test information sharing and data setupDesired Skills:3-5 years testing experienceExperience with Quality Center/ALM for requirements, test case and defect managementData testing experience including writing SQL and working with XML filesExposure to Property & Casualty Insurance a plusExcellent skills as a communicator and facilitator, both written and oralAbility to work independently and within a team to accomplish a common goalSelf-starter with strong negotiation, conflict resolution, and influencing skillsA process improvement mind-set Plymouth Rock, founded in 1982 by Jim Stone, former Massachusetts Insurance Commissioner, is a privately held insurance company that writes personal and commercial lines of business in the Northeastern United States. Today, Plymouth Rock, with more than $1billion in premiums underwritten and serviced, is comprised of a group of companies that were started or acquired to expand product offerings, channels of distribution, and the geographic footprint. With more than 800,000 policyholders, Plymouth Rock writes insurance through more than 800 independent agents.  The Plymouth Rock Group employs over 1,600 people and is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. Plymouth Rock holds an A.M. Best rating of A-/Excellent.

This role will have the opportunity to evaluate current procedures and recommend best practices. Supply Chain etc. to resolve issues.Monitor price requests from Value Added Resellers (VAR’s) to ensure compliance with Nasuni pricing and policiesCoordinate Deal Desk to facilitate communication necessaryMaintain and customize SF contracts/Intacct contracts processTrack all Proof of Concept trials at customers and assist in the recovery of equipment when necessaryAssist in the administration of commission plans, offering insight into best practice, etc.Maintain Sales Process documentationAid in Productization of Business Case and Proposal development and continued improvements driven from Name: Business Systems Analyst
