Convene and facilitate meetings and communication with senior management team and external partners  Research and identify best practices and recommend successful program model changes  Responsible for all contract management, training, record keeping, internal controls, security, evaluation and reporting associated with the new program, including piloting  Monitor the progress, risk and quality of all operational activities  Represent the team at external meetings, committees, conferences and coalitions  Provide supervision and monitoring of all deliverables associated with program and pilot  Core Competencies: The ideal candidate must have strong, working knowledge of:  The principles and practices of human resource management including behavioral techniques, planning, forecasting, organizational development, etc.  Data collection and analysis methodologies  Project monitoring and evaluation systems  Organization development techniques, principles and methods  The idea candidate must be able to:  Design and implement planning, policy, research and evaluation processes  Coordinate and direct project activities  Analyze data as a tool  Identify mission critical initiatives and prioritize accordingly  Establish and maintain effective working relationships  Meet numerous and tight deadlines  Troubleshoot problems and offer creative solutions or workarounds  Communicate effectively both orally and in writing  Deal with external individuals and organizations in a diplomatic and efficient manner  Ability to coordinate numerous projects simultaneously to successful completion  Interpret and use data in problem-solving and process improvement  Understand, apply and explain pertinent laws, rules, regulations, policies and programs  Work independently and collaborativelyprovided by Dice Analysis, Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analysis, Data Collection, Development, Manager, Management, Programming, Project, Project Manager, Research, Security, Supervision

Name: Systems Analyst / Report Writer
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT: Under general direction of the Pharmacy Systems Manager, the incumbent will be responsible for implementations, upgrades, configuration, and support of multiple systems under the purview of the pharmacy department, including the evaluation of system computer and system devices, design of system software modifications, technical specification/programming, system integration, and testing for modifications. In addition, this position will be responsible for gathering requirements for report requests and then the design, creation, maintenance and dissemination of those reports.  Qualified candidates will act as a master security officer for both local and remote locations; as well as liaison with other departments for interface, operational and data requirements relating to the Pharmacy Systems and Pharmacy Operations. This role requires the capability to independently manage operational aspects of the computer systems, including installation, configuration, local and remote location management, network connectivity, and system archiving and retrieval. The incumbent will provide support training to new and existing system users, establish and/or maintain Pharmacy Systems documentation, and be required to be on-call 24/7, on a rotating basis.  This role requires technical excellence, clinical know-how and organizational acumen.  PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES :For all pharmacy department systems: o Develops subject matter expertise and maintains models and documentation of business and system requirements and configures system accordingly  o Analyzes business processes to ensure proper system configuration and downstream integration  o Develops and maintains models of business and system requirements and configures system accordingly  o Creates and maintains all required system design and build documents  o Recognizes, communicates, and escalates concerns relevant to critical path and/or timeline in a timely manner  o Supports departmental/functional team with application and information systems knowledge  o Documents and analyzes business processes  o Tracks and resolves issues and action items  o Contributes to preparation of testing scripts and materials  o Participates in unit, integrated, and regression testing tasks  o Participates in post-live implementation activities and production support for all pharmacy department systems  o Provides on-call rotation support for patient care critical systems issues 24 x 7  o Attends weekly team meetings to discuss team and project related activities, issues, change communications, and updates Provides Epic Clarity Data Model Certification/Proficiency (Clarity and Cogito fundamentals for KPIs, self-service tools, dashboards, navigating Caboodle)Provides expertise and production support for Omnicell Automatic Dispensing Systems, as well as other Omnicell suite of applications Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS :Required : · Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field  · Minimum of 5 years related work experience:  o Experience with report writing in a clinical setting.  o Experience with healthcare clinical systems  · Some understanding of clinical workflow relevant to hospital pharmacy  · Epic Clarity Data Model Certification/Proficiency desired or must obtain Epic Certification or Proficiency as outlined by program requirements  Preferred: · Ability to apply clinical workflows to the design of information systems  · Understanding of change management processes  · Strong verbal and written communication skills  · Strong problem solving and negotiation skills  · Ability to effectively conduct small meetings, both formal and informal  · Self-motivated, independent and possesses the ability to learn quickly  · Ability to successfully negotiate and collaborate with others of different skill sets, backgrounds and levels within and external to the organization  · Ability to assimilate and understand new software releases and adapt to a changing environment  · Ability to review project deliverables for completeness, quality, and compliance with established project standards  · Ability to document and communicate the status of progress against plans, taking corrective action as necessary  SKILLS/ ABILITIES/ COMPETENCIES REQUIRED : · Report Writing  o Crystal Reports and Enterprise  o Knowledge of various databases (e.g. MS-SQL 2016, Oracle 11g, Cache, ServiceNow)  o SQL query language, Crystal  o Database connection protocols  · On-call  o Basic understanding of  § Networks  § Windows 2016 Server and Win 10 desktop O/S.  § Network devices/printers.  o Diagnose and troubleshoot complex systems. o Experience supporting: § Epic, preferably Willow module  § Omnicell products  o Good customer service skills.  o Manage troubleshooting during system outages.  o Working knowledge of systems integration (interfaces) and HL7  o Experience in healthcare IT environment, workflows and priorities.  o Familiarity with ITIL workflows and processes.  · Systems Administration  o Ability to support upgrades, installs, hardware migrations and user administration.  o Recommend hardware and software solutions.  o Liaison among vendors, IT staff and end users.  o Manage procurement of computer equipment for users.  o Testing  § Smoke test newly built/upgraded systems  § Assist in implementing volume and performance testing.  § Testing software patches and major upgrades.  § Assist in writing test cases.  o Assist in maintaining the department intranet site.  · Documentation  o System topology diagrams  o Systems manuals  o IT policies and procedures  o Develop and write test plans.  o Excellent writing skills.  o "How to" tip sheets.  o Good knowledge of Microsoft Office suite.  · Project Management  o Organize and lead small projects  o Work with end users to build requirements and project plans.  o Basic understanding of project management processes and tools.  o PMP a plus but not required.  · Programming and Applications  o Working knowledge of at least one programming language.  o HTML  o ServiceNow certification a plus.  o MS Access  WORKING CONDITIONS : · Must be able to lift up to 20 lbs.  · Must be able to sit for extended periods of time  Ability to be flexible, versatile and adaptable in day to day activities. Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: The pricing analyst is responsible for supporting the Pricing team at ProfitWell. The main responsibilities of the Pricing Analyst are:  - Communicating with clients via email and conference call  - Creating summary documents for the purposes of client education  - Creating surveys for the purposes of data collection  - Consolidating and analyzing data collected from surveys in Microsoft Excel  - Developing pricing strategy recommendations based on data analysis  Main Responsibilities Communication: Strong oral and written communication skills are required for the position of pricing analyst. The pricing analyst is responsible for communicating with client partner teams via email and conference call on a regular basis. In addition to communicating with clients, the pricing analyst is expected to communicate honestly and openly with other members of the client services team in the interest of organizing responsibilities and delegating tasks. Communicating with the Price Intelligently Sales Team will be necessary for the purposes of onboarding new clients into the engagement process. Data Analysis: The pricing analyst is responsible for developing an experimental design that includes survey creation and distribution. Survey data is collected within a proprietary application and fed through proprietary algorithms to produce raw workable data; the analyst is responsible for organizing and consolidating the raw data into client education documents that explain the pricing study findings and their implications. Client Support: A primary responsibility of the pricing analyst is to ensure that our clients feel supported in their partnership with ProfitWell. The pricing analyst, as an extension of the Pricing team, is responsible for facilitating an environment where our clients feel supported long after the final deliverable has been given to the client. The pricing analyst is expected to work with the Pricing team in matters of answering client questions and supporting clients through price testing and strategic implementation. Requirements Quantitatively: 1-3 years of managing large projects1-2 years of financial analysis high desirableProven effectiveness as a team member (Have you increased capacity? Decreased delivery time? Developed a better process?) Qualitatively: Skilled at data analysis, reporting, and presentationsDemonstrated experience in interacting with C-level executivesA strong conviction in output with at least in SaaS or a related field. Works well in a team (we want missionaries here, not mercenaries) and be prepared to prove this. A knowledge for the technical & data side of software, the current market shifts, and certain nuances that accompany themCan take all sorts of feedback, coaching, and criticism while maintaining a strong declaration in their abilitiesExceptional communication skills including tact and diplomacyProactive in problem solving, comfortable with completing tasks with some level of ambiguityAbility to quickly understand and demonstrate technology and business value propositions.A sharp focus on your goalsA powerful work ethicStreet smartsThe ability and desire to advance the mission of ProfitWellBenefitsWhy ProfitWell? At ProfitWell, you’ll learn more than you ever thought imaginable amongst a team that’s incredibly passionate about their mission to help SaaS companies grow through pricing, analytics, and retention tools.  Perks: Time when you need it - flexible hours and vacationFully-stocked break rooms with complimentary food and drinksAll the gear to help you be successfulDog-friendly officeFrequent company and team outings, including kayaking, hiking, retreats, trivia, and other events put together to bond and blow off steamOpportunity to work with top software brands Benefits: Competitive salary and bonus structureEquity in a thriving company with no outside ownership. We’re 100% team member owned.Premier medical benefits401kPaid parental leaveIncredible career development in a rapidly changing environment

Name: Advisor, Business Systems Analyst
Description: RSA, the Security Division of Dell, provides more than 30,000 customers around the world with essential security capabilities to protect their most valuable assets from cyber threats. With RSAs award-winning products, organizations effectively detect, investigate, and respond to advanced attacks; confirm and manage identities; and ultimately, reduce IP theft, fraud, and cybercrime.  PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Help drive continuous improvement processes related to account assignment accuracy, minimizing account duplication, and general data quality efforts.  Support field sales users in the use of the territory management system  Develop and maintain reports as needed related to sales territories, sales order assignment and customer account intelligence  Help oversee training efforts for the global sales organization on the territory management system  Oversee user provisioning for the territory management system  Help maintain sales order assignment rules data  Help analyze sales order assignment accuracy on a monthly basis for continuous improvement  Work closely with Americas Commissions team, the global Sales Operations team and the Sales Productivity team on shared territory management and commissions processes  Help oversee critical data processes including integration with other sales and marketing systems, including Salesforce.com, SAP and OBIEE.  SKILLS Required  o Strong quantitative and analytic aptitude  o Strong project management experience  o Experience with Salesforce.com administration/support  o Aptitude and comfort level with manipulating large data sets  o Ability to work collaboratively with a team  o Interest and aptitude in maintaining and improving business processes  o Strong customer service skills; proven ability to interface directly with internal, business-side clients  o Strong written and oral communication skills  o working knowledge of SQL; ability to build out basic queries  o Working knowledge and experience with relational databases  o MS Excel  o MS Access  o Ability to multi-task and work independently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment  Desired  o Knowledge of / experience with territory management function for B-to-B, high-tech company  o Knowledge of commission / sales order assignment processes  o Sales Operations and/or Sales Productivity experience  o Experience administering and driving enhancements for Salesforce.com  o Experience building relational databases  At least 1 year of experience with the above.  o Experience overseeing technical / developer person-resources Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here.

Name: Business Analyst Agile
Description: The PMO is made up of business analysts, QA engineers, project managers, and moreall working together to help design, develop, and deliver the best technology tools and business solutions available in our industry. Togetheralong with our colleagues all across Technologywe are developing solutions designed to help our clients run their own advisory businesses. Our development approach has always been Agile, and we recently revamped our team structure based on Scrum.  Do you love finding creative solutions to business problems using technology? Are you adaptable, flexible, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment? If so, you may be the right fit to join our group of a dozen-plus business analysts.  As a business analyst, your responsibilities would include:  Working on our Generalist Scrum team, which is responsible for designing and implementing our firm's applications and solutions Providing creative technology solutions to our company's business problemsGathering and documenting business requirements; going above and beyond to understand the client's complete business need and putting a plan into actionMeeting with subject matter experts to identify and document all system requirementsTaking the information from your client meetings and putting it into system requirement documents/user stories that our Development team will use to build the applicationCollaborating with the other members of the Technology department to develop project documentation, UI design, and so onConducting walk-throughs of all completed specifications with the team to ensure that the documentation is complete and development estimates are accurateServing as the main liaison between business users and development staff to ensure that all requirements are met on schedule; communicating business requirement changes to the business usersCompleting and distributing documentation in a timely manner so that everyone is kept up to date on status and any issues that need to be resolvedWorking with vendors to implement new systems or modify tools we currently use The ideal candidate for this position would also meet the following requirements:  Experience in Agile development process and Scrum Adaptable, flexible personality; comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with constant changesFinancial services background a plusExcellent written, verbal, and presentation skills, with the ability to facilitate meetings5 years of experience in business analysis and requirements definition for IT systemsDetail oriented; ability to multitask and meet deadlinesA solid understanding of technologyAbility to think out a problem creatively and not just look at by-the-book solutionsStrong organizational and analytical skillsComfortable working independently but also a team playerExperience with all stages of a project life cycle, including planning, analysis, design, construction, and testingStrong computer skills, including Microsoft Office suite and Visio; ability to learn new applicationsSome project management experience a plusPrevious experience with TFSSDL2017

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Business Systems Analyst. We are open to talent who are interested in our office in either Farmington, CT or Canton, MA.  As a key member of our IT division, you will have an opportunity to be a part of an experienced, focused, innovative team of IT professionals that span the U.S. As a Senior Business Systems Analyst you will serve on Agile teams and be charged to take on the role of a product owner in additional to being an expert in delivering quality technical solutions to complex user needs. Responsibilities:The Senior Business Systems Analyst conducts detailed research in order to transform business requirements into precise, high quality user stories or functional specifications.Responsible for eliciting, analyzing, documenting and validating business requirements and recommending solutions in support of business needs and overall IT strategies. Recognizes improvement opportunities and effectively presents recommendations to stakeholders. Accurately identifies, defines and communicates business problem and solution scope.Produces business requirements documents, diagrams, use case modeling, business process and workflow modeling for complex assignments.Leads requirements elicitation and review sessions with customers and IT stakeholders. Creates a product backlog based on defined Epics and User Stories. Works closely with development team members in the process of analyzing business requirements and evaluating possible solutions. Ensures questions/ issues are addressed. Manages approval and estimation process. Manages requests for change and ensures proper change control procedures are followed.Serves as one of the primary liaisons between IT and assigned business and/ or service units. Uses knowledge of business products, workflow and processes and service unit objectives to assist IT team members in solution development. Maintains a strong understanding of business priorities and objectives. Uses this knowledge to prioritize work while managing multiple complex assignments.Maintains current knowledge of insurance industry developments.Communicates effectively with team members, customers and stakeholders, both verbally and in writing.Responsible for working with project teams and end users to coordinate systems testing, training and support. Assists with review of test strategies, test plans, test cases and expected results. Performs post implementation evaluation of effectiveness of solution and works with team members to continually improve processes.Monitors and reports on progress against plan, escalating issues to IT management as appropriate.Requirements:Demonstrated proficiency with computer software including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, VisioStrong communication skills required for interaction with business partners and IT team members.Experience working in an Agile environmentEducation and Experience:Bachelor's degree or comparable, related work experience requiredComputer Science or IT qualifications preferredThe ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of related experience as a business/ systems analyst3+ years of experience combination of Production Support and Software Development as a business analystExperienced in financial reporting, regulatory reporting (i.e.: Medicare; NCCI; State reporting)Experienced with SQL serverBasic working knowledge with Microsoft .NET and JavaKnowledge of claims management (experience as a claim handler preferred), workflow and claims systems, preferably in specialty insurance segment is a plus2+ years of experience within an Agile/Scrum Environment and experience on enterprise level or strategic business projectsExperience in Property/ Casualty or Specialty insurance markets highly preferredCPCU, IIA Certifications or comparable insurance certification preferredCertificate in business analysis or comparable professional designation preferred

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Technical Business Analysis * SQL * EPIC Clarity * Healthcare * My client, a Healthcare company in Westwood is looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join their application development team. Ideal candidate should have experience in EPIC Clarity and SQL with a healthcare background. The tasks for this role include gathering business requirements to hep support internal applications, developing test cases to locate errors, running SQL queries to resolve issues with the database. You will also be working on multiple tasks with EPIC Clarity, so must have experience with EPIC Clarity in order to be qualified for this position. The development manager will be training this individual on how utilize Tableau. This is a great opportunity to work for the best healthcare firms in LA and learn technical tools. If you are interested in this opportunity, please call Assistant Vice President - Lead Recruiter Jimmy Escobar at (310) 209-6838 or Jimmy.Escobar@RHT.com Job Requirements *Technical Business Analysis *SQL - MUST *EPIC Clarity - MUST *Healthcare - MUST - provided by DiceAnalysis, Analyst, Business Analyst, Business Requirements, Database, Development, Development Manager, Epic, Manager, Recruiter, SQL

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: There is an opening for a Financial Analyst at a fast-growing, dynamic team via Accountemps ?the Financial Analyst will be a key business partner in forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management. This Financial Analyst role is a long term temporary employment opportunity and is located in the Boston, Massachusetts, area. Conducting financial modeling on various financial products, as well as measuring, analyzing and forecasting performance in conjunction with operating plans, will be among the Financial Analyst's duties. Among the Financial Analyst's other duties will be advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and preparing reports for management.  Your responsibilities Gather and oversee forecasting reportsEnable effective Business Intelligence (BI) to provide decision making supportWork with the Accounting group to lead the monthly and quarterly close processKeep up weekly, quarterly and annual Area/Segment level Bookings and P L forecastingResearch performance to date and assess potential risks and opportunitiesIdeal candidate would have an adaptable nature and experience dealing with vast amounts of information while exceeding expectationsManage monthly reporting to business partners on financial results and actions requiredWork with contacts in Accounting and Operations to support business plansParticipate in planning with senior executives on strategic deep dives by developing financial models and insights on topics such as: Retention forecasts, Campaign Planning Tracking, return on investment of strategic investments, event tracking and execution, strategic resource allocation, and prioritizationUnderstand and communicate internal and external drivers impacting performance and trendingMonitor monthly and quarterly performance by comparison of actuals versus expectations and enable business partners to handle their resources effectively

Name: Practice Business Analyst, Banking, Insurance & Capital Markets
Description: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant?s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant?s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  Navigant?s team of Banking, Insurance & Capital Markets professionals apply experience, clear thinking and teamwork to deliver pragmatic solutions to complex problems across the global banking, insurance, and investment management sectors. As a recognized and respected advisor to many leading organizations, our professionals provide consulting solutions to the foremost financial services organizations. Areas of specialty include operations and technology, regulatory compliance, risk management, strategy, business process management and operations and technology strategy and transformation. *Position Summary:** The Practice Business Analyst is responsible for providing comprehensive operational support to the Banking, Insurance, & Capital Markets (BICM) practice operations team.  This position will report directly to the BICM Practice Area Business Manager. This individual will interact directly with Practice Leadership, Operations Management, Human Capital, Finance and Accounting personnel. *Duties & Responsibilities:** + Support the resource management function by preparing regular staffing analyses, assisting with core staffing functions, examining weekly/monthly utilization, and understanding the profile of the professionals within the practice; serve as the practice liaison to coordinate project staffing decisions  + Manage the practice training program; coordinate new training development, organize training sessions, and compile training reports  + Provide oversight of the contingent workforce, including managing agency relationships, onboarding contingent staff, and executing contracts  + Support the onboarding of new consultants to the BICM Practice  + Support client-specific onboarding for large BICM engagements, working independently with client personnel on required contract administration activities  + Assist in the analysis and evaluation of Professional Development (PD) budgets  + Create interesting and innovative forms of communication to allow the management team to effectively reach the practice  + Develops, automates and streamlines reports and analyses to help manage the BICM practice  + Work to develop, analyze and evaluate new and novel analyses not otherwise produced  + Undergraduate business degree required (finance or accounting preferred)  + High level of Excel proficiency, plus a desire to quickly learn and master new systems  + Strong ability in broader Microsoft Office Suite, particularly PowerPoint  + Must exhibit an analytical mind, a strong intellectual curiosity and attention to detail  + Desire to learn, grow, and seek increased responsibility  + Ability to work closely and effectively in a team environment across all facets of the practice and company  + Demonstrate strong organizational skills with a history of automating or streamlining processes  + Ability to work independently and be self-motivated  + Interest in working in a dynamic setting and flexibility to manage time sensitive priorities  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment to coordinate work  + Frequently travels by airplane, train or car as necessary to perform work at another location  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  + Generally works in an office environment  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Navigant and Navigant will not be obligated to pay a placement fee._***Navigant** is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation. Navigant will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: BAIN CAPITAL OVERVIEW Bain Capital, LP is one of the world's leading private multi-asset alternative investment firms with more than $95 billion of assets under management that creates lasting impact for our investors, teams, businesses, and the communities in which we live. Since our founding in 1984, we've applied our insight and experience to organically expand into several asset classes including private equity, credit, public equity and venture capital. We leverage our shared platform to capture cross-asset class opportunities in strategic areas of focus. With offices on four continents, our global team aligns our interests with those of our investors for lasting impact. Identify areas of risk, while monitoring the current environment, potential improvement areas, and the financial implications of those decisions.Participate in user acceptance testing and support system training / documentation.Form strong working relationships with both business and technical teams.Fulfill responsibilities related to production support as well as application development projects simultaneously.Engage in complex problem solving with both business users and development resources.TECHNOLOGY EXPERIENCE:Experience with reporting, data visualization or analytics tools like Tableau, Qlik or CognosPrior experience with AWS or Azure data management tools a plusUnderstanding of relational databases, reporting schemas, data transformationsIntermediate skill level with SQL queries (writing as well as reading/understanding)Prior experience with Salesforce or other CRM systems a plusPrior experience with iLevel, Investran, eFront, Alta Return or other Private Equity systems a plusExperience in project management or managing regular software release cycles, working with support vendorsExperience with project reporting - status, milestones, deliverablesFamiliarity working within multiple architectures: n-tier, .NET, client-server, etc. and multi-system application integrationQUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors or advanced degree in computer science , systems and/or financeMaster's Degree with concentration in finance, technology or analytics preferred4+ Years of experienceExperience with private equity, venture capital and alternatives investment / finance concepts / terminology and systems a plusExperience with a functionally diverse, and informed user base that demands high quality solutionsSelf-motivated and willing to work, learn and take ownership in an energetic, fast pace team environmentStrong interpersonal skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsKnowledge of data management and analytics is requiredIn-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in supporting & implementing applicationsAbility to manage multiple projects and iterations with several applications simultaneouslyAbility to perform various roles (e.g., business analyst, systems analyst, data analyst, tester)History of developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures, and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines within an Agile environment.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst, Senior
Description: PTC Company Description PTC (Nasdaq: PTC) is a $1B+ global provider of technology platforms and enterprise applications for smart and connected products, operations, and systems. Our enterprise applications serve manufacturers and other businesses that create, operate and service products. Our award-winning ThingWorx technology platforms help companies achieve a “new reality” in smart, connected things and systems - deriving new value emerging from the “Internet of Things” market. An early pioneer in Computer Aided Design (CAD) software, PTC today employs more than 6,000 professionals serving more than 28,000 businesses worldwide. We are headquartered in Needham, MA. Region The Americas Subregion North America Country-City USA-Needham Business Title Business Analyst, Senior PTC Org CSS - Customer Success Job Description for Advertising Purposes Field Business Senior Business Analyst By joining our Field Business department (encompassing the entire sales, service and renewal customer experience) you will play a key role in PTC’s transformation to a world class provider of industrial IOT and AR technology solutions. We are looking for individuals who are eager to apply their abilities and passion for process and technology to be part of a team providing cutting edge business solutions.  The Business Systems team, within the Field Business Organization, is responsible for providing expertise and advice on technology and delivering solution development, configuration, maintenance and support for the various applications around CRM, web and BI analytics/reporting. Specifically, your areas of responsibility will include the Salesforce CRM platform and related applications that rely on the force.com platform. Your Day-To-Day As part of the Field Business team, you will engage with business partners across all aspects of customer success, from closing a deal through adoption, renewal and expansion. Members of our team obtain valuable experience and insights about the entire customer success business model by partnering with key stakeholders in our Field Business organization to understand strategic initiatives and business needs. Your challenge will be to convert that understanding into an action plan and user stories, and be part of the team that designs, develops, tests, and deploys solutions that support those initiatives. Skills and knowledgeApplied knowledge of CRM systems, preferably Salesforce, with a basic understanding of the various types of system users and how they use the system to perform their jobs to meet high-level business needsUnderstanding and experience with end to end system integrations and overall business system landscapesAbility to interpret documented business processes into application workflows and featuresHighly skilled communicator within a worldwide team of engineers, developers and managersUnderstanding of Agile methodologies and tools We believe that diversity of experience and background leads to better ideas and a stronger company. We encourage everyone to bring their unique perspectives to our team. Basic QualificationsBachelor’s degree and minimum 2 years of professional experience as a systems business analyst Job Req Number 29674BR Why Join Us and Benefits Summary PTC is a great place to work. Our culture is one of excellence, innovation, empowerment, and caring about our customers, communities, and employees. We have built an action oriented culture of integrity and trust, creating a sense of team spirit at both the departmental and company-wide level. At PTC, we have great employees and know that they are critical to the company’s success.  The Core Values we live by to achieve our success are: Customer SuccessExcellenceInnovation & EmpowermentIntegrity & ProfessionalismSocial Responsibility through Shared ValueTeamworkWinning We are looking to add strong candidates that uphold the PTC Core Values and are eager to grow and develop their careers with us. If you share these values and enjoy a work environment that is fast paced, hands on, and results oriented, then PTC is the place for you.  PTC benefits are among the most competitive in the industry. While your salary is the major component of your compensation, you also receive a competitive benefits package including: Retirement Savings Plan with Company MatchHealthcare and Dental insurancePaid Time Off and Sick TimeBirthday Day-offTuition Reimbursement (Canada, India, Israel, US)Holiday PayEmployee Referral ProgramManagement and Employee Training DevelopmentOther Regional-specific Benefits All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Apply!

Name: Business Analyst, Officer, Global Exchange
Description: Posting Description: The State Street Global Exchange (SSGX) team is look for qualified individuals with experience and industry knowledge to work with an offshore development team responsible for front office to back office data integrations on large client implementations. The Business Analyst (Officer) will be responsible for working with the off-shore development team, producing agile development stories and communicating effectively / efficiently with management. The successful candidate must be a quick and dedicate learner, strong communicator, and have a general understanding of the investment industry.  SSGX combines our unique capabilities in data and analytics to better serve our clients and build relationship with clients. Through information and insights investment analytics, data solutions, and front office tools our goal is to help our clients zero in on the opportunities and actions that will generate the most value for the SSGX front-to-back solution. We offer client solutions and implementation services that give our clients new functional capabilities that help drive efficiencies and new technical capabilities. We offer information, data management, and front-to-back office tools plus analytics to help clients achieve results and manage risk.  SSGX’s Client Solutions and Implementation team in Boston, MA is looking for qualified individuals to fill key roles in implementing the industry’s first ever front-to-back client servicing platform. Primary Responsibilities:Work with client implementation workstreams to organize and design integration plans for large client implementation effortsContribute to integration architecture design in conjunction with multiple workstreams including potential on site client workshops and internal State Street design sessionsEffectively manage the requirements development, prioritization, an communication process with an offshore development team in an agile development environmentWork with product strategy teams to align client-specific integration plans with strategic product development roadmapsDesign / develop reusable integration tools for future client integrationsEngage and work iteratively with both internal testing teams and client end users to support end to end testingQualifications: State Street considers all disciplines when hiring for a job and seeks out candidates who demonstrate the following: 3+ years of experience in IT development with financial applications, preferably in portfolio management and trading systems. Familiarity with roles and processes in investment lifecycle is a plus.Knowledge of ETL tools (ex: Pentaho Kettle)Knowledge of file transfer scheduling systems (ex: Autosys / iDeliver)Experience in requirements analysis and system designMust be able to manage a development team in an agile environmentExperience with managing development testing cyclesDesired Qualifications or Skills:Ability to communicate effectively and in a professional manner both written and orallyBe a team leader with a positive attitude, enthusiasm, initiative, and self-motivation.Must have the ability to multi-task and meet aggressive timelinesExperience of working in a financial industry and regulatory initiativesLocation: Boston, MA based

Name: Grant Administrator/Financial Analyst
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT: Under the guidance of the Administrative Director of the Translational and Clinical Research Centers (TCRC) of the Massachusetts General Hospital, the Grant Manager/Financial Analyst will develop into the point person for fiscal and post award research affairs of the Center's research activities. This position requires skillful interface and diplomacy with the faculty and administration of the TCRC, all of its users, research management and other-related hospital and corporate entities.  T h e incumbent will work closely with the Administrative Director (AD) to optimize operational and costefficiencies wherever possible. He/she should possess a basic knowledge of health care reimbursement and compliance, contract management, clinical trial operations, and sponsored project policiesand management. The positionrequires discretion and judgment to organize priorities, complete tasks and handle confidential information. This positionrequires skillful interface and diplomacy with study sponsors, project PIs, study staff, research management and other-related hospital and corporateentities.  PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Pre-Award Assist with the preparation of research proposals, awards and transactions related to grant/ contract management. Prepare budgets; helps customers to ensure proposal compliance with Hospital and grantor policies and procedures, as well as those of subcontracting institutions. Maintain grant, contract and sponsored research agreements in shared electronic files in compliance with institutional and research sponsor policies. Facilitate implementation of grant awards by obtaining fund numbers, activating salary assignments to grants, and other associated tasks. Interacts with PI, Clinical Trials Office (CTO), and Research Management in the Insight proposal submission process; uploads required documents; respond to Research Management questions and concerns. Identifies potential budget, procedural, and/or policy issues affecting grant submissions and work with investigators to resolve issues. Post-Award Maintain timely coordination and communication with involved parties regarding grants management issues. Prepare new fund activation requests, monitor fund balances and close out expired funds in a timely fashion. Monitor award/ agreement milestones, payment schedules and payments. In coordination with Research Finance, oversee contract billing, receivables and receipt of funds. Assist with progress reports and other grant-related reporting activities. Responsible for the timely closeout of all expired projects through the coordination of fiscal resources. Prepare cost transfers, No Cost Extension requests, Residual Balance Transfers and rebudgeting according to institutional and sponsor policies. Verify Financial Status Reports and subcontract invoices for accuracy. Finance Ensure financial integrity of the Center with accurate and timely accounts reconciliation and approve travel vouchers, invoices, procurements, reimbursements to employees, credit card activities with proper justification. Prepare budget forecasting; conduct ongoing monitoring of fund statements; resolve accounting problems and errors. Provide fiscal and grant support to the Center, including monthly reporting, planning, budgeting and trend analysis. Provide administrative support and fiscal oversight for the Center's Research Cores. Responsible for billing management of the Center's Research Cores Responsible for contract billing and receivables for clinical trials that are managed in the Center. Maintain Center fiscal record keeping system and develop monthly status reports of research funds. Communicate with Accounts Payable, Research Management, Research Finance, Payroll, Clinical Trial Office and other departments as needed for financial and grant related issues, including fund creation, closeouts, transfers, contracts, purchase orders, and all other grant and financial processes. Assist Administrative Director with identification and prevention of projected overruns and for the resolution of projects in deficit situation. Initiate mechanisms of budget control and assist in implementation on short and long-term basis. Advise regarding the allowability of costs to be charged to programs. Review appropriateness of transactions and budget reallocations against funding source guidelines. Work with AD and Research Finance to resolve complex accounting issues. Responsible for the interpretation and articulation of institutional and sponsor policies and procedures to ensure compliance. Responsible for proactively keeping departments apprised of changes in policies and regulations of federal and non-federal grantor agencies. MGH/NCI FedShare Proton Beam Program With the Sr. Administrative Director for MGH Research Management, assist in administration and oversight of the MGH/NCI FedShare Proton Beam Program. Ensure the program is in compliance with the terms of the MOU. Prepares financial, proposed use and progress reports required by the MOU for submission to NCI. Working with Radiation Oncology and Cancer Center administrative leadership, and the Federal Share Committee, coordinates the process for annual selection, notification and management of new and continuing projects, in accordance with MOU terms and conditions. Provides financial oversight to projects funded by the Federal Share. Point of contact for MGH FedShare investigators, Radiation Oncology research administration, and Partners Research Management to answer questions relating to the program Other MGH Research Management special projects/reports as requested. As needed, work with AD and Center Medical Directors to coordinate grant submission; prepares budgets and budget justification; ensures proposal compliance with Hospital and grantor policies and procedures  Perform/coordinate special projects for Administrative Director or Center/Department as may arise from time-to-time.  Other duties as assigned Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS: BA/BS in business or related field. 1-3 years experience in research management, research finance and/or related field is required SKILLS/ ABILITIES/ COMPETENCIES REQUIRED: Strong spreadsheet and database skills. Strong communication and analytical skills. Meticulous attention to detail as well as overall aspects of job performance. Excellent written and oral communication skills Flexibility to learn new tasks on a regular basis Ability to work independently and as a member of a team Exceptional organizational skills and ability to handle multiple tasks and deadline pressures Ability to prioritize tasks effectivelyEEO Statement Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged. Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Description: Job DescriptionBoston, MA 7+ years’ experience working as a Business Analyst in Cap Mkts domain o Understanding of Investment Banking and Asset Management  o Knowledge of capital markets & financial instruments – Equities, Derivatives, Fixed Income, FX. When Citadel enters into a partnership, it is a serious business commitment to provide the best possible resources to ensure the success of our clients. We realize that these partnerships are critical to meeting our client’s needs, and sound business relationships are key to our continued success in this highly competitive industry. We are committed to providing technical solutions to meet the challenges in information technology with maximum cost effectiveness. Professional EXPERTISE: Citadel can provide experienced professionals in most technical disciplines for complete project life cycle support and/or management. Our staff consists of experts in all information systems job functions. We can provide complete project teams including seasoned Project Managers for local project outsourcing, staff supplementation to enhance your existing operations, or off-shore project support.

Name: Data Analyst, Sr. - Physician Payment Analyst, Sr.
Description: Reporting to the Senior Director of Physician Analytics for the MGPO/BWPO, the Analyst II provides advanced analytics to support contract proposals with third party payers/government payers; develops financial models to support physician negotiations and rate implementation; works independently to design and create databases and develop data reporting systems; and researches physician reimbursement and policy issues. Other specific responsibilities include the following:  Collect, analyze and model financial data to forecast impact of payer proposals and yearly fee updates on physician revenues. Review and analyze PHS risk contracts, including Medicare's RVU data, to determine adequacy of negotiated target. Manage projects as it relates to the coordination of data and information across the POs, hospitals, PHS, and/or the physician practices. Represent the project to senior leadership and physician councils. Provide comparative payer data to physician groups to aid in decision making processes regarding rates and contracts. Research Medicare, Medicaid and other payer reimbursement issues, including new technologies and procedures. Research new opportunities for participation in Medicare Pilots such as bundles, etc. Report the findings of such research, including positive and negative impact to physician payment and reimbursement, as well as proposed solutions. Support PHS Contracting in the development of system-wide contract strategies. Work on special projects as assigned.QualificationsEducation : Bachelor's degree in related field is required. Masters in Healthcare Administration or Public Health preferred.Experience : Minimum 3-5 years healthcare/analytic experience. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple responsibilities in complex environment. Working knowledge of physician reimbursement, medical terminology, ICD 9, CPT and HCPCS coding preferred. Payer experience a plus Superior quantitative analytical and problem solving skills. Strong organizational and project management skills with attention to detail to manage multiple projects under aggressive deadlines. Expertise in managing, interpreting, reporting and presenting data to all levels of management. Must be self-directed and self-motivated. Able to work independently and as a part of a team. Able to respond to changing situations and manage time appropriately to meet deadlines. Thorough understanding of RBRVS payment methodology in conjunction with other physician payment systems preferred. Proficiency in Access or other relational databases required. Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and Word also desired. Experience with designing advanced data visualizations, and some familiarity with visualization software (e.g. QlikView or Tableau) Good research skills. Business Intelligence Software experience preferred.EEO Statement Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged.  Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Description: 7770 - Epic Kaleidoscope AnalystJob Title:Sr JDA Consultant (In-Person Interview Required)Reference Number:7770Location:Boston, MAType:ContractOur healthcare client is seeking a Kaleidoscope Applications Coordinator that will be responsible for the configuration of Epic Ambulatory/Kaleidoscope Applications.*** In-Person Interview Required *** This role works collaboratively with both technical and business-oriented project team members to scope, design, and configure solutions in Epic. Name: CBO Business Analyst I
Description: As a not-for-profit organization, Partners HealthCare is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women's Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.  We're focused on a people-first culture for our system's patients and our professional family. That's why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Partners HealthCare is committed to aligning our employees' personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal developmentand we recognize success at every step.  Our employees use the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.  General Overview  Working under the general direction of the Manager/Director, the CBO Analyst is responsible for analyzing payer denials, work queues, quality and KPI metrics. As part of the CBO team, the CBO Analyst will participate in RCO process improvement initiatives.  Principal Duties and Responsibilities Key contributor in a high-profile group responsible for collection of the AR by resolving problems resulting in delayed collection activity.Operate independently while conducting reviews of high volume denials both intra and inter departmental to find root cause to influence workflow and process efficiencies.Develop and create EPIC and payer 'Tip Sheets' designed to support transparent processes across the CBO.Preview and log EPIC E-Care ticket request and Huron change requests.Participate in projects related to RCO process improvement initiatives.Document and update process and procedures of CBO Third Party teams.Execute audits of unit QC and productivity performance in accordance with established policies.Provide elbow support and training of EPIC system functions.Provide high level analytical support to Director, Manager and Supervisors.QualificationsBachelors or equivalent experience and training required2-4 years relevant experience in a health care setting desired.Alternative work experience or training in lieu of experience may be considered. Skills/Abilities/Competencies Proficient with Epic HB, PB and SBO systems either due to prior training or through a combination of training classes or peer-to-peer training. Formal training of 20 hours with 6 8 weeks of peer to peer training is typical.Proficient in Excel and Access highly desired, high intermediate required. Intermediate skills in Outlook, Microsoft Suite and Visio needed to perform all range of assignments.Knowledgeable on Third Party Insurance and Medicare Billing Regulations including basic Medicare and Secondary Payer (MSP).Ability to work independently and initiate activities required to complete assignmentsAbility to meet deadlines and excel in a fast-paced environmentEffective communications, organizational and problem-solving skillsAbility to manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously.SDL2017

Name: Principal Applications Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description: Purpose: This position is for a recognized subject matter expert in the Enterprise Systems sub-family. Responsibility Statement:The Principal Analyst, Business Intelligence (BI) is a technical role responsible for architecting and maintaining a high performing and agile reporting environment. Principal Analyst will also work with project managers, developers and business users to define prioritize and create new projects, reports, dash-boards or add new data elements.Coordinates technical and non-technical staff to gather requirements and develop system requirement definitions. Experience with preferably Oracle BI portfolio including Hyperion but familiarity with Cognos, PowerBI, SSRS or Tableau considered valuable.Hands-on experience using SQL and PL/SQL for performing data profiling, formatting, and ad-hoc data analysis.Experience with creating reports, dashboards, and/or summarizing large amounts of data into actionable intelligence to drive business decisions.Mastery of BI development methodologies and project management skills.Strong problem solving and analytical skills with a hands-on practical approach.Team player with strong communications and interpersonal skills.Education: Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems, or similar discipline or equivalent work experience.
