Name: Quality Assurance/Business Analyst - Insurance Development Team
Description: Quality Assurance/Business Analyst - Insurance Development TeamThe Insurance Team supports the development of the Eagle STAR Insurance product. Eagle’s STAR Insurance product is a proven solution for statutory reporting needs for insurance clients. You will focus mainly on quality assurance testing of insurance development items in all software release types (Major, Enhancement/Service Pack, JetFix) as requested. Candidate will be responsible for recreating issues in multiple software environments to validate enhancements and defect correction, and on-going build out of regression test bed. In addition, working with Product Owner to address any gaps in testing suites or product. As a member of the Insurance development team, candidate will also assist in the creation and refinement of user stories and acceptance criteria of development items to meet program increment objectives under the guidance of the Insurance Product Owner. Qualifications: Demonstrated success over 2 to 4+ years as a business or quality assurance analyst in the financial services industry with specific experience in Mutual Fund or Investment Accounting, Insurance regulatory reporting a plus Background in Eagle’s Accounting product is a big plus Understanding of Agile Team Methodologies a plus Demonstrates strong analytical and problem solving skills Experience with MS Office is essential Excellent communication skills Basic SQL query skill is a plus Team player – must have ability to work as a member of small team and interact with different groups in the organization On-going commitment to expanding ones business and technology expertise BS/BA degree in Business Administration (Accounting or Finance), or Information Technology … or equivalent/relevant work experience; Advanced degree a plus To apply for this role click https://jobs.bnymellon.com/jobs/1807822?lang=en-us. For any questions on this role, please contact us a careers@eagleinvsys.com.

Name: Business Analyst, Manager- Medical IT
Description: Manager, Medical IT28-Nov-2018LocationUS-MA-Cambridge Job DescriptionThe Medical team provides scientific and medical expertise for late stage development and post market support for Biogen’s drugs for both internal and external customers. The person in this role leads the information technology strategy and implementation for systems used by scientists, physicians and disease experts, who review, prepare and present information to answer questions from healthcare providers, internal groups and patient services and oversee late stage (Phase IV) clinical trials. The lead in this role will partner to support digital innovation and process improvements to systems and services including CRM, Medical Information, content management, collaboration, data analysis, and knowledge bases used by the Global Medical team to develop and share accurate and up-to-date information about Biogen’s sciences and products.1. Business analysis planning and monitoring• Conduct IT resource planning• Conduct system impact analysis and initial project plan2. Name: Private Equity Analyst
Description: About SFA:Search Fund Accelerator ("SFA") is an innovative private equity firm designed to optimize a niche investment model known as a Search Fund. SFA provides support and capital to entrepreneurs seeking to acquire, manage and grow a single business as CEO. Our entrepreneurs have experience in investment banking, consulting and private equity, and are alumni of top business schools including Harvard, Columbia and Yale. Analyst Program:Private Equity Analysts support SFA's entrepreneurs to identify and acquire a business. Analysts will learn about a variety of industries, business models, company valuation methods and research techniques. Our Analyst Program also includes frequent workshops and events.Location: All analysts must work in our office in Boston, MA. We do not hire remote/virtual analysts.Start Date: Immediate start or hired on a rolling basis Responsibilities:Industry Generation: Identify & evaluate industry niches Lead Generation: Screen potential target acquisitions & interface with brokers/bankers to source opportunitiesDeal Evaluation: Analyze financial statements & business modelsDue Diligence: Conduct commercial & financial due diligence on acquisition targetsTeam Management: Lead the entrepreneur's team The Analyst Program at SFA provides analysts with experience that is applicable in every corner of the business arena. Our alumni have continued their careers at firms such as: Goldman Sachs, Bain Capital, Bain & Co, McKinsey & Co, Deloitte, EY, JMI Equity, UBS, Silicon Valley Bank, Deutsche Bank, Loomis, Sayles & Co, Liberty Mutual, Bank of America and Morgan Stanley.More information: http://www.searchfundaccelerator.com/analystsRequirementsThe Analyst Program requires a commitment of 40 hours/week for at least 6-12 months.Required Qualifications:Recently graduated from university.At least one prior internship experience.An entrepreneurial, energetic, optimistic attitudeStrong analytical abilities and attention to detailExcellent English communication skills, both written and oralA keen interest in finance and entrepreneurshipA strong work ethicA good understanding of financial statementsHelpful Qualifications:A business-related majorFinancial modeling skillsExperience in search funds or private equityBenefitsCompensation:Analysts are compensated at the prevailing hourly minimum wage and are entitled to health benefits.Engaging Atmosphere- Entrepreneurial culture - Headquarters in Boston's Back Bay Developing Skills- Technical & career workshops - Mentorship from entrepreneurs Networking Opportunities- Professionals with experience in PE, IB & consulting Building Careers- Hands-on leadership experience

Name: Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAre you interested in research and data analysis? Does working for schools, colleges, and universities at all levels appeal to you? Do you like working with data to gather insights and make decisions? Do you work well in a team environment? What we want you to do Maguire Associates is looking for Analysts who will help our clients succeed. This is a full-time position where you’ll use your research and data skills in a range of assignments that support our two main business lines, which include research-based consulting and predictive modeling. To be more specific, here are some of the things that you’ll do: Help design and analyze custom research that provides insight on stakeholder perceptions and needsCreate statistical models that help colleges and universities decide how to spend millions of dollars in financial aid in order to meet their enrollment goalsDesign predictive models to help institutions understand the factors that predict student application, enrollment, and retentionRefine and shape data files to maximize their ability to answer research questionsUse secondary data to advise colleges and universities with new academic program offeringsTalk to clients and advise them on research insights and strategyWho you are You are someone who has interests in education, quantitative research, and statistical methods. Qualifications:Master’s preferred in social science or another field where data analysis has been an important part of your educationProficiency in Microsoft Office and quantitative statistics packages like SPSS, SAS, or R; or knowledge of any programming languageExperience with multivariate data analysis, such as multiple regression, logistic regression, or machine learning algorithmsWho we are Maguire Associates is based in Concord, MA, and is a premier research-based consulting firm that serves the education industry. Since our founding in 1983, we have served more than 600 private and public colleges and universities, K-12 schools, educational consortia, educational service providers, and government organizations focused on education. We offer a highly collaborative, intellectually interesting, casual environment where you’ll have an immediate impact on our work for our clients. What to do next To apply, submit your resume and cover letter to jobs@maguireassoc.com. In your cover letter, tell us how you’ve used research to test a hypothesis or inform a decision. Maguire Associates offers competitive compensation and employee benefits, and is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer.Company DescriptionMaguire Associates is based in Concord, MA, and is a premier research-based consulting firm that serves the education industry. Since our founding in 1983, we have served more than 600 private and public colleges and universities, K-12 schools, educational consortia, educational service providers, and government organizations focused on education. We offer a highly collaborative, intellectually interesting, casual environment where you’ll have an immediate impact on our work for our clients.

Name: Data Analyst I
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT: \ The Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) Corrigan Minehan Heart Center and Cardiovascular Research Center is seeking a highly motivated individual to work on multiple clinical and translational research projects focused on cardiovascular disease.  This Statistical Data Analyst position offers the opportunity to work directly with the Senior Investigator in the Division of Cardiology at MGH as part of a collaborative multidisciplinary team of clinicians, scientists, and trainees. The candidate will have the opportunity to lead data analyses for projects related to heart disease, and to leverage conventional and advanced approaches to analyze large unique high-dimensional complex databases of human data. Responsibilities will include developing research protocols, compiling data, managing databases, conducting statistical analyses, validating programming and reporting output in numerical and graphic formats under the supervision of the PIs. The candidate will need a thorough understanding of data/information quality principles in medical data management, as well as manipulation and interpretation of large databases in an academic medical center environment.  The candidate will contribute to the preparation and presentation of research results and publications and will help coordinate collaborative research activities with investigators locally and at other institutions across the U.S. and other countries around the world. The successful candidate is highly motivated, scientifically inquisitive, and thrives in an academic/professional atmosphere, where interdisciplinary teams are central to project success. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The Statistical Data Analyst has the following duties and responsibilities: Actively lead the data analysis for a set of projects related to heart diseaseWork closely with investigators to ensure analytical activities are within scope, timeline, and reach the overall aims of the collaborationContribute to study design as well as creation and implementation of analytical plans for specific research projects or a set of research projects.Contribute to the preparation and presentation of research results in the form of oral presentations at meetings and conferences as well as in the form of original research publications.Coordinate collaborative data analysis related activities with investigators within other Harvard departments and at other institutions across the U.S., and Europe .Regularly and proactively communicate accomplishments and progress at project team meetingsParticipate actively in mentorship of research team members and trainees to foster a culture of scientific excellenceConducts primary data analyses using SAS and other statistical analysis softwareConducts quality control of programming and statistical modelsAssists with other research-related tasks as neededQualificationsSKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED: The Statistical Data Analyst should have the following skills and competencies:  · This position requires a Masters degree in biostatistics, epidemiology, or public health  · Knowledge of epidemiology and biostatistical methods, including survival analysis, scientific research design, database management  · Strong experience in statistical programming and ability to use software systems like SAS or STATA, ability to develop macros and do statistical computing using R is a plus  · Experience working with epidemiological or clinical trial databases  · Excellent English oral and written communication skills are required.  · Candidate must be highly organized and have precise attention to detail.  · Able to multitask and assign priorities in a busy, start-up like environment.  · Excellent interpersonal skills are required for working with a dynamic team.  · Ability to demonstrate professionalism and respect for subjects' rights and individual needs.  · Ability to multi-task and prioritize responsibilities LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, and/or REGISTRATIONS: · Latest SAS certificate preferred EDUCATION: · Minimum education required Masters degree in biostatistics, epidemiology, or public health EXPERIENCE: · Preferred 1 year of relevant work experience SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: · May assist with the mentorship of research trainees and training and orienting of new staff. FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY: · None WORKING CONDITIONS: · Duties will be performed in an office and hospital setting. EEO Statement Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged.  Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Name: Client Quantitative Analyst I
Description: Job Description: Description:  Responsible for transforming data into meaningful information that supports Small Business Products and Services strategies and tactics. This role will report to the manager of Small Business Products and Services Analytics. The primary focus will be on using statistical and other analytic methods to deepen Small Business relationships and improve client product and services adoption. Identify opportunities for product deepening with new and existing Small Business relationships that result in increased profitability.Execute observational studies and randomized experiments to identify key drivers of client acquisition and profitability.Independently seek and gather relevant study information, via discussions with subject matter experts, analytics peers, or internal/external research.Communicate study options, their tradeoffs and results in a clear and concise manner.Analyze customer and product behavior to identify relevant trends and opportunities for relationship deepening.Collaborate with multiple functional groups including Analytics, Finance, Model Risk Management, Legal, Compliance, and TechnologyManage and prioritize tasks, complete project documentation, deliver high quality analyses, and present results to multiple teams and business partners.Self-manage large efforts with project plans, communicating timelines and progress to stakeholders. Qualifications/Required skills:BS Degree in Statistics, Math, Economics or related analytical field.3+ years experience in applied statistical analysis (DOE/observational studies) and/or model development.3+ years experience in a marketing or business analysis role.Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).Proficient in SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide, SQL, MS Excel and PowerPoint.Ability to navigate complex data environments and manipulate large data sets to identify relevant insights.Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently.Self-motivation, self-direction, and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities without sacrificing quality or timelines.Attention to detail.Desired skills:Banking / Financial analysis work experience.Knowledge and usage of key Bank data sources (e.g. W data warehouse).JMP, R experience, CART techniques a plus.Small Business banking experience & product knowledge a plus.MBA or MS in Statistics a plus.

management and field best practicesBackground and Experience:3+ years’ experience within Sales Operations, preferably in a SaaS-based or software companyExperience working with Executive Leadership in a fast-paced environment a plusExperience with Salesforce.com (CPQ) a strong plusExperience with Demand Tools (CRM Fusion) a strong plusExceptional work ethic with high energy to multi-task and meet tight deadlines

Name: Credit Analyst II
Description: Rockland Trust is currently seeking a Credit Analyst II in our Boston Office. The Credit Department is an integral part of the Commercial Lending function. Its members are trained professionals and its function is to provide detailed reports outlining the financial condition of prospective and present borrowers. This is a vital part of the process of arriving at lending decisions that provide working capital to generate economic growth in the community and represent profitable business and reasonable credit risk for Rockland Trust.  Credit Analyst II's handle the larger and more complex loans for both commercial & industrial as well as real estate. Also acts as a training resource for junior analysts. Analysts arrive at their recommendations through analyzing financial reports and other information. Lending recommendations are based on the complete analysis of a businesses’ financial condition, cash flow, capacity, collateral and its ability to repay. Required Skills:Strong analytical skillsFamiliarity with computerized spreadsheets and Microsoft Windows applicationsExcellent report writing skills are essentialMust be able to establish and maintain effective working relationshipsMay be required to lift and/or move up to 20 poundsRequired Experience:At least three years direct experienceBachelor degree in accounting, finance or economics Our goal is to offer our colleagues the most generous benefits package possible. We strive to provide colleagues with a comprehensive benefits package and an environment that supports a healthy work-life balance. Benefits include: Competitive compensation with performance incentive awards, Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, a 401K and DC Plan for your retirement, LTD & Life Insurance, Vacation Time, Day Care Reimbursement, Tuition Assistance for graduate and undergraduate programs, an Award Winning Wellness program and much more!  At Rockland Trust you'll find a respectful and inclusive environment where everyone is given the chance to succeed. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Name: Revenue Cycle Bus Analyst
Description: Scope of Position  The Business Services Team is part of the MGH Patient Access Services Department and is comprised of operations analysts, project managers, and training specialists. Its goal is to enhance operational practices by leading process improvement initiatives. Under the general direction of the Senior Manager of the Business Services Team, the Revenue Cycle Operations Analyst will be a key contributor on departmental projects; navigating Front End Revenue Cycle operations, providing support on Epic System / Health Information Systems activities, developing functional specifications and business requirements, analyzing data trends and key performance indicators, preparing and executing project plans, and coordinating project implementation. The major focus of this role will be to help structure denial / financial clearance revenue cycle initiatives. The role with interact with multiple Partners Healthcare related revenue groups (i.e. PHS Central Billing Office).  Principal Duties and Responsibilities  Supports project management tasks for all process improvement engagements, with a focus on streamlining front end financial clearance operations.  Functions as a revenue cycle subject matter and front end financial clearance expert, working closely with back end users to develop process improvement solutions utilizing both a qualitative and quantitative analysis process.  Generates weekly and monthly denial reports to perform root cause analysis and help facilitate process improvement initiatives to reduces hospital denials and increase net revenue.  Completes operational functions associated with all financial clearance requirements including work queue management, prior authorization requirements, etc.  Identifies new process improvement projects through data / operations analysis and completion of administrative functions.  Acts as a liaison between the front end and back end billing users to ensure accurate reimbursement is being applied to all MGH hospital accounts.  Attends all PHS and MGH denial / revenue cycle related meetings with the intention of presenting root cause analysis and implementing action plans based off hospital denial trends.  Provides user support for Epic, Huron, and other systems used by departmental staff.  Communicates project status and prepares project documentation as needed (e.g., project plan, status reports, meeting minutes, and project documentation).  Prepares functional design documents and/or technical specifications that meet the needs of the user and are technically feasible. This includes both hardware and software needs assessment and proposals.  Manages the system request changes for Epic application and others as purchased. Provides the management teams with status reports.  Organizes and attends meetings, documenting minutes, key decisions, next steps, and outcomes.  Manages issues, including prioritization, resolution tracking, and communication of critical issues.  Possible projects include but are not limited to: system upgrades and enhancements; capacity management; front-end revenue initiatives including registration and financial clearance processes improvement. Qualifications Education  Bachelor's Degree (Required)  Experience  Experienced in EPIC Grand Central / Prelude and Hospital Billing applications, including but not limited to Build, Support, and Operation  Prior work experience in hospital or other healthcare environment  Knowledge of third party payers  Knowledge of ICD-10 and CPT coding (preferred)  2-3 years of experience  Skills and Abilities:  High-quality analytical and problem-solving skills  Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills  Ability to develop relationships and work collaboratively with all levels of hospital employees with attention to detail; customer focus; and a tolerance for ambiguity, changing priorities, and unexpected events  Ability to work both independently and in a cross-functional team environment  Motivated with a high degree of initiative, a quick-learner, and have the capability to manage multiple priorities  Proficiency in personal computer and desktop applications, in particular a command of Microsoft Office applications: Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Word, and SharePoint EEO Statement Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged.  Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Position Description:  Mathematica is a nationally recognized research organization that conducts social policy studies on health care, disability, education, welfare, nutrition, and related topics. Our mission is to improve public well-being by bringing the highest standards of quality, objectivity, and excellence to bear on the work we do for our clients, which include federal, state, and local government agencies, as well as private foundations.  We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to leverage enterprise data and BI techniques as part of our data science and engineering (DSE) group in the Health division. The BI Analyst will provide direct project support for project management and technical assistance, and they will support the DSE leadership team in executing and managing initiatives. Responsibilities:Support the development and monitoring of a business intelligence planWork collaboratively with data science and engineering leadership to conduct business intelligence activities in service of using data to make informed decisionsDevelop metrics for business intelligence outcomes and monitor these metrics to ensure performance in this areaProvide project management and technical assistance services for a wide range of projects in the health unitMentor junior programmers on tasks that require data manipulation, visualization, and analysisPosition Requirements: Requirements:Bachelors degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a relevant field; Masters degree in data science, computer science, engineering, mathematics, or statistics preferred1 to 2 years of experience in a policy research firm, preferably a firm with collaboration across different functional areas (e.g., data analytics, health and human services research)Demonstrated ability to apply concepts in business intelligence to improve operational decision makingExperience designing and implementing business intelligence solutions using MicroStrategy, QlikView, Tableau, and/or Cognos softwareWorking knowledge in Web Technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), knowledge in frameworks such as Angular or Ember and visualization libraries such as D3 is a plusExposure to applied data mining, machine learning, predictive modeling, or other data intensive analytic modelingExperience with analytical programming languages (such as SAS, Python and R), SQL; experience using Java, C++, Perl, and other modern programming languages in the deployment of advanced analyticsExcellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate model results, design specifications, and technical information to internal and external audiences possessing a widely varying level of analytical sophistication We offer our employees a stimulating, team-oriented work environment, competitive salaries, and a comprehensive benefits package, as well as the advantages of employee ownership. We provide generous paid time off (and an on-site fitness center).  Various federal agencies with whom we contract require that staff successfully undergo a background investigation or security clearance as a condition of working on the project. If you are assigned to such a project, you will be required to obtain the requisite security clearance.  To apply, please submit cover letter, resume, transcript, salary expectation, and location preference. Available Locations: Princeton, NJ; Washington, DC; Cambridge, MA We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Product Owner / Business Analyst
Description: Our client is a leader in the financial services industry, with business operations in dozens of countries around the world. This company is a market leader with over two centuries of experience and manages over $200 billion in assets. In addition, this position will be responsible for gathering requirements for report requests and then the design, creation, maintenance and dissemination of those reports.  Qualified candidates will act as a master security officer for both local and remote locations; as well as liaison with other departments for interface, operational and data requirements relating to the Pharmacy Systems and Pharmacy Operations. This role requires the capability to independently manage operational aspects of the computer systems, including installation, configuration, local and remote location management, network connectivity, and system archiving and retrieval. The incumbent will provide support training to new and existing system users, establish and/or maintain Pharmacy Systems documentation, and be required to be on-call 24/7, on a rotating basis. Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: The pricing analyst is responsible for supporting the Pricing team at ProfitWell. The main responsibilities of the Pricing Analyst are:  - Communicating with clients via email and conference call  - Creating summary documents for the purposes of client education  - Creating surveys for the purposes of data collection  - Consolidating and analyzing data collected from surveys in Microsoft Excel  - Developing pricing strategy recommendations based on data analysis  Main Responsibilities Communication: Strong oral and written communication skills are required for the position of pricing analyst. The pricing analyst is responsible for communicating with client partner teams via email and conference call on a regular basis. In addition to communicating with clients, the pricing analyst is expected to communicate honestly and openly with other members of the client services team in the interest of organizing responsibilities and delegating tasks. Communicating with the Price Intelligently Sales Team will be necessary for the purposes of onboarding new clients into the engagement process. Data Analysis: The pricing analyst is responsible for developing an experimental design that includes survey creation and distribution. Survey data is collected within a proprietary application and fed through proprietary algorithms to produce raw workable data; the analyst is responsible for organizing and consolidating the raw data into client education documents that explain the pricing study findings and their implications. Client Support: A primary responsibility of the pricing analyst is to ensure that our clients feel supported in their partnership with ProfitWell. The pricing analyst, as an extension of the Pricing team, is responsible for facilitating an environment where our clients feel supported long after the final deliverable has been given to the client. The pricing analyst is expected to work with the Pricing team in matters of answering client questions and supporting clients through price testing and strategic implementation. Decreased delivery time? Developed a better process?) Qualitatively: Skilled at data analysis, reporting, and presentationsDemonstrated experience in interacting with C-level executivesA strong conviction in output with at least in SaaS or a related field. Works well in a team (we want missionaries here, not mercenaries) and be prepared to prove this. A knowledge for the technical & data side of software, the current market shifts, and certain nuances that accompany themCan take all sorts of feedback, coaching, and criticism while maintaining a strong declaration in their abilitiesExceptional communication skills including tact and diplomacyProactive in problem solving, comfortable with completing tasks with some level of ambiguityAbility to quickly understand and demonstrate technology and business value propositions.A sharp focus on your goalsA powerful work ethicStreet smartsThe ability and desire to advance the mission of ProfitWellBenefitsWhy ProfitWell? At ProfitWell, you’ll learn more than you ever thought imaginable amongst a team that’s incredibly passionate about their mission to help SaaS companies grow through pricing, analytics, and retention tools.  Perks: Time when you need it - flexible hours and vacationFully-stocked break rooms with complimentary food and drinksAll the gear to help you be successfulDog-friendly officeFrequent company and team outings, including kayaking, hiking, retreats, trivia, and other events put together to bond and blow off steamOpportunity to work with top software brands Benefits: Competitive salary and bonus structureEquity in a thriving company with no outside ownership. Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Business Systems Analyst. We are open to talent who are interested in our office in either Farmington, CT or Canton, MA.  As a key member of our IT division, you will have an opportunity to be a part of an experienced, focused, innovative team of IT professionals that span the U.S. As a Senior Business Systems Analyst you will serve on Agile teams and be charged to take on the role of a product owner in additional to being an expert in delivering quality technical solutions to complex user needs. Responsibilities:The Senior Business Systems Analyst conducts detailed research in order to transform business requirements into precise, high quality user stories or functional specifications.Responsible for eliciting, analyzing, documenting and validating business requirements and recommending solutions in support of business needs and overall IT strategies. Recognizes improvement opportunities and effectively presents recommendations to stakeholders. Accurately identifies, defines and communicates business problem and solution scope.Produces business requirements documents, diagrams, use case modeling, business process and workflow modeling for complex assignments.Leads requirements elicitation and review sessions with customers and IT stakeholders. Creates a product backlog based on defined Epics and User Stories. Works closely with development team members in the process of analyzing business requirements and evaluating possible solutions. Ensures questions/ issues are addressed. Manages approval and estimation process. Manages requests for change and ensures proper change control procedures are followed.Serves as one of the primary liaisons between IT and assigned business and/ or service units. Uses knowledge of business products, workflow and processes and service unit objectives to assist IT team members in solution development. Maintains a strong understanding of business priorities and objectives. Uses this knowledge to prioritize work while managing multiple complex assignments.Maintains current knowledge of insurance industry developments.Communicates effectively with team members, customers and stakeholders, both verbally and in writing.Responsible for working with project teams and end users to coordinate systems testing, training and support. Assists with review of test strategies, test plans, test cases and expected results. Performs post implementation evaluation of effectiveness of solution and works with team members to continually improve processes.Monitors and reports on progress against plan, escalating issues to IT management as appropriate.Requirements:Demonstrated proficiency with computer software including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, VisioStrong communication skills required for interaction with business partners and IT team members.Experience working in an Agile environmentEducation and Experience:Bachelor's degree or comparable, related work experience requiredComputer Science or IT qualifications preferredThe ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of related experience as a business/ systems analyst3+ years of experience combination of Production Support and Software Development as a business analystExperienced in financial reporting, regulatory reporting (i.e.: Medicare; NCCI; State reporting)Experienced with SQL serverBasic working knowledge with Microsoft .NET and JavaKnowledge of claims management (experience as a claim handler preferred), workflow and claims systems, preferably in specialty insurance segment is a plus2+ years of experience within an Agile/Scrum Environment and experience on enterprise level or strategic business projectsExperience in Property/ Casualty or Specialty insurance markets highly preferredCPCU, IIA Certifications or comparable insurance certification preferredCertificate in business analysis or comparable professional designation preferred

Name: Business Systems Analyst Intern
Description: OverviewWith the Healthcare industry entering an unprecedented growth period, there has never been a greater demand for talent and resources. As a business service provider in the healthcare space, Barton Associates is primed for significant growth in the coming years, and we’re looking for talented people to join our team and grow along with us.  That’s where you come in!  The selected candidate will interview users to understand and document current processes and future system needs, review requirements with the technical team, test new systems and prepare training documentation among other duties.ResponsibilitiesDocument and maintain requirements (user stories, use cases), work flow diagrams, and wireframes for enterprise applications like CRM, ERP, etc.Participate in evaluation of the enterprise applicationsParticipate in and ensure successful implementation of the enterprise applicationsDocument test scenarios and test new system behavior to ensure alignment with the requirementsPrepare training documentation, train users and conduct post rollout validation of the new systemsDesign & maintain some modules of the enterprise applications (CRM, ERP, etc.)Assist in the development of communication plans and related activities QualificationsAptitude for technology and ability to communicate effectively between the “business” and the technical teamAbility to work in a fast paced environmentPrior experience working in an agile environment is preferredWorking knowledge of SQLProficient with Excel, Word, PowerPoint & Visio Company OverviewBarton Associates specializes in providing the healthcare industry with best-in-class staffing (Locum Tenens) services throughout the United States. Since its inception, Barton has prided itself on building exceptional relationships with both its clients and providers, all of which originates from their world-class training program and strong commitment to their employees.  Locum tenens, a latin term meaning “holding the place,” is a $3.9 billion industry that is projected to reach $6.2, billion in the next 5 years. As our industry continues its rapid growth path, Barton Associates is poised to grow along with it. In 2001, Barton Associates was founded in a small office in Massachusetts’ North Shore. Since then, the company has grown to over 600 employees in 10 offices across 7 states (Massachusetts, Florida, Connecticut, Texas, New Hampshire, Nevada and Arizona) with more on the horizon.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: There is an opening for a Financial Analyst at a fast-growing, dynamic team via Accountemps ?the Financial Analyst will be a key business partner in forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management. This Financial Analyst role is a long term temporary employment opportunity and is located in the Boston, Massachusetts, area. Conducting financial modeling on various financial products, as well as measuring, analyzing and forecasting performance in conjunction with operating plans, will be among the Financial Analyst's duties. Among the Financial Analyst's other duties will be advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and preparing reports for management. Name: Clinical Business Analyst
Description: About Us  As a not-for-profit organization, Partners HealthCare is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women's Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.  We're focused on a people-first culture for our system's patients and our professional family. That's why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Partners HealthCare is committed to aligning our employees' personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal developmentand we recognize success at every step.  Our employees use the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.  General Overview  The Senior Clinical Business Analyst for Radiant reports to the Radiant Manager and is responsible for providing end user support, eliciting business requirements and working with the system build teams to implement enhancements and improvements to the Epic end user community with a primary focus on Radiology related workflows and associated areas. This person will also have responsibilities of facilitating application changes, executing user acceptance testing, training and supporting IT initiatives and applications for Medical Imaging IT (MIIT). They will also be responsible for leading small to large scale projects.  The position entails IT support and working closely with the Clinical and Operational Leadership to diagnose system issues, optimize workflows, and implement requested changes in a highly matrixed environment. They will work to support and evaluate workflow process with software and interface configuration, design and implementation for the Epic Radiant application. A history of working with Radiology scheduling, ordering and resulting systems, as well Network/Technical basics will benefit the candidate. Name: Business Analyst, Senior
Description: PTC Company Description PTC (Nasdaq: PTC) is a $1B+ global provider of technology platforms and enterprise applications for smart and connected products, operations, and systems. Our enterprise applications serve manufacturers and other businesses that create, operate and service products. Our award-winning ThingWorx technology platforms help companies achieve a “new reality” in smart, connected things and systems - deriving new value emerging from the “Internet of Things” market. An early pioneer in Computer Aided Design (CAD) software, PTC today employs more than 6,000 professionals serving more than 28,000 businesses worldwide. We are headquartered in Needham, MA. Region The Americas Subregion North America Country-City USA-Needham Business Title Business Analyst, Senior PTC Org CSS - Customer Success Job Description for Advertising Purposes Field Business Senior Business Analyst By joining our Field Business department (encompassing the entire sales, service and renewal customer experience) you will play a key role in PTC’s transformation to a world class provider of industrial IOT and AR technology solutions. We are looking for individuals who are eager to apply their abilities and passion for process and technology to be part of a team providing cutting edge business solutions.  The Business Systems team, within the Field Business Organization, is responsible for providing expertise and advice on technology and delivering solution development, configuration, maintenance and support for the various applications around CRM, web and BI analytics/reporting. Specifically, your areas of responsibility will include the Salesforce CRM platform and related applications that rely on the force.com platform. Your Day-To-Day As part of the Field Business team, you will engage with business partners across all aspects of customer success, from closing a deal through adoption, renewal and expansion. Members of our team obtain valuable experience and insights about the entire customer success business model by partnering with key stakeholders in our Field Business organization to understand strategic initiatives and business needs. Your challenge will be to convert that understanding into an action plan and user stories, and be part of the team that designs, develops, tests, and deploys solutions that support those initiatives. Skills and knowledgeApplied knowledge of CRM systems, preferably Salesforce, with a basic understanding of the various types of system users and how they use the system to perform their jobs to meet high-level business needsUnderstanding and experience with end to end system integrations and overall business system landscapesAbility to interpret documented business processes into application workflows and featuresHighly skilled communicator within a worldwide team of engineers, developers and managersUnderstanding of Agile methodologies and tools We believe that diversity of experience and background leads to better ideas and a stronger company. We encourage everyone to bring their unique perspectives to our team. Basic QualificationsBachelor’s degree and minimum 2 years of professional experience as a systems business analyst Job Req Number 29674BR Why Join Us and Benefits Summary PTC is a great place to work. Our culture is one of excellence, innovation, empowerment, and caring about our customers, communities, and employees. We have built an action oriented culture of integrity and trust, creating a sense of team spirit at both the departmental and company-wide level. At PTC, we have great employees and know that they are critical to the company’s success.  The Core Values we live by to achieve our success are: Customer SuccessExcellenceInnovation & EmpowermentIntegrity & ProfessionalismSocial Responsibility through Shared ValueTeamworkWinning We are looking to add strong candidates that uphold the PTC Core Values and are eager to grow and develop their careers with us. If you share these values and enjoy a work environment that is fast paced, hands on, and results oriented, then PTC is the place for you.  PTC benefits are among the most competitive in the industry. While your salary is the major component of your compensation, you also receive a competitive benefits package including: Retirement Savings Plan with Company MatchHealthcare and Dental insurancePaid Time Off and Sick TimeBirthday Day-offTuition Reimbursement (Canada, India, Israel, US)Holiday PayEmployee Referral ProgramManagement and Employee Training DevelopmentOther Regional-specific Benefits All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Apply!

This role is well-suited for a detail-oriented team player with  strong interpersonal and written communication skills. Name: Grant Administrator/Financial Analyst
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT: Under the guidance of the Administrative Director of the Translational and Clinical Research Centers (TCRC) of the Massachusetts General Hospital, the Grant Manager/Financial Analyst will develop into the point person for fiscal and post award research affairs of the Center's research activities. This position requires skillful interface and diplomacy with the faculty and administration of the TCRC, all of its users, research management and other-related hospital and corporate entities.  T h e incumbent will work closely with the Administrative Director (AD) to optimize operational and costefficiencies wherever possible. He/she should possess a basic knowledge of health care reimbursement and compliance, contract management, clinical trial operations, and sponsored project policiesand management. The positionrequires discretion and judgment to organize priorities, complete tasks and handle confidential information. This positionrequires skillful interface and diplomacy with study sponsors, project PIs, study staff, research management and other-related hospital and corporateentities.  PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Pre-Award Assist with the preparation of research proposals, awards and transactions related to grant/ contract management. Prepare budgets; helps customers to ensure proposal compliance with Hospital and grantor policies and procedures, as well as those of subcontracting institutions. Maintain grant, contract and sponsored research agreements in shared electronic files in compliance with institutional and research sponsor policies. Facilitate implementation of grant awards by obtaining fund numbers, activating salary assignments to grants, and other associated tasks. Interacts with PI, Clinical Trials Office (CTO), and Research Management in the Insight proposal submission process; uploads required documents; respond to Research Management questions and concerns. Identifies potential budget, procedural, and/or policy issues affecting grant submissions and work with investigators to resolve issues. Post-Award Maintain timely coordination and communication with involved parties regarding grants management issues. Prepare new fund activation requests, monitor fund balances and close out expired funds in a timely fashion. Monitor award/ agreement milestones, payment schedules and payments. In coordination with Research Finance, oversee contract billing, receivables and receipt of funds. Assist with progress reports and other grant-related reporting activities. Responsible for the timely closeout of all expired projects through the coordination of fiscal resources. Prepare cost transfers, No Cost Extension requests, Residual Balance Transfers and rebudgeting according to institutional and sponsor policies. Verify Financial Status Reports and subcontract invoices for accuracy. Finance Ensure financial integrity of the Center with accurate and timely accounts reconciliation and approve travel vouchers, invoices, procurements, reimbursements to employees, credit card activities with proper justification. Prepare budget forecasting; conduct ongoing monitoring of fund statements; resolve accounting problems and errors. Provide fiscal and grant support to the Center, including monthly reporting, planning, budgeting and trend analysis. Provide administrative support and fiscal oversight for the Center's Research Cores. Responsible for billing management of the Center's Research Cores Responsible for contract billing and receivables for clinical trials that are managed in the Center. Maintain Center fiscal record keeping system and develop monthly status reports of research funds. Communicate with Accounts Payable, Research Management, Research Finance, Payroll, Clinical Trial Office and other departments as needed for financial and grant related issues, including fund creation, closeouts, transfers, contracts, purchase orders, and all other grant and financial processes. Assist Administrative Director with identification and prevention of projected overruns and for the resolution of projects in deficit situation. Initiate mechanisms of budget control and assist in implementation on short and long-term basis. Advise regarding the allowability of costs to be charged to programs. Review appropriateness of transactions and budget reallocations against funding source guidelines. Work with AD and Research Finance to resolve complex accounting issues. Responsible for the interpretation and articulation of institutional and sponsor policies and procedures to ensure compliance. Responsible for proactively keeping departments apprised of changes in policies and regulations of federal and non-federal grantor agencies. MGH/NCI FedShare Proton Beam Program With the Sr. Administrative Director for MGH Research Management, assist in administration and oversight of the MGH/NCI FedShare Proton Beam Program. Ensure the program is in compliance with the terms of the MOU. Prepares financial, proposed use and progress reports required by the MOU for submission to NCI. Business Intelligence Software experience preferred.EEO Statement Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Name: CBO Business Analyst I
Description: As a not-for-profit organization, Partners HealthCare is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women's Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.  We're focused on a people-first culture for our system's patients and our professional family. That's why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. As part of the CBO team, the CBO Analyst will participate in RCO process improvement initiatives. Skills/Abilities/Competencies Proficient with Epic HB, PB and SBO systems either due to prior training or through a combination of training classes or peer-to-peer training. Formal training of 20 hours with 6 8 weeks of peer to peer training is typical.Proficient in Excel and Access highly desired, high intermediate required. Intermediate skills in Outlook, Microsoft Suite and Visio needed to perform all range of assignments.Knowledgeable on Third Party Insurance and Medicare Billing Regulations including basic Medicare and Secondary Payer (MSP).Ability to work independently and initiate activities required to complete assignmentsAbility to meet deadlines and excel in a fast-paced environmentEffective communications, organizational and problem-solving skillsAbility to manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously.SDL2017

Name: Business Banking Senior Credit Analyst
Description: OverviewTo work in a dynamic environment with Business Bankers and the Business Banking Department in evaluating, underwriting, monitoring and maintaining the overall credit quality of new and existing loan facilities.ResponsibilitiesRESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIESUnderwriting and Analysis: Underwrite high quality credit narratives in support of new and existing loans. This process includes:Ordering loan documents, either in-house or using outside counselReviewing documentation for consistency and accuracy with credit approvalsOrdering and reviewing formation documents & UCC searches for clientsEnsuring loan terms have been detailed accurately on the Bank’s loan system, post-closing.Portfolio Management: Create, maintain, and monitor all loan and credit files at the highest quality. This process involves:Monitoring existing credit facilities for financial and reporting covenant complianceReviewing the covenant compliance log to ensure updated financial information and covenant compliance and communicating with clients to receive required reporting informationDetecting early warning signs that could lead to a potential defaultIdentifying defaults immediately to the Business Banker and Executive Loan CommitteeMonitoring underperforming loansEvaluating proper loan risk ratingsCorresponding with Executive Loan Committee and Credit on waivers, amendments, renewals, reviews and modificationsClient Service: Assist the Business Banker on all levels of the business banking relationship to ensure the client receives exceptional service. This process includes:Receiving and funding loan advances and paymentsCollecting loan and legal feesCalling on delinquenciesAssisting clients with various loan and deposit related inquiriesRemedying or submitting client requests to the proper departments and following up to ensure timely executionIdentifying cross-sell opportunities.Lead special projects as needed.Be or become proficient in Microsoft Office, Bisys, AFS Level III, and Moody’s.Perform duties and responsibilities specific to department functions and activities.Performs other duties and responsibilities as required or assigned by supervisor. QualificationsSKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILTIESExcellent credit skillsTeam playerOutstanding communication skillsProvides extraordinary internal and external serviceWorks independentlyFurthers the First Republic Bank culture and valuesEDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, TRAINING OR CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSESRequired: Bachelor’s Degree with MBA preferred; strong credit background, a minimum of 3-5 years of commercial banking and lending experience. Established network of business clients, prospects, and referral sources.Preferred: Ideally, an industry specialization, such as law firms, accounting firms, private equity, entertainment, and non-profits.Senior Credit Analysts will have 7 plus years’ experience with all of the above capabilities plus the ability to independently structure and underwrite most loan requests. Experienced in lending to a wide variety of industries, loan types, and size of companies. Preferably, have experience coaching and developing others, informally or formally.MENTAL/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTSThe ability to learn and comprehend basic instructions; understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quickly.Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens.Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person.Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions.Position involves sitting as well as walking or standing for brief periods of time.Must be able to travel as position requires.May be required to lift 25-50lbs.

Name: Business Technology Analyst
Description: Price Mechanical Limited a division of Price Industries Limited, North America’s leading manufacturer and distributor of air distribution products (www.priceindustries.com) is a dynamic, progressive and innovative organization looking for new talent in our growing Cambridge or Winnipeg manufacturing facility. If you thrive on new challenges, pushing yourself to new heights and working in a team-driven environment, you should consider the following opportunity. Business Technology Analyst The Business Technology Analyst will identify, implement, and maintain technology solutions for operational needs to simplify, automate and institutionalize processes at Price Mechanical. This position is responsible for evaluating existing and potential technology needs and implementing company-wide technology initiatives in congruence with Corporate IT strategy. The successful candidate's responsibilities will include:Acting as a liaison between internal departments, support groups and customers to baseline and then develop interconnecting business processes to formalize the flow of information within the company. Using strong communication skills to elicit, document, analyze, and validate business processes, systems, and requirements. Demonstrating and sharing industry best practices, tools and experience with the business in daily activities. Formulating and defining scope and objectives of prioritized projects using knowledge of information technology and industry requirements. Supporting and conducting visualization, user experience trials, and configuration validation of solutions, tools, and processes prior to implementation. Developing structured, detailed user manuals and training programs for new business processes, tools, or software. Supporting and managing change management process implementations. Considering new application of technology to the current business environment. Conduct feasibility/benefit assessments for the use of new technology and tools in the business. Supporting continuous improvement by participating in conceptualizing and developing robust system tools to strength communication, information and material flow. Providing time and resource estimates for assigned tasks. Assisting departments with analyzing system data to track performance using KPIs. Acting as Price Mechanical liaison on the Corporate ERP assessment and implementation team. The ideal candidate for this position will have:A degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Business Analysis (preferred) with a minimum of 3-5 years of related experience. The ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with a cross-functional and mixed-skillset team. Effective verbal and written communication at all levels of the organization. Experience in a custom, engineer-to-order manufacturing environment. Experience working intimately with ERP systems (Infor products considered a strong asset). Familiarity and experience with Business Process Modeling techniques. Highly effective at initiating and developing positive cross functional relationships. The ability to be process-oriented with strong, accurate analytical skills. A demonstrated sense of urgency and proactive approach that is results focused. Working technical knowledge of programming languages and relational databases, including SharePoint and SQL. Should this excellent opportunity interest you, please submit your resume, including salary expectations and shift preference. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit and business need. We appreciate the interest shown by all applicants, however only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

Name: Regulatory Reporting Analyst
Description: We're reimagining sports and technology. DraftKings is bringing sports fans closer to the games they love and becoming an essential part of their experience in the process. An industry pioneer since our founding in 2012, we believe we can continue to define what it means to be a technology company in sports entertainment. We love what we do and we think you will too. Love data? We do too. We're growing quickly and are searching for a Regulatory Reporting Analyst to scale through data-driven insights and action. You will collaborate across business areas to help us optimize our regulatory processes and data sets. If you're looking for a fast-paced environment where you'll see the direct impact of your personal work right away, then you've come to the right place. Join us.  What you'll do as a Regulatory Reporting Analyst: You will serve as an expert on the company's data platform.You will create regulatory reports and dashboards.Partner with Data Engineering, Finance, Compliance, and other applicable stakeholders to deliver timey reporting that satisfies regulatory requirements.You will also provide ad-hoc analysis accurately under time constraints and tight deadlines. What skills you will use: Ideally, you have at least 1 year of analytics experience, preferably in a highly regulated industry.You have extensive experience with SQL and Tableau. Additional programming language experience is a plus.A thorough knowledge of statistics and hypothesis testing. Model building experience is a plus.The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.You have a BS in Mathematics, Business, or a related field.Who are we a good fit for? We love working with talented people but more than that, we seek out compassionate co-workers with a collaborative spirit. Our work moves quickly and we're great at coming together to find creative solutions to some of tech's most interesting problems. If that sounds good to you, join us. Apply now We're proud to believe that your gender, race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability should have nothing to do with our hiring practices. We'll never discriminate against anyone's background or creed. If you're good at what you do, we want you to do it at DraftKings.

Name: Digital Advertising Analyst Contractor
Description: Who We Are Pixability is a video advertising technology company that gives media professionals the ability to plan, buy, and report across YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Snapchat. Pixability's holistic solution empowers advertisers to deliver outstanding campaign performance across these premium video environments, through deep insights, patented targeting technology, verified viewability, and apples-to-apples reporting. Pixability's solution empowers advertisers to activate video at every stage in the consumer journey in order to deliver impactful business results. Our Award-Winning Culture Our team is at the heart of our culture. We value innovation, collaboration and curiosity, combined with a passion for getting things done. We strive to hire and develop the best and foster a culture of open communication and transparency. We are driven and hard-working, but also have fun along the way with weekly catered lunches and happy hours, team outings, and unlimited time-off. We were named the global winner for Video Innovation in the 2017 Google Premier Partners Awards, and proud to be included in Boston Business Journal's Fast 50 awards (2018) and BostInno's list of Boston's Coolest Companies (2017), as well as named #497 on the Inc. 500 (2017). The Role We are looking for a Digital Marketing Analyst to analyze the data available to determine the appropriate next steps for providing the most relevant information to stakeholders for business and marketing decisions. The role requires a deep analytics background, along with specific channel knowledge, proficient skills in data reporting and competitive analysis to contribute to the success of all digital initiatives. You will provide data, information, and analysis to assist with metrics-driven strategy and media decisions, and also provide clients, stakeholders and partners with insights that drive traffic and improve conversion rates for various projects.  This will be a 3-month contract with potential to extend or turn into a full-time role. What You'll DoNote that this is not a data science role, though you will eventually work closely with themDeliver insights and help in packaging / delivering reportsContribute to our industry studies and case studies by identifying valuable areas of study on YouTube, Facebook, and Instagram and developing data-driven storylines around these platformsBe an industry expert on all things videoUtilize Pixability Video Platform as a tool to aid in your ability to help understand individual industries, topic spaces, and campaign performanceProvide data insights and statistical analysis, as required on accountsStay current with client and industry benchmarksWork closely with account team to make specific and actionable client recommendationsWhat You Bring to the Party1+ years of experience working with analytics (within ad agencies or ad tech being a plus)Experience in data analysis and report generation is a mustHands-on experience with web analytics platforms like Google Analytics, pixel tracking, etc.Role requires the ability to write clear and concise presentations for client summarizing data insights, outcomes, and implications in a straight-forward and enlightening way for clientsProficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerpointExperience in Google Adwords, Facebook, or ad tech platforms is a plusExperience effectively managing projects that support multiple clients and stakeholdersPast agency experience or proven knowledge of digital advertising is a plusExperience using Tableau is a plusPhotoshop, Indesign background is a plusPixability does not accept/pay fees for unsolicited resumes from third party agencies/vendorsAs part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Pixability is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

Name: Business Planning Analyst
Description: Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect. Job DescriptionCoordinates supply chain and procurement activities related to wafer material and services with worldwide foundry suppliers, including maintaining quotation and wafer cost in price engine and processing purchase order in SAP.Collects forecast input and conducts forecast review with Planning, consolidates and communicates forecast to supplier and reconciles wafer demand and supply.Monitors wafer material WIP, delivery, leadtime and cost performance against procurement metrics.Develops and maintains foundry wafer capacity modeling, and facilitates wafer order within capacity constraint and spend budget.Provides periodic reporting and ad-hoc analysis; inclusive of data gathering, analysis and metrics.Works with IT and Finance to solve shipment and invoicing issuesActs as primary interface between supplier and internal Planning and Engineering teams.Drives continuous improvement on business processes and across the supply chain, along with a strong focus on efficiency, quality of data, and customer support.Skills/ ExperienceExperience with Microsoft tools; intermediate/advanced Excel skill required, VBA/Macro skill a plusAble to work in a dynamic, fast paced global procurement/ planning environment, while maintaining a high degree of accuracy and qualityGood written and verbal communication dealing with suppliers and internal  customers and comfortable interfacing with all levels of managementExperience working with SAP a plus but not requiredKnowledge of semiconductor manufacture process a plus The candidate will be working collaboratively with both domestic and international suppliers, Planning, Engineering, Finance, and other procurement professionals and will have good exposure to all levels inside Analog Devices. For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) may have to go through an export licensing review process. Analog Devices, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability Education Level: Bachelor's Degree Travel Required: No
