Name: Sr. Financial Systems Business Analyst
Description: *Description** The Financial Business Systems Analyst for Financial Planning & Analysis will be a key member of the Staples Digital Solutions (SDS) Finance team helping to analyze strategic decisions and drive insights for the upcoming year and beyond. There will be frequent and regular communication with the SDS Finance team members, cross functional departments, as well as business unit Finance teams. This role will be to partner with the SDS finance teams to drive business financial reporting, facilitate change and process improvement as well as administer the team?s financial management tool. Analyses performed by this role will influence decisions impacting spend and strategy across a variety of departments/businesses. *Primary Responsibilities** ? Possess the unique ability to bridge the gap between business, finance and technology  ? Gain knowledge of the multitude of databases utilized by the organization, from both a business and technical perspective  ? Perform ad hoc reporting and analysis and investigate issues providing explanations and interpretation  ? Assist in administering the team?s financial management tool  ? Ensure financial model adheres to standards and includes appropriate security and audit controls  ? Develop and maintain documentation in support of project design, change control and user testing  ? Responsible for the development, automating, compiling and preparing reports under general supervision  ? Monitors, identifies, investigates, prioritizes, remediates and communicates data quality issues  ? Lead requirements gathering sessions and provide thought leadership during requirements gathering efforts  ? Review Use Cases and conceive and execute proof-of-concept models *Qualifications***Required** ? 3+ years? experience working on or with on both finance and technical teams  ? Intermediate to advanced Excel level experience  ? Ability to translate financial business processes into technical solutions  ? Experience with complex data modeling, especially finance related  ? Strong data analysis and business skills  ? Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills  ? Ability to work in fast paced, demanding environment *Preferred** ? Experience with Anaplan connected planning solution  ? Experience with ITFM tool, M-PWR  ? Experience with BI tools (PowerBI, Tableau)  ? Experience with Access  ? Experience building financial models with an emphasis on creating and maintaining flexible models  ? Excellent oral and written communication skills must be comfortable interacting with interacting with internal and external customers  ? Ability to actively engage and partner with various leadership team members to drive results and provided needed analysis.  _Staples is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law._

Name: Business Consultant
Description: As a FINEOS Business Consultant you will be expected to lead the requirements gathering and requirements management processes. Using a variety of standard requirements gathering techniques you will be expected to elicit requirements and subsequently manage these requirements through the entire project lifecycle.  You will be expected to be able to plan your time and work with the extended project team to ensure the delivery of the solution within agreed project deadlines. You will communicate scope changes to the client, manage their expectations and assist them in defect management.  You will be expected to contribute to the industry best practice standards and to input to the continuous improvement of these standards within FINEOS. When necessary you will recommend changes to business processes to reflect lessons learned from project experience. Over time you will be expected to become a FINEOS product expert and lead the client in configuring the FINEOS product to its best advantage.  This is a largely a client facing role. Strong written and verbal communication skills are necessary to allow you to establish and maintain key relationships with both the client and the wider FINEOS organisation. These skills are also required to ensure that client presentations and training is always both effective and relevant. Ability to travel is a prerequisite of this role.  FINEOS offers associates excellent opportunities to travel abroad, fast career development and competitive salary and benefits, further details are available at http://www.fineos.com/about/careers/ Responsibilities:Eliciting requirements from clients and documentation of samePlanning and leading requirement workshops with clientsDemonstrating FINEOS product to clientCreating and maintaining solution through configuration first principlesEnsuring that all configuration is completed to FINEOS best practiceEnsuring all solutions are scalable for further versions or additional lines of businessEstablishing and adhering to a project configuration management strategy that is in line with the FINEOS best practice configuration management processWorking with FINEOS team to ensure successful and timely delivery of solutionCommunicating the clients requirements to all stakeholdersWorking with the project manager to estimate and plan project implementationAdvising best practice and escalating risks to key project stakeholders.Managing clients expectations of the FINEOS deliveryProvide product feedback and detail measurable opportunities for improvementSharing knowledge, influencing and providing direction to others within the Business Consultancy Practice by pro-actively pushing information out to the wider groupParticipating in (and sharing knowledge from) internal or external communities which have an emphasis on skills or knowledge which are directly relevant to the Business Consultancy Practice.Required Skills:Expert skills in at least one and advanced skills in the other core Business Consultancy Competencies of Business AnalysisConfiguration AbilityBusiness KnowledgeAgile implementationBusiness ArchitectureProven Client Management and Consultancy skillsAn understanding of the Insurance Claims market and Absence ManagementMultiple years (3-5) experience as a Business Analyst / ConsultantMultiple project experience implementing enterprise software within the Insurance IndustryExcellent oral and written communication skills Proven delivery of high quality project artifacts to both Clients and internal audiences.Ability to confidently deliver high quality oral presentations which display business expertiseAbility to analyze and articulate complex business problems within a concise manner. FINEOS is an equal opportunities employer  The FINEOS flagship product, FINEOS AdminSuite, is a cloud based core product suite for Life, Accident and Health carriers. FINEOS AdminSuite delivers full service Policy, Billing, and Claims, providing best-in-class functionality for Group, Voluntary, and Individual administration on a single platform, while also supporting self-admin, full-admin, and TPA models. FINEOS delivers innovative core systems to a global market and has customers, employees, and established bases in North America, Europe, and the Asia Pacific markets. For more information, visit www.FINEOS.com. We are seeking a strong candidate to fill a Knowledge Analyst role in BCG’s People & Organization Practice (POP) with a specific focus on Leadership, Talent, HR, Behavior & Culture. Our customized approach combines deep insight into the dynamics of companies and markets with close collaboration at all levels of the client organization. This ensures that our clients achieve sustainable competitive advantage, build more capable organizations, and secure lasting results. Name: Risk Analyst
Description: Risk AnalystJoin the Boston-based Risk Management team and learn about the Capital Markets by working on a new trading floor. The role is to safeguard the firms balance sheet and reputation through the use of robust risk tools and technology. The candidate will represent the firm in collaborating with business partners by articulating risk policies and procedures as it relates to Collateral, Market and Operations Risk.The core functions will be analyzing market risk for trading functions, assessing collateral-based margin requirements as well as analysis, validation and monitoring of Market Access controls. Participate in the expansion of effective operational risk measurement methods, understanding process flows and controls sets, development of key risk indicators to identify potential risks and control gaps. Work to enhance and provide detailed and executive level summary reports highlighting potential loss exposures.The TeamThe Risk Management team is responsible for a wide array of risk functions within the Fidelity Capital Markets Division. Fidelity Capital Markets is the institutional trading arm of Fidelity Investments, providing trading, products and operations to internal business channels and external clients, including Retail Investors, Investment Advisors, Broker Dealers and Family Offices as well as buy-side & sell-side institutions and hedge funds. Fidelity Capital Markets offers a suite of trading, clearing and custody, middle office operations, electronic brokerage products and execution services across multiple asset classes including equities, equity options, fixed income, FOREX as well as prime brokerage, securities lending and municipal and bank-issued brokered CD underwriting. For more information about Fidelity Capital Markets, please visit www.fidelitycapitalmarkets.com.The Expertise You HaveBachelors Degree in Finance or related field2+ years of brokerage backgroundStrong analytical and technical skillsExcellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skillsThe Skills You BringYou are able to utilize or learn the brokerage business and financial product knowledge in trading, clearing and custody with risk management practicesYou have strong technical and analytical skills to use in your daily risk management responsibilitiesYou have ability to identify inherent risks to the business (e.g. market, credit, financial, operations regulatory, technology and reputational)You are a self-starter who is able to work independently and manage time to drive initiatives from beginning to endYou are familiar or willing to learn brokerage, brokerage operations and brokerage rules and regulationsYou command effective written and verbal communication skills that will be leveraged in influencing decisionsYou have excellent knowledge of MS office products particularly Excel, PowerPoint and WordFamiliarity with database queries and analytical tools and methodologies (SQL is a plus)The Value You DeliverWorking independently and with team members to analyze fixed income market risks, market access controls and process related operations risks by recommending mitigation practicesEffectively managing multiple initiatives and responsibilities within prescribed timelinesAbility to engage interested parties and facilitate discussions, meetings and walkthroughs of risk analyticsDriving innovation using complex data sets to identify risk, understanding the controls, parameters, risk methodologiesCommunicating complex issues by condensing them into a concise summary report and presentationsIdentifying opportunities to enhance existing risk reporting and developing new key risk indicators Company OverviewAt Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and valueour associates for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit Fidelitycareers.comFidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Strategic Business Analyst
Description: Strategic Analyst This role will be responsible for the ideation, definition and development of strategic initiatives within the Stratus business. You will be a key member of the team that is defining the future of Edge Computing and helping lead a companywide transformation that is already underway. This role will report to the Vice President of Strategy and Business Line Management and own the execution of workstreams within larger company strategic initiatives. This role will also support the general strategic planning process, manage Board materials development, and create presentations relating to company initiatives and strategies. This is a high visibility role and requires a motivated individual with a sense of ownership and demonstrated high performance in previous jobs. Primary ResponsibilitiesWork directly with VP of Strategy and Business Line Management and other members of Stratus’ executive team various critical strategic initiativesPerform in-depth industry research on critical areas for future growthCreate presentations for multiple stakeholders including executives, board members, and strategic business development resources.Run financial analyses to understand impact of various initiativesBe a driver and facilitator of Stratus’ annual strategic planning process as well as ad-hoc strategic projects as new business opportunities arise.Work with CFO and finance teams to develop financial models to ensure well thought out recommendations. Key Requirements & QualificationsUndergraduate degree in business administration – concentrations in finance, strategy a plus3 years of management consulting / project management experience with 1.5+ years of experience working on large, cross-functional projectsSolid understanding and experience in change management practices and implementationPrior experience in technology and or industrial verticals will be a plus.Exceptional ability to multi-task / manage multiple tasks with concurrent deadlinesStrong ability to tolerate ambiguity and ability to constantly shift priorities to the most important task at handStrong organizational skillsStrong critical thinking skillsStrong Communication skills, written & verbalStrong relationship management skills About Stratus In today’s always-on world, applications run under increasingly demanding circumstances. With these escalating demands comes greater pressure to prevent even the smallest amount of application downtime. Companies are responding to this need for always-on solutions by searching for technologies that either conform to or enhance their current IT infrastructures.  Stratus’ solutions enable rapid deployment of always-on infrastructures, from enterprise servers to clouds, without any changes to your applications. Our products – software and platforms – combined with our people and services enable us to prevent downtime before it occurs and ensure uninterrupted 24 x 7 x 365 performance of essential business operations. Stratus Technologies is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer; we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D

Name: Senior Analyst
Description: Fuel your intellectual curiosity and professional growth. Forrester is an idea company, where smart, motivated, curious people bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on ideas that change the course of business. Most of all, bring a point of view; here, every voice has value. At Forrester, you’ll work with innovative clients at emerging and established brands; these are the business and technology leaders we inspire and who inspire us. The Forrester experience is built on a singular, powerful purpose: to challenge thinking and lead change. About This Role: Senior Analysts conduct innovative research and deliver advice through written reports, consulting, client inquiries, and speeches. Contributing to Forrester’s CIO team, the Senior Analyst serves senior tech management leaders such as CIOs, CTOs, and chief digital officers who are increasingly responsible for delivering excellent customer and employee experiences that drive positive business outcomes for their company.  The Senior Analyst writes to, presents to, and advises CIOs and other senior technology leaders on Forrester’s research that addresses the strategic needs of CIOs worldwide. In particular, this Senior Analyst will research concepts, frameworks, and best practices on how talent management solutions can contribute to the CIO’s technology agenda and improve the employee experience. The research efforts will include identifying trends in talent management applications and people/workforce analytics with a secondary focus on learning management, employee wellness, and recognition tools. The Senior Analyst will track and understand the respective vendor landscape and strategic partners for these areas (from large established ERP vendors to emerging niche technology providers and everything in between) and convey the information to CIOs and senior tech leaders.  The Senior Analyst should have a strong understanding of the business and technology issues facing CIOs today, an appetite for conducting and writing research to stay abreast of the issues, and the desire to engage directly with clients to lead positive change in their organizations. Develop a deep understanding of what Forrester clients require to be successful as CIOs.Conduct primary research on how enterprises plan to utilize talent management solutions to help deliver on their corporate strategy.Evolve thought leadership around the emerging role of talent and learning and how those roles are key to the emerging employee experience conversation.Be able to predict the future role of the related software ecosystem as an enabler for business innovation.Collaborate with experts in different focus areas from across Forrester’s role and geographic teams to develop a complete context for these trends, both providing input to their research reports and writing reports incorporating their expertise to provide a big-picture view.Collaboratively develop cohesive bodies of research that are focused on helping clients succeed with their talent strategies.Write/create approximately eight to 12 reports and workbooks per year, use social media to develop visibility for your research and Forrester, and contribute to Forrester client communities.Consult with clients to apply Forrester’s research in the context of their specific business environment and help solve their problems through inquiry and advisory.Present at Forrester-sponsored and industry-related events and deliver client webinars.Establish an industry presence as an influential speaker and thinker; build relationships with senior technology leaders, CTOs, and CIOs, as well as with the journalists who cover the sector; and participate in vendor briefings and field press inquiries as necessary.Proven experience with HR and talent management processes and technologies. Experience with broader ERP solutions a plus.A strong record of academic achievement: B.A. or B.S. minimum; MBA or M.S. preferred.A deep intellectual curiosity about the effect of talent on the business landscape; solid business instincts and a practical understanding of what makes companies tick and how CIOs operate; and a creative view of markets, technologies, and attitudes combined with a fascination with the future.Superior listening, critical thinking, and writing skills, as well as memorable presentation skills. Principal/Senior Analysts are expected to take complex, disparate ideas and distill them into simple, provocative concepts — and be willing to take a stand on vendors and outcomes.The ability to travel more than 25% of the time.Explore #ForresterLife on:YouTubeTwitterFacebookInstagramLinkedInGlassdoorFLSA Status: Exempt  Forrester Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity for all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, genetic information, military service, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. Minorities, Women, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans are especially encouraged to apply.

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: HTC – A brief profile Established in 1990, HTC Inc., a CMM Level 5 company with headquarters in Troy, Michigan, is a leading global Information Technology solution and BPO provider. HTC assists clients across multiple industry verticals, offering turnkey project lifecycle in, e-business, data warehousing, embedded systems, ECM, SCM, CRM, and ERP solutions. Name: Analyst - Business Analytics, Intelligence and Data Science
Description: Harvard Business Publishing’s Corporate Learning partners with clients to create world-class leadership development solutions for managers at all levels in global organizations and governments. We leverage the management insight, thought leadership, and expertise of Harvard Business School faculty and Harvard Business Review authors to provide solutions that are relevant to today’s most pressing business challenges. For more than 20 years, we have developed and delivered innovative, technology-enabled solutions that drive meaningful business results.    The Analyst - Analytics, Business Intelligence & Data Science is responsible for developing business insights through in-depth data analysis. You will evaluate business requirements, identify sources of data, and use business intelligence tools (e.g.; Alteryx, Tableau, Birst, etc.) to create analytically rich solutions to critical business questions. You will also develop standardized reports, dashboards and self-service access to critical information for individuals across all the functional groups within Corporate Learning. You will need to become quickly familiar with our data, its structure, and also have strong business acumen (in finance, marketing, product development) which will allow you to create meaningful insights in support of our business. The analyst will work collaboratively with all groups throughout the Corporate Learning organization.   You will:  Work with business stakeholders to define business requirements; identify and recommend potential data sources and solutions; and develop customized reports, analyses, and/or data visualizations that answer the problem. Develop analytically rich solutions that help us both understand what has happened in the past, and help us predict what will happen in the future. Identify and design processes that ensure data integrity and accuracy across the entire organization Manage assigned projects and support activities of team. Ensure prompt completion of specific deliverables. Ensure accuracy and efficiency in project completion and work cooperatively with all internal and external contacts. Ensure adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies.  Your Experience:  3-5 years’ experience in a business intelligence, analytics or data science. Worked in highly regarded companies/organizations, with high standards for excellence. Degree in math, statistics, computer science, other quantitative discipline with strong business background. Strong technical experience in Alteryx,Tableau, Birst, MS SQL, Excel

Name: Sales Operations Analyst Co-Op
Description: About Mirakl  Sales Operations Analyst Co-Op  Mirakl is the leader in online marketplace platforms. We provide a software-as-a-service (SaaS) solution for managing online marketplaces. Founded by Marketplace veterans, Mirakl delivers Seller Onboarding, Seller Management, Marketplace Operation Management and Marketplace Financial Management solutions multi-channel and pure play online retailers.  Job Description  Join our growing Sales Operations team!! This Co-Op will run from January to June and will be full time. We are looking for a Sales Operations Analyst Co-Op to support our marketing and sales organizations. In this role, you will be responsible for sales reporting and modeling and analysis to support strategic and operational decision-making at a fast growing technology company. This role will be cross-functional, supporting Mirakl’s Sales, Marketing, Strategy, and Finance organizations. Success in the role requires creativity and original thinking to proactively identify new and different approaches to analyzing data, and to synthesize multiple information sources to generate fresh strategic insights.  You will be performing analysis to identify trends and uncover useful insights, present findings and support cross-functional operational teams in improving operational execution and business strategy in the following areas:  Sales (e.g. lead-to-close cycle, pipeline, sales activities, forecasts, etc.) Marketing (e.g. leads, campaigns, account and contact profiles, etc.) Finance (e.g. bookings, revenue, expenses)RequirementsExperience in an analytic role within one or more of the disciplines of Sales, Marketing, Strategy or Finance preferred Proactive, creative, entrepreneurial and results oriented Experience using data analysis, modeling, and/or financial analysis to support or drive business decisions Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel and prior experience with modeling and analysis is essential in performing the role successfully Experience with HubSpot would be a plus Comfortable presenting and engaging with cross-functional teams and executive management. Able to synthesize many threads of information to generate strategic and financial insight Team player: experience working across functions to deliver customer/prospect/client facing proposals Able to prioritize requests based on importance and timing for key decision making or events. Example events include Quarterly Operations reviews, Board Meetings, and more. The position is available at our Somerville, MA office.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: POSITION: FINANCIAL ANALYST - PROFITABILITY Summary:  Implement and operate the Product and Relationship Profitability systems, including ongoing updates, analysis and production of related reports. Manage data collection and processing of the Business Line Profitability function through MPC. Act as a resource to the other Financial Analyst(s). Review ROA simulations for the commercial lenders. Write quarterly narratives on lender profitability. Work closely with business line managers, based on their needs, to investigate areas of their operations that could be addressed for greater efficiencies. Responsible for the collection, analysis and documentation of data as it pertains to establishing and maintaining income and expense allocation routines for the organizational and product profitability models. Make recommendations and prepare analysis as appropriate for review by senior management. Serve as a resource to the department for the data warehouse reporting. Analyze and produce monthly financial reports as requested by senior management. Responsible for all other data management, advanced Excel analysis, and ad-hoc projects, as requested by senior management. Provide and initiate analytical reports of management and business center managers.  Key Result Areas: Responsible for the implementation and monthly report production through the product profitability system and relationship profitability system, as well as ad-hoc analysis as requested by senior management.Accurately review return on asset (ROA) simulations by understanding the loan requirements presented by Portfolio Managers. Explain the results and recommend changes to maximize profit, if necessary. The results are presented to all necessary loan review committees and the Board.Produce independent analyses of various products and customer relationships drawing from knowledge acquired through working with the relationship profitability process.Work with business line managers as an outside source to investigate areas of their operations that could be made more efficient.Collect monthly data from the data warehouse and all other department sources to develop performance statistics for inputs to the Product system. Design queries using the data warehouse to facilitate this process.Responsible for modification, distribution, and collection of the annual overhead center surveys to allocate department time for business line profitability. As well as the survey to allocate product expenses for loans and deposits necessary for relationship and product profitability.Constantly work to increase knowledge of the organization and products in order to make suggestions and recommendations regarding possible changes to the allocations for the organizational profitability process.Act as a resource and guiding influence for the other financial analyst(s).Stay informed to national and regional market changes and what the potential impact could be on the profitability of the Bank and business units.Assist in the written analysis of the market conditions regarding each of the branch's in the banks systems to explain the strengths and weaknesses of each and how increased profitability can be achieved.Update product cost assumptions, formulas, and methods.Responsible for the quarterly production of the loan officer profitability reporting by writing the officer narratives.Accept responsibility for all deliverables associated with major department initiatives.Responsible for the development of initial documentation of all Profitability processes as well as ongoing updates to the documentation.Assist in the creation of the annual profitability budget.Work with the department heads as necessary to monitor production changes compared to budget.Backup the functions of the other Financial Analyst regarding monthly reporting and the MPC software.Prepare comparison reports on transfer pricing changes to senior management on a regular basis.Generate monthly financial reports for distribution to department heads and senior management.Design and enhance existing controls for department processes.Continually update data warehouse skills. This includes a collection of various statistics to be used in performance measurement systems for various analyses.Responsible for the on-going records management according to department schedule.Create, update and enhance various graphs and spreadsheets, used for department projects and senior management reporting.Perform additional analyses as needed.Contribute to the effective team management of all bank and department initiatives.Perform additional duties as required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree, preferably in economics or finance, with specialized courses in cost accounting, management, or finance.1-3 years financial analysis experience.Knowledge of bank accounting and analysis.Experience with business line and product profitability theory and production preferred.Advanced computer skills, including very strong Excel experience. Proficient in PowerPoint.Strong interpersonal, customer service and presentation skills.Strong quantitative, technical and analytical skills. Ability to analyze large volumes of data and learn new systems quickly.Strong oral and written communication skills.Ability to pay attention to detail, meet deadlines, take initiative, multi-task, and work independently with minimal supervision.Knowledge of the financial structure of the Bank. The above description covers the most significant major responsibilities but does not exclude other occasional responsibilities and accountabilities the inclusion of which would be in conformity with the major purpose of this job.

Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: HR Technology Analyst  Workday is the core system in our HR Management Platform (HRMS), which also includes Taleo, and a variety of payroll providers. The HR Business Process Analyst owns the configuration of global business processes and supports various aspects of continued development, implementation and maintenance of Workday and Taleo. The role is responsible for harmonizing processes globally while localizing to meet country specific regulatory requirements. A significant portion of the work is related to the system updates released each year, the implementation of continual improvement projects between system updates and providing technical system support to our end users. The successful candidate must be analytical, have the ability to multitask, be a self starter and quick learner. This role will work with the global HR Community, HRIT, HRMS Reporting and HRMS Security teams.  Responsible for process and data configuration within the HCM & ATS systems (Workday and Taleo): Global configuration of business processes: design, build, test and deploy new BP's as well as update existing BP'sCreate calculated fields, condition rules for data / plan eligibility, and notificationsRegression test Workday and Taleo releases each year: create, update and execute test scripts; log cases with the vendor when issues are identifiedBe an active member of the Workday and Taleo knowledge sharing community: create and vote on brainstorms, participate in groups, apply knowledge gained to Sun Life processesConfigure and initiate annual programs such as Talent, Compensation, Performance. Partner with COEs on delivery of these processes.Set up and maintenance of business data such as Job Profiles, Locations, Cost Centers, Bonus Plans etc.Upload data using EIB'sDetermine root cause of data related issues regarding integration errors and partner with IT Analysts and Developers to analyze and improve integrations related to WorkdayProvide Tier 2 support by investigate technical issues relating to HCM, ATS, and other system configurationBachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required3-5 years experience in a HR system support role, HCM or ATS support idealPrior experience with HRMS; Workday highly desirable but not requiredWorking knowledge of HR processes and procedures highly desirableStrong analytical, multitasking and interpersonal skills requiredMust be a self starter, take initiative, comfortable with web based learning and be curiousMust be detail orientated while keeping eye on the bigger pictureAbility to effectively communicate both verbally and in writingMaintain confidentialityOccasional weekend work in order to support updates; after hours work in order to support all countries; and travel between locationsSDL2017

Name: Senior Analyst (Media)
Description: Job DescriptionAn experienced, data-driven professional who can thrive within a dynamic and growing research/consulting firm focused on video and digital technology.  At Latitude Research (www.latd.com), we provide creative intelligence for media and technology innovators. For over two decades, the biggest names in the media and technology industries have been turning to Latitude for innovative research to uncover market-level and business-specific insights. With the explosion of technologies that enable viewers to store, share, and engage with content across a variety of traditional and emerging platforms and distribution channels, our tools and methods for collecting and evaluating video content are rapidly evolving.  To help us keep pace as we grow and change, we need more smart, creative people who are driven by curiosity and determined to uncover insights and deliver value to our clients. The right candidate will possess:3+ years of professional experience in media/market research and data analysis.Proficiency in statistical software (e.g., SPSS, SAS, Q, R), data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, D3.js), coding (e.g., Python, JavaScript), and/or presentation software (e.g., PowerPoint, Excel).An ability to think about and work with a wide variety of data formats and structures, and to perform statistical analysis as needed. Familiarity with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL) and SQL. Strong interest and proficiency in data visualization.An interest in new technologies, media/entertainment, and related trends.Knowledge of and experience in the television and digital media industries - including familiarity with media research types (e.g., content testing, ad effectiveness, strategy & thought leadership, etc.) - preferred, but not required. Our Analysts core areas of responsibility will be: Analyzing and interpreting research findings about our clients advertising campaigns, audiences, subscribers, users, and prospects.Integrating and presenting analyses to internal teams and external clients.Working with senior-level team to develop new products and solutions leveraging behavioral and attitudinal data, with a focus on Lumiere (http://lumiere.is), our proprietary video feedback platform.Helping to develop Latitudes internal practices around data & analysis, with an eye towards smart, efficient architecture & processes.Other project-related tasks as needed, including: conducting background research, coordinating fieldwork, programming surveys, and communicating directly with study participants and clients. Salary: commensurate with experience  More about Latitude Research  Since 1996, Latitude Research has been providing innovative qualitative and quantitative research solutions for media content providers, including traditional broadcast and cable networks, as well as digital and streaming content distributors. We test advertising, brand, and program elements, inform content strategy, and help clients connect with and better understand viewer and user audiences. Lumiere (www.lumiere.is), our proprietary video content evaluation platform is a core element of many of our studies. It represents the leading edge of in-video content testing technology, enabling us to gather viewer feedback at scale using innovative tools and techniques that capture on-screen feedback, behavioral data, and facilitate user social interactions.  Latitude offers competitive salaries, excellent benefits, and a flexible work environment, centered around a creative, open loft space located in downtown Boston that is filled with interesting people who are passionate about working in an innovation-focused environment.

Name: Financial Analyst-Accountant / BWPO Anesthesia
Description: The Financial Analyst will report to the Finance Manager and support the Department of Anesthesiology, Perioperative and Pain Medicine (DAPPM) focusing on accounting, budgeting and financial analytics. The Financial Analyst will work closely with the Finance Manager to understand and evaluate financial performance and financial issues facing the Department.  The job's primary responsibilities, but not limited to, include the following:  General ledger maintenance and monthly adjusting journals entries and accruals. Assist with the annual DAPPM-BW/F budget development process. Oversight of DAPPM compensation reviews, including, but not limited to, off-cycle salary requests, commitment loans/bonuses, annual compensation surveys, etc.. Evaluate departmental FTEs on a monthly and ad hoc basis. Monthly review and analysis of actual/budget variances for all operating funds for reporting to all levels of management. Review and process invoices and expense reimbursements submitted to the Department for payment. Assist with strategic analyses in support of business decision-making. Assist with the development and enhancement the monthly, quarterly, annual reporting packages for level of management. Providing financial support for departmental forecasts, analyzing key performance indicators, and providing input for operational decisions. Effectively communicates and presents issues to appropriate levels of finance, management or external customers. Assists with or leads special projects which are central to improving analytical tools, internal processes, and the overall management decision process. Evaluates areas of responsibilities and continuously drives for improvement. Assists with other analytical assignments; ad hoc reporting as required. Be the responsible person to handle financial transactions in the Financial Managers absence. This includes ensuring the monthly GL close, processing of A/P, A/R and reporting and analysis as required by the BWPO/BWH/Partners and the Department.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration. CPA or Master Degree a plusMinimum of 3-5 years' relevant experience in healthcare or business environment that has extensive fiscal responsibility, including accounting, budgeting, forecasting and cost/benefit analysis.Excellent computer skills especially in spreadsheets and databases (and all Microsoft Office products).Strong interpersonal skills, including strong customer service orientation; and able to take initiative, take-charge ability, including knowledge of resources to answer questions and find required data and information. SKILLS/ ABILITIES/ COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:Proficient in budgetary or accounting principles and practices as applicable to experience/education required, including the ability to prepare, interpret and analyze financial statements and cash flow analyses.Ability to work independently and in a teamwork environment, as well as the ability to exercise good judgement and decision-making skills, to prioritize workload and to manage multiple complex and concurrent projects.Astute attention to details, commitment to accuracy and integrity of all data, reports and communications.Exceptional research and organizational skillsExcellent communication (both oral and written), collaboration and presentation skills.Ability to manage multiple tasks and re-establish priorities as necessary.A demonstrated ability to be a self-starter with the ability to excel in a fast paced and deadline oriented environment. Must be a team player and willing to take on additional challenges if needed.A high degree of social facility in obtaining cooperation and support from a broad range of people.Exceptional judgment and discretion in interacting with constituencies (internal and external) on sensitive political, fiscal and confidential issues.Knowledge of standard PHS systems (e.g., PeopleSoft, SRC, POLR, Document Direct, etc.) a plus.EEO Statement Brigham and Women's Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Name: ServiceNow Business Systems Analyst
Description: ServiceNow Business Systems Analyst needed in Cambridge, MA.  This individual will work closely with business partners in the CLIENTs community and analysts and engineers in Information Systems & Technology (IS&T) on the analysis, design, configuration, and support of digital business process implementations in the ServiceNow platform. At CLIENT, the ServiceNow platform is broadly used in IT Service Management and several other key business areas outside of IT.  Projects for this role will focus on end-user and community facing functionality, so a breadth of experience covering the basics of a design-centric approach and developing an effective user experience, especially in ServiceNows Service Portal application using modern web frameworks, will be an important success factor.  In addition to the essential functions itemized below, this role will focus on designing, implementing, and enhancing business solutions in the ServiceNow platform with a focus on IT service management and service delivery, but with the ability to incorporate non-IT business areas and processes for business partners in the CLIENT community for whom ServiceNow is determined to be an effective solution.  We are looking for an individual with both a strong general business systems analyst skillset and the experience and ability to apply and further develop deep expertise in the ServiceNow platform. Minimum 5 years of relevant experience.Working knowledge of ServiceNow, IT and non-IT service delivery business operations, systems requirements, and IT processes and technologies required.Working proficiency with one or more coding languages and system configuration; specifically, experience in the following or a demonstrated ability to quickly learn the following is strongly preferred:Working proficiency and recent experience in JavaScript, especially in the context of the ServiceNow platform.Working proficiency in Bootstrap 3 and AngularJS 1.5 web frameworks.Expertise in HTML and CSS, especially in the context of developing customer-facing experiences in ServiceNows Service Portal framework.Experience with, or ability to quickly come up to speed in ServiceNow configuration, administration, change and application packaging.Working proficiency in business analysis and systems design principles and best practices.Familiarity with fundamentals of effective project management and ability to directly manage small to medium projects as part of BSA and ServiceNow implementation role. Employer Staffing has been recruiting and placing professionals for over 30 years. From Fortune 100 companies to small businesses, our philosophy remains the same: to achieve excellence by providing quality employees and an uncompromising level of service. We believe in honesty, integrity, and a simple philosophy of providing value to our customers and our employees. We strive to be unsurpassed in the recruitment and placement of quality and skilled professionals.  #tti

Name: IT Business Analyst (Cyber Security)
Description: Location: Waltham MADuration: 4 months with possibility for extensionJob Purpose: Responsible for investigating business situations, identifying and evaluating options for improving business process & systems, defining requirements and ensuring effective use of information systems in meeting the needs of the Client business. Key Accountabilities: • Takes full responsibility for business analysis within a portfolio where the advice is given and decisions made will have a measurable impact on the profitability or effectiveness of Client.  • Establishes the contribution that technology can make to business objectives, supporting strategies, validating and justifying business needs, conducting feasibility studies, producing high level and details business cases, taking into account the implications of change on the organization and all stakeholders.  • Guides senior management towards accepting change brought through process and organization change.  • Provides Quality Assurance work on the BA deliverables for Business Analysts or contractors if leading a team. Knowledge & Experience Required: • Good Leadership skills and experience working with line management in significant business or IS influence.  • Undertaking roles in which analytical thinking is applied to produce business improvements within the Client Environment across a variety of business situations and complexity.  • Knowledge of IS project development processes and wider organization units of IS.  • Understanding of the purpose of business process teams. Qualifications Required: • Relevant business analysis qualification e.g. BCS ISEB Diploma in business analysis or similar  • Relevant non-IS qualifications will also be considered on the basis they match the skills profile.  Job Dimensions:  • Takes ownership for delivery of analysis deliverables for large sized projects and programmes of work up to £50m. Key Interfaces: • Business Users & Senior Business Management• IS Business Consultants & Relationship Managers• Project Manager & Programme Delivery Managers• Solution Architects & Enterprise Architects• Partner resources• IS Procurement, IS Finance, IS Service DeliveryCoreBusiness Skills: • Commercial Awareness - Strongly contributes to business objectives/strategy. Analyses commercial information to ensure sound business decision making. Frequently pursues added value ideas and actions. Understands the global marketplace and impact upon the business function.  • Leadership & Team Working - Frequently encourages other team members and helps the team in decision making and planning. Works to build team spirit and to resolve any conflicts. Acts as a role model within the team and as a representative to customers/stakeholders. Leads continuous improvement activities.  • Customer Focus - Manages customers requirements and underlying needs. Has a depth of understanding in monitoring and reviewing service levels and actively seeking to improve them. Anticipates customers long-term needs with increased input into the decision-making process. Seen as a trusted adviser.  • Drive and Initiative - Without Focuses attention of self and others on key objectives and tasks. Frequent demonstration of personal commitment to do whatever it takes. Responds positively to setbacks and takes appropriate action to get back on track.  • Business Analysis Techniques Demonstrates an understanding of the appropriate use of analysis tools. Can knowledgeably advise on selection and use of most suitable techniques. Acts as a trusted advisor for the subject area. Consistently demonstrates the ability to lead analysis work on large-scale projects. Handles complex business areas with numerous influences/external interactions. Uses initiative and provides leadership in terms of delivering effective analysis objectives. Shows clear perception of business goals and areas of strategic influence in relation to analysis activity. Ensures consistently effective business recommendations. Influences business direction as a result of the thorough analysis. Carries out impact assessments across a wide area. Has effective relationships with stakeholders at all levels, including internal and external business partners. Has a wide knowledge of the functional structure of all business areas within the organization. Has a sound understanding of the range of business objectives, strategies and CSFs for the majority of the business functions within the organization.  • Information Capture - Has a command of appropriate information modeling tools. Demonstrates clarity and understanding. Works independently on information modeling activities. Able to supervise others on the selection and use of appropriate modeling tools. Sees all relationships between data in different views and effectively selects appropriate models to demonstrate or determine an overall view of a process or problem.  • Communication Skills - Works independently to conduct a stakeholder analysis to understand communication preferences and characteristics (e.g. scope of influence, their influencing and persuasion skills, attention to detail and approaches required to manage the characteristics). Applies analysis without supervision. Without supervision, regularly selects the most appropriate communication method based on the goals and characteristics of the audience. Independently facilitates and manages meetings/workshops with complexity. Able to supervise and support others on facilitation techniques. Has good influencing skills and communicates in a persuasive and convincing manner. Workshops/meetings are fully inclusive and interactive. Consistently achieves objectives of meeting/ workshop.  • Business Process Improvement Skills - Analyses all aspects of current business processes and business aims to identify improvements, both at a project level and strategically. This includes end-business aims as well as IS business aims. Evaluates wider issues including cultural, organizational and business constraints affecting options for change. Leads identification of potential alternative processes to achieve or exceed business aims. Assesses the risks, costs, potential benefits and feasibility of the potential approaches. Facilitates cost estimation by obtaining information and costs from potential suppliers and from experience of previous projects. Prepares business cases and investment papers for the recommended approach for all sizes of project. Leads in ensuring the successful implementation of new processes. Develops means of identifying that the changed business processes deliver the expected improvements. Helps to improve and develop the Solution Delivery Process within IS  • Project Management - Can support the production of detailed project plans. Applies appropriate control techniques at all times unsupervised. When needed, supports others. Has basic knowledge of Financial Planning techniques; manages small budgets and where necessary, takes corrective action Identifies and manages risks associated with the project including mitigating actions and running risk workshops. Has an understanding of other projects in the portfolio and associated dependent risks. Acts as advisor to less experienced colleagues

Name: Consulting Business Systems Analyst
Description: PURPOSE AND SCOPE:Determine, analyze, validates and lead the definition of critical business processes in support of developing integration components integrating applications throughout FMCNA. Manage the implementation of integration tasks associated with a given project in a framework consistent with other development efforts. Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst  07-Sep-2018 Position Summary BCG’s Knowledge Services (KS) group is a growing, global team that drives knowledge management strategy, program implementation and operations for BCG. The KS team provides overall management of major knowledge management platforms, products and programs, including efforts in areas such as machine learning/artificial intelligence, expertise/reputation management, search, content management, social collaboration/communities, taxonomy, analytics, business request management and other related topics. Within KS, the Digital Knowledge Group is a new and growing team focused on developing and deploying leading edge knowledge solutions supporting BCG’s business goals, through leverage of data, analytics and cognitive solutions.  We are seeking a Data Analyst or junior Data Engineer to play a crucial role in analyzing user behavior telemetry and producing actionable insights to inform the development of a knowledge management and collaboration platform. The role will work closely with machine learning experts and product management in analyzing web application logs and analytics, creating effective reports and visualizations, identifying key user activity patterns, and translating them into business requirements. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, strong collaborative and execution capabilities, excellent communication skills, a practical and flexible mindset, high attention to detail and work quality, and robust understanding of business matters. A strong interest in developing additional data science/engineering capabilities is also desired. This ensures that our clients achieve sustainable competitive advantage, build more capable organizations, and secure lasting results. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: OverviewCompany Overview:Bain & Company is one of the world’s leading global business consulting firms. Founded in 1973, we currently have thousands of employees in more than 50 offices worldwide. We have developed a track record of delivering results through tailored, pragmatic, actionable solutions for our clients. Bain has worked with thousands of major multinational organizations from every economic sector, in every region of the world. Position Summary:Working as a member of the Global Financial Planning & Analysis group, you will report on the financial performance of our business to senior leadership. By gathering information from key business partners and internal systems, you will support the data driven decisions that drive key aspects of Bain’s operations and strategy. You will also be an important financial partner that supports operational and functional leadership by developing financial and operational plans for the business. Do you have a passion for analyzing corporate financial performance data and turning it into tangible insights and results? If so, you might really enjoy this position. To learn more please review the job description below and contact us if it sounds interesting to you. ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities will be engaging, varied and challenging, but will include developing and analyzing annual financial plans for various parts of the business. You will then support our management team by tracking against those financial plans, highlighting and explaining variances and recommending potential actions to address business issues. This will require you to gain an understanding of not just the financials, but also the strategic and operational goals of key business segments. When additional information is needed, you will help develop and implement new financial systems that allow for the right data to be tracked and analyzed. You will also help our senior business leaders look at their teams through a more strategic lens, developing longer term plans that help them achieve their most important business goals. When our management team meets to make the most important decisions for our business, you will help with the analysis and presentation materials that allow them to make the most informed choices. As your skill set grows you will innovate on ways to analyze the business and proactively recommend changes that will help continue Bain’s long term track record of success in our industry. QualificationsBS/BA in Business/Accounting/Finance preferred; will also consider Economics, Math or other analytic fields with strong interest in Business/Finance; high academic achievement requiredExcellent organizational, quantitative and analytic skills with a very strong aptitude for problem solvingVery strong proficiency with Excel (financial modeling & data aggregation, lookups, pivots), working knowledge of PowerPoint, experience in advanced data aggregation and visualization tools a plusStrong interpersonal & communication skills, ability to make the numbers come alive by clearly conveying complex information in a way that supports decision makingStrong professional standards and business ethicsEnthusiastic team player, productive working independently or as part of a groupInd123

Description: Job Number 18-066370 Post Date 11/26/2018 Job Title Demand Planning Analyst III - Retail Business Services Positions Available 1 Operating Company Retail Business Services Full/Part Time Status Full-Time FLSA Status Exempt (Salary) Address 1385 Hancock St City Quincy State MA Description Retail Business Services, LLC, is the services company of Ahold Delhaize USA, currently providing services to six East Coast grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, GIANT/MARTIN'S, Hannaford and Stop & Shop, as well as the country’s largest online grocery retailer, Peapod.  Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provides industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies with services including Commercial Services and Strategy, Operations, Information Technology, Financial Services, Legal Services, Communications, Supply Chain and People Systems and Services.  Position Title: Demand Planning Analyst  Position Location: Quincy, MA Position Summary: Responsible for collaborating with leadership team in the implementation of a selling organization culture with a consumer-centric focus through the Demand Planning Analyst responsibilities. Business expert to develop, implement, and manage the Forecasting and Replenishment (F&R) System's forecasting capabilities. Provides guidance and acts as a key contributor for strategic demand planning practices that support our banner strategies, inventory targets, and collective supply chain objectives. Collects, merges, and shares pertinent information to create a single, unified demand forecast within the F&R System. Applies seasoned in-depth knowledge of industry forecasting processes and methods. Identifies drivers through root cause analysis of forecast variances, then quantifies and implements updates to complex forecasting systems and processes. Utilizes exception-based analysis and forecast accuracy results to drive sales growth, maximize inventory investment, and enable business process improvement. Principle Duties and Responsibilities:Subject Matter Expert for managing and leveraging the demand planning capabilities within the F&R System.Responsible for maintaining the F&R System’s forecasting capabilities for creating daily orders for Buyers to review.Partnering closely with the Buying team that the DPA supports to help translate extensive product knowledge into appropriate system actions.Coordinate and provide leadership for growth projects within the organization.Work closely with the Super Users on business rules modifications, system regression testing, and optimization models, which would include truck building and economic order quantities.Organize and manage scheduled demand consensus meetings with category teams in support of establishing a Sales and Operations Planning Process.Partner with other business functions within Supply Chain, Pricing, and Category teams to leverage end-to-end forecast visibility to support a unified demand forecasting process.Responsible for overall F&R System forecast accuracy and support of inventory management in partnership with merchandising, distribution, and retail functions.Work within F&R System to measure, analyze, and create appropriate-term forecasts, while maximizing item-level forecast accuracy to drive supply chain optimization.Execute exception-based analysis to identify drivers in forecast error variances, with an aggressive approach to quantify and implement changes to improve forecasting and replenishment within F&R System.Analyze and execute F&R System processes for new items, along with store and marketing events.Collaborate with the Super Users to maintain and execute system enahacements and the functional expansion of the F&R System's capabilities.Ability to distill complicated data and analysis into actionable recommendations, guidance, and conclusions.Partner with Category Management and Supply Chain Leadership to provide forecast analysis with influence to the long-term strategies.Communicate, demonstrate, and inspire behaviors in others that drive a consumer demand driven Supply Chain strategy.Maintain a 24/7 on-call rotation with other DPAs and Super Users.With direction from the Super Users, take action for weather events to proactively manage demand in coordination with supply chain activities.Occasional travel to banner retail locations for research or specific initiatives. Requirements Basic Requirements:Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and related work experience in Mathematics, Economics, SCM, Logistics, IT, or other relevant subject expertise3 to 5 years of experience in Demand Planning, Forecasting, Category Management, Pricing, Logistics, Procurement, or Distribution OperationsSkills and Abilities:Mature level of knowledge for company, business and industry practicesProficient with Microsoft OfficeAPICS, IBF, or MIT certification preferableProficiency in working within a cloud-based systemIn depth knowledge of industry forecasting processes and methodsExperience with IT road map developmentExperience with IT User Acceptance Testing (UAT) processesWorking knowledge of Tableau and Alteryx systemsDemonstrate a personal acceptance of change and the ability to adapt and drive changeDemonstrate an ability to implement and analyze retail business using consumer insights and trendsStrong root cause analytical skill setComfort working within a highly technical environmentActive listener with an ability to build trust across varying levels of the organizationStrong training and teaching skillsExcellent organizational, planning, influence, communication, and presentation skillsSelf-motivated and persuasive in presenting and selling ideas, and executing their implementationAble to handle multiple prioritiesDetail orientedAbility to manage day-to-day activity for identified responsibilitiesAbility to influence without authorityAbility to work as part of a teamAbility to think innovativelyAbility to work with all levels of management

Name: Veeva Business Analyst
