Name: IT Business Analyst II-US
Description: Job Description IT Business Analyst II-US  Waltham, MA  12 MonthsDescription: The IS/IT Cyber Security Business Analyst is responsible for assessing the business needs of the project, converting these into formal business requirements, and producing the documents that will allow the (remainder of the) project team to define, develop and implement a solution that will meet these needs. He/she will produce the Investment Proposal, Business Requirements, and the Total Cost of Ownership and provide input to a range of other project deliverables. Cyber Security experience preferred.*Key Accountabilities: " Delivery of analysis deliverables for medium and some large sized projects such as the investment proposal, business requirements document, and supporting analysis deliverables.  " Investigates work to determine business requirements and specify business processes, through improvements in information systems, information management, practices, procedures and organization change. Conducts investigations for strategy studies, business requirements and feasibility studies.  " Applies and monitors the use of required modeling and analysis tools. Methods and standards giving special consideration to business perspectives.  " Identifies stakeholders and their business needs. Knowledge & Experience Required: " Good Leadership skills and a tracking record of ability to influence business or IS colleagues.  " Experience of undertaking roles in which analytical thinking is applied to produce business improvements within the clients environment  " Knowledge of IS project development processes and wider organization units of IS is preferred but not mandatory  " An understanding of how the client is organized as a business, what the business functions do at a high level and how the client and makes money  " Understanding of the purpose of business process teams and the new RIIO regulatory framework. Qualifications Required: " Relevant business analysis qualification e.g. working towards or has BCS ISEB Diploma in business analysis or similar qualification or experience that demonstrates analysis skills. Key Interfaces: " Business Users  " IS Business Consultants  " Project Manager  " Solution Architects  " Partner resources  " IS Procurement, IS Finance, IS Service Delivery Core Business Skills: " Commercial Awareness - Consistently takes into consideration commercial implications of actions when making decisions or setting objectives for self or others.  " Leadership & Team Working - Strongly demonstrates team working through sharing the workload to ensure the team meets its objectives. Keeps the team informed and up to date with relevant information and consistently is encouraging continuous improvement.  " Customer Focus - Shows depth of approach in communication with customers. Developing relationships with customers to address underlying needs and identify areas for improvement.  " Drive and Initiative - Without supervision will apply extra effort to meet the team's objectives and deadlines. Demonstrates a strong determination to achieve business goals despite opposition.  " Business Analysis Techniques - Familiar with a broad range of modelling techniques. Works independently. Frequently provides advice/support to colleagues on areas of knowledge. Has proved competent to work on a few larger scale or more complex projects. Shows a desire to improve techniques and methods employed. Frequently demonstrates sound understanding of the key purpose of analysis activity. Can effectively analyse given information, identifying relevant relationships and resolving given business problems. Can independently pick up new analysis tools and techniques quickly. Analysis deliverables benefit from peer review but do not require significant rework Frequently demonstrates a sound understanding of the key objectives and strategies of the majority of business functions within the organization  " Information Capture - Demonstrates a sound knowledge of the appropriate information capture techniques appropriate for any situation. Works independently on information capture activities. Able to supervise others on the selection and use of appropriate techniques. Identifies the needs of different classes of stakeholders and knows how those needs would be catered for in the management of interviews, workshops, materials, etc. for such stakeholders.  " Communication Skills - Under minor supervision, conducts stakeholder analysis to understand communication preferences and certain characteristics. Occasionally applies analysis without supervision. Without supervision, regularly selects the most appropriate communication method based on goals and characteristics of the audience. Adapts templates to complete documents appropriate for the audience, with limited repetition of information.  " Business Process Improvement Skills - Analyses information gathered about current business processes and business aims to identify improvements at a project level, including balancing end-business aims with IS business aims. Is aware of wider issues including cultural, organisational and business constraints affecting options for change. Identifies potential alternative processes to achieve business aims. Helps assess the risks, costs, potential benefits and feasibility of the potential approaches. Facilitates cost estimation by obtaining information and costs from potential suppliers and from experience of previous projects. Prepares business cases for the recommended approach for medium sized projects.  " Project Management - Demonstrates the ability to produce plans to support the definition of schemes of some complexity. Regularly supports project control techniques, sometimes unsupervised. Identifies and manages risks associated to the project including mitigating actions and running risk workshops. Cyber Security experience preferred.*

Name: Principal Business Analyst, (R\u0026D IT) Planisware Portfolio Management
Description: Principal Business Analyst R&D IT Portfolio Management  20-Sep-2018 Location US-MA-Cambridge Job Description Biogen has one of the most exciting pipelines in the Biotech / Pharmaceutical industry. Over the next five years, the company plans to significantly grow its portfolio.  Along with this growth comes many exciting opportunities to work with our expanding business areas. One of these opportunities is to work in R&D Ops IT to support the growing needs of the R&D strategy and Operations organization. Drug discovery and early development research at Biogen is a foundational capability that supports the company’s mission to develop new medicines in Neuroscience related to worldwide neurological disorders.  The program managers working in these areas have diverse needs for technology that enables portfolio and resource decision support analysis, program and functional timeline and resource management, program/HR/Finance metadata integrations. They use a variety of software tools and systems to support their work, from specialized desktop software to hosted enterprise systems.  As a technical group supporting R&D Ops IT we are seeking a talented individual to innovatively address and solve process, technology, data, information and analysis challenges. The successful candidate will be a member of the R&D Ops IT group and will work in close partnership with their peers across the Company. Members of the R&D IT Ops group will be expected to deal with a changing and diverse research arena and should display a willingness to learn new technology and systems supporting research agility.  As a member of the R&D Ops IT team, the business Analyst role will be responsible for gathering use cases and requirements in support of initial concepts and projects. S/he will work with stakeholders to ensure that the stakeholder needs are accurately captured and clear to create a best fit solution. S/he will define data flow and business process diagrams and research the potential use of existing tools. They will also be responsible for deliverables per the system development life cycle such as business requirements, functional requirements, traceability matrices, etc.  The key responsibilities of this Business Analyst position include: Process & Requirements: Eliciting, refining and documenting requirements from end users via interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.Data Analysis & Evaluation: Analyzing and evaluating information gathered from multiple sources, reconciling conflicts, translating high-level information into details, as well as being able to redefine low level details into higher level general overarching documentation, and distinguishing user requests from the underlying true business needs.IT-Facing Solution Delivery: Translating business needs into application and operational requirements to ensure that the business requirements are understood so that plan, build, and run can effectively deliver. Comfort with current relevant solution technologies such as Planisware is required.Delivering the following artifacts as needed: Business Requirements, Functional requirements, Use Cases, Test cases, Validation protocols and drive document review processesWorking with end users to define concepts with the guidance of project ownersSuccessfully engaging in multiple initiatives simultaneouslyServing as the conduit between the end users and the technical teams.Manage regular meeting with stakeholders and end usersRequisition Number31853BREmployment Category Full-Time Regular External Posting Title Principal Business Analyst, (R&D IT) Planisware Portfolio Management Job Category Information Technology QualificationsDemonstrable knowledge and background in Life Sciences Projects delivery as a business analyst.Excellent proficiency in technical writing and technical documentation managementExcellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate complex technology matters to audiences with varying degrees of technical background. Proficiency in articulating how technology can be used to enhance/enable R&D Operations capabilities.Experience with software development life cycle methodology(s) such as agile and waterfall, and the components that make up the software life cycle in line with highly structured framework, e.g. GxP.Strong client interface and presentation skills, able to build relationships and a willingness to extend across multiple facets of the organization.Excellent interpersonal skills and teamwork skills, with the ability to interact with business users, technical team, project managers, senior management, outsourced service providers, and vendors.Excellent verbal and written communication.Ability to operate effectively in a matrix environment; team player; must possess strong time management skills, attention to detail and organization skills.Track record of initiative and outstanding performance, along with being a self-starter and ability to perform and complex task and resolve issues with a minimum of supervision.Passion for learningQualifications Required:Personnel with a minimum of 5 years’ experience as a technical business analyst with applicable experience within bio-pharmaceuticals, pharmaceutical research, and /or the medical device industry as well as a prior scientific background will be considered for this role.Previous work in GxP-validated environments will be required.Business Analysts with prior understanding and working of knowledge of Planisware will be preferred.Education Minimum BA or BS in life sciences/computer sciences required. Experience Level Associate Summary Biogen has one of the most exciting pipelines in the Biotech / Pharmaceutical industry. Over the next five years, the company plans to significantly grow its portfolio. Along with this growth comes many exciting opportunities to work with our expanding business areas. One of these opportunities is to work in R&D Ops IT to support the growing needs of the R&D strategy and Operations organization.

Name: Global Finance Operations Analyst
Description: Global Finance Operations Analyst26-Nov-2018Position SummaryThe Global Finance Operations Team (GFOT) is a virtual finance function comprised of ten International Controllers and Adjacent Business Model Directors that are located in all four of BCG’s regions.Key areas of focus for the GFOT include acting as advisors to the CFO and Global Finance leadership, supporting challenges for local/regional/global finance initiatives, embedding risk management into the local offices, and managing the team structure and operations of the field. The GFOT delivers value along a variety of dimensions including strategic alignment, risk management, people management, operational efficiency, Learning & Development, special initiatives, and policy setting.To be successful in this role, an individual must be a fast learner who is excited by new and difficult challenges, and is a strong team player. The Global Finance Operations Analyst will build a working knowledge of BCG’s global finance function and priorities, and use this context to help drive initiatives forward. This role requires a self-starter who can work independently, seek opportunities to expand responsibilities, and possesses the ability to be flexible and shift gears based on the needs of the business. A successful candidate will quickly develop an understanding of local and global finance roles and responsibilities including management, statutory reporting, and business metrics for evaluating the business’ performance.Job ID7775BRCompany InformationThe Boston Consulting Group (BCG) is a global management consulting firm and the world’s leading advisor on business strategy. We partner with clients from the private, public, and not-for-profit sectors in all regions to identify their highest-value opportunities, address their most critical challenges, and transform their enterprises. Our customized approach combines deep insight into the dynamics of companies and markets with close collaboration at all levels of the client organization. This ensures that our clients achieve sustainable competitive advantage, build more capable organizations, and secure lasting results. Founded in 1963, BCG is a private company with offices in more than 90 cities in 50 countries. For more information, please visit bcg.com.Employee TypeRegular Basic Job RequirementsBachelor’s Degree1 – 3 years’ experience in relevant field preferredFoundational understanding of finance/accounting/management reporting preferredProficient in MS Office applications – Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, WordFamiliarity with MS SharePoint is a plusOutstanding interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skillsProject management skills within a fast-paced, dynamic teamStrong customer service orientation with creative and resourceful problem solving skills – “can do” attitudeExceptional attention to detailProactive self-starter, highly motivated and innovativeAbility to work independently on multiple, simultaneous assignments with minimal supervisionMust be authorized to work in the United StatesJob TypeFull timeNon-discrimination StatementThe Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws. In addition, as a federal government contractor, BCG maintains an affirmative action program which furthers its commitment and complies with recordkeeping and reporting requirements under certain federal civil rights laws and regulations.BCG is an E-Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify. VEVRAA Federal ContractorCountryUnited StatesCity/TownBoston FunctionFinanceJob ResponsibilitiesInitially the role will be 100% dedicated to BCG Finance’s Learning and Development Program; establishing the content and framework of that Program as an institutionally sustainable one. We expect this effort will likely take a year or less. Following this, the role to be split roughly 50/50 with 50% allocated to L&D ongoing operations and program development and 50% allocated to project support for the GFOT as described below. Learning and Development RoleSupport operations and continued development of the Worldwide Finance Learning & Development (L&D) program with a focus on information management, coordination of existing channels, and supporting strategic priorities to enable a scalable learning program.Support coordination and/or facilitation of existing Finance L&D offeringsFinance@BCG intranet site administrationPost new and updated content in a timely manner on behalf of finance functions, manage file repository/access permissions, support changes to website layout to improve navigationVirtual Learning Series (~monthly live trainings)Worldwide Finance Quarterly Newsletter (quarterly email distribution)Finance “Wire” (~bi-weekly training email distributions)Finance Essentials Series (foundational training materials)Content creationLeverage existing content and subject matter experts to create new and improved training materials, email distributions, etc.CommunicationsCoordinate and distribute L&D communications through Salesforce Marketing Cloud (i.e. Wire, Newsletter, Survey distributions, etc.)Stakeholder managementDevelop relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the finance function and in many BCG locations across the world to foster a stronger connection between Finance L&D, the global finance sub-functions, and the local/regional finance teamsSupport identification and development of strategic priorities to increase Finance L&D impact including:Support development of role-based learning curriculumSupport development of Onboarding harmonization initiativeMeasure impactSupport quarterly reporting on L&D milestones and engagement metrics for readouts to the Functional Finance Leadership TeamProject roleThe GFOT International Controllers and Adjacent Business Model Directors (a Team of 10 Directors) are involved in key firm projects and initiatives. These projects often require analysis, project management, liaising with staff in offices around the globe, and stakeholder communications. This role will be actively engaged on these projects by supporting GFOT members throughout the initiative.Recent examples include:Capacity analysisRisk Management analysisPolicy developmentGFOT budget trackingSystem upgrades and/or replacementWorldwide Finance Meeting coordination (contracting, logistics, communications)Job TitleGlobal Finance Operations Analyst

Name: Principal Financial Analyst
Description: Fuel your intellectual curiosity and professional growth. Forrester is an idea company, where smart, motivated, curious people bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on ideas that change the course of business. Most of all, bring a point of view; here, every voice has value. At Forrester, you’ll work with innovative clients at emerging and established brands; these are the business and technology leaders we inspire and who inspire us. The Forrester experience is built on a singular, powerful purpose: to challenge thinking and lead change. About This Role: The Principal Financial Analyst is a key partner to business unit leaders and provides them with forward-looking decision support by conducting and effectively presenting insightful planning and analysis. The Principal Financial Analyst leads or contributes meaningfully to the following critical processes for his or her assigned business units: Annual operating budget.Monthly rolling forecast.Monthly accounting close and financial review.Weekly resource planning.Special projects: business cases, process optimization, M&A support, etc.Elevating financial acumen of business partners.Engage as a business partner with the leaders of the business units assigned to you, and maintain a productive relationship that improves understanding of the key business drivers and facilitates fluid and effective decision making.Project-manage the annual planning process for assigned business units.Assist the monthly and quarterly accounting close by reviewing and reconciling financial results, including bookings, revenue, and expenses as appropriate.Update the monthly rolling forecast in collaboration with business unit leaders.As part of the monthly financial review process, document and present to business unit and finance leadership: 1) variance analysis and commentary for actual results compared to plan and to prior year and 2) an updated rolling forecast summary that includes risks, opportunities, and actionable course-correction recommendations.Participate in the weekly resource planning process, ensuring optimization of available talent and nonpeople resources.Maintain assigned databases in the FP&A planning system related to monthly close and management reporting.Evolve financial forecasting and planning models to ensure forecast accuracy and quality are always improving.Contribute to special projects as needed, such as investor relations analytical support, strategic planning, process optimization, business case preparation, external benchmarking, and M&A support.Help to improve the financial acumen of your peers, your business partners, and their teams.A bachelor’s degree in business, with eight to 10 years of related business experience; an MBA or post-graduate degree is strongly preferred.Demonstrated mastery of fundamental techniques in corporate financial analysis as well as a firm grasp on methods employed to evaluate financial performance of public companies.A polished professional with outstanding presentation skills who pursues knowledge of the business and industry to produce insightful analysis to support the decision-making process.A strategic thinker with a sense of urgency, a commitment to quality, and the ability to independently prioritize the most impactful tasks in a fast-paced environment.A team player who has demonstrated the ability to partner with the C-level, is comfortable coaching and being coached, and will elevate the team.Expert knowledge of Excel (sophisticated modeling, manipulating and analyzing large data sets, etc.).A solid understanding of database structure (CRM, data warehouse, ERP, etc.) and experience with a variety of financial systems.Experience with public midsize service/consulting organizations is a plus.Explore #ForresterLife on:YouTubeTwitterFacebookInstagramLinkedInGlassdoorFLSA Status: Exempt  Forrester Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity for all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, genetic information, military service, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. Minorities, Women, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans are especially encouraged to apply.

Name: Technical Implementation Consultant - Analyst
Description: Position: Technical Implementation Consultant 2019 Overview: Recognized on the Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies in the US, Peloton is one of the largest and fastest growing professional services firms specializing in Integrated Cloud Solutions for Enterprise Resource Planning, Enterprise Performance Management, and Big Data and Analytics. At the core of who we are – we believe that business analytics is changing the competitive landscape. Companies that are equipped with the right information, have the know-how, and the enabling technology to consistently leverage analytics will gain a competitive advantage.  Our company provides an opportunity to work with consulting professionals in a collaborative, stimulating, entrepreneurial environment. Where individuals look forward to arriving at work each day, are recognized and appreciated, and are allowed to move boundaries and take calculated risks for greater success. Our teams partner with business leaders to develop unique and innovative solutions that generate real business results. Beyond results, we also strive to make every engagement educational and fun. Yes – fun! We really like what we do and we let it show.  If you are interested in being part of our high performing and growing organization – and have strong passion for business and/or technical consulting; especially as related to analytics, enterprise performance management, cloud solutions, or information management – you may be a good fit for our team. Our proven innovative approach to accelerate solution deployment and enhance value through experiential learning delivers solutions that assure quality and adoption. Join the revolution and lead organizations on a journey to compete in the 21st century!  Specific responsibilities include:Defining business requirements and providing recommendations to resolve client pain pointsContributing to team brainstorms and effectively communicating informationDesigning, prototyping, and building technical solutionsConducting system integration testing and user acceptance testingDelivering end user training and conducting knowledge transfer sessions with the clientDeveloping Peloton knowledge assets and intellectual propertyRequired Experience and Skills:Qualified candidates must have a BS or BA degree in Finance, Business/ Consulting, Technology, or equivalentExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsEagerness to work in a team oriented environment, high levels of initiative and driveProficient in Microsoft Excel and AccessAbility to quickly understand and decompose financial and technical conceptsExposure to technologies: web (Java, HTML, Python), relational database (Oracle, SQL), reporting, or data analysis/data miningAbility and willingness to travel within the United States Compensation:Competitive Base Salary and Performance BonusMedical, Dental, and Vision Insurance401K with a supporting company matchFlexible SpendingTechnical and Business Skills TrainingPaid Holidays and Vacation DaysDiscounts on Pet Insurance Peloton Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, genetics, or veteran status.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: ezCater is the #1 online - and the only nationwide - marketplace for business catering in the United States a $23.9 billion market. Our 3.3M+ on-time ratings and reviews, our 60K+ caterers and restaurants, and our 5-star customer service make it superbly easy for business people to find and order great food for their meetings. We're backed by Insight Venture Partners, Iconiq Capital, and Wellington Management, we're on a path to $1B in 2019 and $2B in 2020, and we'll get there even more surely if you come help us.  The role will work cross-functionally to drive business insight throughout the organization. You'll rely on analytical and interpersonal skills to support a growing online two-sided marketplace. This is an ideal role for a bright and driven analyst who is looking to accelerate their career path. What you'll do:Develop financial models and work on special projects to assist with decision making, planning and reporting.Analyze current and historical cohort data to create forecasts for future periods. Drive visible analysis on LTV and unit economics by channel trends.Work across the Finance team to consolidate financial results and metrics in support of monthly close processes, including:Validating data integrity, accuracy, and consistencyAnalyzing and interpreting data to understand key drivers of financial resultsPreparing standardized reports and insightful analysis for Director of Finance and other key stakeholdersAssisting with revenue and expense forecasting during annual budget processesAnalyzing results to ensure proper presentation of variancesProviding M&A analysis and insightYou have:1-4 years of experience in a corporate finance role (Technology industry experience is preferred)A strong understanding of budgets, forecasts, and financial statementsProven ability to operate independently and manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environmentThe desire to work in a start-up environment  • Impressive attention to detail and accuracyAn easy time communicating -- you're comfortable interacting with a variety of audiences within the organizationAdvanced Excel skills with some exposure to SQL and/or VBA a plus What you'll get from us: Most importantly, you'll get sane working hours and a huge amount of flexibility around work/life balance. Have people in your life of any age who always, often, or sometimes need your help? We make room for that. Have a bad thing or a good thing happen to you? We make room for that, too.  Oh, and here's what else you'll get: Market salary, stock options you'll help make worth a lot, the usual holidays, all-you-can-eat vacation, 401K, health/dental/FSA, long-term disability insurance, subsidized T-passes, a great office in the heart of Boston, a tremendous amount of responsibility and autonomy, wicked awesome co-workers, cupcakes (and many more goodies), and knowing that you helped get this rocket ship to the moon. ezCater is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace humans of every background, appearance, race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, and disability status. At the same time, we do not employ jerks, even brilliant ones.

Through negotiations, support local brand strategies, align vendors to precise plans and leverage size/scale. Name: IT Business Analyst, IS Projects
Description: About us Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.  To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business. Job Purpose We are seeking an individual to coordinate and provide management assistance to the definition, implementation and improvements of IT governance controls processes, procedures and tools. This includes: Project and program sanctioning, collaborating across IS and other NG governance committees, assist in Investment planning, both annual and as needed throughout the fiscal year, collaborating and coordinating with multiple IS teams including but not limited to Business Partners and production planning within Program Delivery, contribute to and assist in timely responses to Rate Cases, supporting the IT Regulatory team; contribute to IT compliance to audit, risks, ethics, safety and other management policies and requirements, and coordinate Finance process and handoffs across the IT Build process / investment lifecycle.  In addition, this individual will also support processes and behaviors that improve the efficiency and compliance to both IS and NG, including but not limited to: Financial accounting for IT investments, liaising and coordinating with IT FinancePlanning and governance alignment with Procurement and related commercial policies and processesCommunications and training for proliferating a including but not limited to the sanction process.Support the tracking and reporting of metrics monitoring and measuring projects delivering accurate, timely and reliable insights to the performance of investments.Key AccountabilitiesCoordinate, execute and continuously improve the IS governance (sanctioning) process, including oversight of planning and approval meetingsMaintain and deliver appropriate SOPs, training and communications to ensure compliance to IT policies and procedures, including but not limited to governance and financial treatmentsPrepare appropriate plan views for and SOX complianceSupervisory/Interpersonal- Experience RequiredInterpersonal experience requiredStrong interpersonal and facilitation skills across diverse stakeholder groups, in a virtual and experience in quality assurance and data managementExcellent Excel skillsExcellent people management and meeting facilitation skillsAwareness and understanding of the project development life-cycleStrong technical skills in Excel, SharePoint, Access, and PowerPlantProfessional writing, presentation and facilitation skillsKnowledge with corporate business planning processesKnowledge of experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. Name: Business Analyst for Facilities
Description: SOFT's client located in Waltham, MA is looking for a Business Analyst for a long term contract assignment. This position would be responsible to perform activities that support the company's interconnection of customer distributed generation facilities.These activities would support areas such as, but not limited to, contract administration, renewable energy and net metering programs, various stakeholder reporting, program and/or online portal management, cost reconciliation, process improvement and on-going operational responsibilities for such facilities in accordance with applicable interconnection requirements involving FERC, ISO-NE, state regulatory and corporate tariffs and operating procedures Key Accountabilities Provide billing support for the development of Distributed Energy Resource (DER) programs in across company service territories.Act as the primary point of contact for internal & external stakeholders on DER Programs such as but not limited to SMART VDER, ReGrowth and Community Net Metering.Work cross functionally with Billing Operations, Metering, Account Management, Customer Response Center, and other groups as necessary, for successful execution and maintenance of DER programs.Maintain and analyze data to accurately forecast DG activities. Identify external drivers for the growth of interconnections in respective states.Demonstrate proficiency with the tools and systems used to gather the information necessary to accumulate and organize the data we use into appropriate outputs.Produce effective management information and reporting in order to provide insight on customers for more senior team members.Monitor and review work financial information, updating where necessary in order to identify any anomalies or discrepancies and ensure management has access to up-to-date and accurate information. Required skills: A Bachelor's degree in a related area and 2 years of related experience, or equivalent work experience. An advanced degree/credits or professional certification is preferred.Knowledge of the electric and gas industry, construction, and/or distributed generation is highly desirableBasic understanding of key financial concepts such as taxation and net present value.Proficiency in relevant software e.g. Microsoft Office Products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access)Experience with internal company systems (notably STORMS, Sharepoint, Salesforce and CSS) is highly desirable.Knowledge of regulatory concepts and rate making is highly desirable Job Type: Contract

Name: Cost Research / Estimating Analyst
Description: Overview  MEI Technologies is growing!  MEIT since 1992 is a nationwide technology company that has implemented process-oriented management and has redefined itself into the family-owned organization that offers innovative, best-value services and solutions within four focused capabilities: Engineering Services & Solutions, Modeling and Simulation, Space Systems, Design & Integration; and IT/Cyber Services & Solutions.  Why Choose MEIT At MEIT YOU WILL have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest, most experienced engineering and technology experts in the U.S.!!MEIT has established proven, quality work methods, including ISO, CMMI and AS9100 certifications.MEIT stands by delivering what we promise with flexibility, quality and integrity to our employees and our customers.MEIT reputation for entering a new markets, getting to work and generating immediate and impactful results. With an abundance of collaborative individuals MEIT is an organization that provides the opportunity to truly reach your potential as a professional.  Job Title: EPASS - Cost Research / Estimating  Location: Boston, Massachusetts  Relocation Assistance: Not at this time  Contact: Kristen Gaustad, Senior Technical Recruiter Kristen.Gaustad@meitechinc.com NO THIRD PARTY RECRUITERS PLEASE Overview  Cost Research: Provide knowledge and experience in conducting various types of specialized cost research efforts to enhance cost analysis and estimating capabilities.  Cost Estimating: Provide knowledge and experience in performing various cost estimating activities in support of all program phases. ResponsibilitiesCost Research: Responsible for, but is not limited to, data collection and analysis; program cost growth factor analysis; development of Cost Estimating Relationships (CERs); development of, or calibration of, cost models including expert system applications; and development of automated cost related data storage and retrieval systems. Cost Estimating: Responsible for, but not limited to, most probable cost estimates; cost analysis concurrent to the acquisition process; economic analysis; and probabilistic cost, schedule, technical, and programmatic risk assessments for Independent Review Teams (IRTs); Component Cost Analysis (CCA) and Analysis of Alternatives (AoAs). Includes experience in the operation of standardized cost models such as PRICE H, Software Evaluation and Estimation of Resources (i.e. SEER, SEM, SEER H), Revised Intermediate Constructive Cost Model (i.e. COCOMO II). Automated Cost Estimating Tools (ACEIT) and spreadsheet applications. QualificationsMust have a Secret ClearanceExperience with the Crystal Ball tool is required as well as familiarity with parametric cost analysis tools.Business, Accounting, Economics or related degree is required.More than 5 years' experience in a Cost estimating / research rolePreferred:DoD experience with Cost Estimating experience.Top Secret is DesiredMaster's degree is desSDL2017

Name: Sr Information Risk Analyst
Company: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Massachusetts
Description: Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.Reporting to the Sr. Manager of Information Risk Management, this key role performs information security due diligence to ensure that application and 3rd party risk is identified and managed by BCBSMA. This key role works as part of a highly collaborative team of experienced information security risk analysts who partner with key security risk Business Stakeholders, Legal, Privacy, Audit, Information Security and Vendor Management to safeguard the privacy of our confidential information. This is accomplished by performing information security risk assessments and then working with business owners, project teams and 3rd parties to develop remediation plans to reduce risk and enable projects which benefit the business. The role also partners with Procurement through an integrated process to identify outsourced services risk and negotiate contractual security requirements with 3rd parties.  Responsibilities: Utilizes expert level knowledge of applicable state and federal security and privacy regulations and security best practices to champion approaches across the business and IT delivery teams.Exhibits strong interpersonal relationships with procurement teams, Audit and Compliance team, architecture team, business partners, project managers, the IT Strategy & planning teams and Quality Assurance team.Lead and participate in cross-functional teams to develop security policies, standards and procedures assisting to communicate these to the IT Division.Serve as advisor and consultant to business units in planning and coordinating systems security analysis, design, and implementation/enhancement projects to automate processing or improve business systems.Conducts application and vendor risk assessments. Communicates resulting risk findings to stakeholders. Works collaboratively with project stakeholders to mitigate risks and facilitate senior leadership risk decisionsFunctions as a mentor to more junior members of the team providing training and guidance on operational issues and risk management strategies.  Qualifications:  • BA or BS degree in Systems, IT, Business Management, or related degree preferred; or equivalent experience8-10 years experience. 5+ years of strong Analyst or Project Management experience in the Information Security domain, with demonstrated competency executing an enterprise security programCISSP strongly preferredExperience achieving compliance with HIPAA and other state and federal privacy regulations preferredAudit certification a plus (CISM, CISA or equivalent)  #LI-MS1LocationBostonTime TypeFull time

Name: Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst, VP
Description: Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst, VPPurpose of Role: The mission of the Global Reporting Team within Finance & Risk Infrastructure & Business Solutions (FRIBS) is to support the strategic objectives of Finance, Treasury, Credit Risk, and Global Markets by enabling innovative data analytics and reporting solutions. The Global Reporting team, in support of a data-driven culture across the organization, is tasked with developing methods and controls to ensure the consistent application and use of data empowering our business partners by publishing controlled and consumable data via Spotfire, Cognos, and TIBCO Data Virtualization (TDV). Providing expertise in the areas of Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse tools and utilization, best practices, and business process management, the Global Reporting team will lead the development, design and execution of reporting and analytical solutions defining goals and objectives, meeting key project deadlines, and ensuring results are aligned with the overall business strategy. Working closely with business partners, the Global Reporting team will bridge the gap between technology and analytics by establishing and driving a long-term BI strategy and roadmap, managing an increasing demand for advanced analytics, and delivering interactive, robust data solutions through a self-service model.The ideal candidate will contribute to the execution of the Finance & Risk Infrastructure & Business Solutions (FRIBS) roadmap working directly with our business partners to understand their current data challenges, eliciting their requirements to define, scope, and deliver solutions that meet their business intelligence needs. Responsibilities:Design and implement reporting framework needed to support report development and delivery that is responsive to multiple cross organizational stakeholders/downstream constituent groups.Participate in cross organizational working groups in order to understand and prioritize reporting deliverables by adhering to a robust demand management process. Implement, and provide training on, query tools to enable the development of the reporting team’s analysis capabilities, automation of data quality metrics and enablement of ad- hoc analysis.Design and build queries, reports, and dashboards using business intelligence tools adhering to established frameworks and standardsActively participate in and influence discussions around reporting requirements, infrastructure needs, and designInterface directly with clients and project team members to understand the needs and objectives of the businessConsistently deliver high-quality business intelligence solutions and services to clients on scheduleBring structure to ambiguous business problems and recommend visualization solutions that can be easily interpreted by usersServe as end user support for the organizational user baseFollow, maintain and improve all documentation and procedures for report design and productionSponsor teamwork and encourage collaborationInfluence business process improvements by integrating data/tools with people/purpose and FRIBS visionQualifications: 7+ years of experience as a business/reporting analyst, in a dynamic business environment, with demonstrated reporting, analytical, and database experience; BS/BA requiredSelf-motivated, well-rounded, analytical self-starter with ability to work in a dynamic, collaborative, Agile team environment with aggressive deadlines, regular releases and multiple prioritiesSound understanding of BI best practices/ methodologies; experience with relational structures, structured query language (SQL), data warehouse and reporting techniquesExperience with business intelligence tools and data visualization concepts (i.e. Cognos, Spotfire, Tableau, QlikView or similar)Dimensional data modeling and understanding of OLAPStrong analytic skills with the ability to gather, synthesize, and organize data to solve complex problemsExcellent verbal, written communication and presentation skillsAbility to work collaboratively and effectively with business and systems personnelFamiliarity with Treasury products and balance sheet concepts

Name: Experienced Actuarial Analyst
Company: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Massachusetts
Description: Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.Why Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts? With almost 3 million members and roughly 50% of the market share, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts (BCBSMA) is a not for profit health insurance company in Massachusetts committed to making quality health care affordable. A career at BCBSMA offers many opportunities to make an impact on one of the biggest issues facing the U.S economy: health care cost. Growth opportunities, new challenging assignments, and coaching are available to help you on your career path. Why the Actuarial Services Department? The Actuarial Services team informs corporate strategy in critical areas including competitiveness, affordability, profitability, provider payment reform and health care policy. As an Analyst on the Actuarial Services team, you will work with a rich dataset and a robust well-established Enterprise Data Warehouse to identify emerging drivers of health care trend and cost, market pressures, and profitability. In a constantly evolving health care system, you will have the opportunity to build innovative models to design and analyze new products, provider payment structures, and health care delivery mechanisms that will lower cost and improve the quality of care provided to our members. What are we looking for in an applicant? The ideal candidate has a background in a quantitative field. Experience in working with large data sets and data driven decision-making is required. Also essential is close attention to detail, focus on results, and the ability to effectively present results. The candidate in this position is required to constantly innovate, challenge assumptions, and generate new ideas and process improvements. Finally, we are seeking a team player with the ability to collaborate with others towards shared goals. Required Technical and Behavior Competencies Use of software for data analysis; specifically spreadsheet and database systems (e.g. MS Excel, MS Access), data extraction and manipulation (e.g. COGNOS, SAS), data visualization (e.g. Tableau) and analytic automation (e.g. scripting, macros).Time management skills to execute on a variety of projects under specific time restraintsStrong written and oral communication skills in a variety of settingsCreative problem solving skillsExceptional analytical skills and technical expertiseThe ability to manage prioritiesEducation and ExperienceBachelor’s degree required with a focus in Math, Business, Health Care or related field strongly preferredA minimum of 3 years of experience preferably in healthcare or related industryAt least four actuarial exams are required to participate in the Actuarial Rotational ProgramCommitment to successfully participating in the Actuarial Rotational Program and obtaining FSA designation.Commitment to leadership development and becoming a business leader #LI-DNILocationBostonTime TypeFull time

Name: Senior Financial Analyst, MGPO Budget Office (Telehealth Support)
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT: Under the direction of the MGPO Budget & Financial Planning's Senior Manager, the Senior Financial Analyst will be an integral part of the MGH Center for TeleHealth (CTH) team. The CTH facilitates real-time, video-based interactions for healthcare clinicians and patients locally, nationally and internationally.  The incumbent will play a supportive role for the financial management and oversight, review, analysis, reporting, budget preparation, and special projects for the CTH.  Given the evolving nature of the telehealth landscape, the CTH is seeking a motivated and collaborative individual who takes initiative and functions well in a dynamic environment. The ideal candidate will serve as a business and financial liaison between MGPO Finance, the MGH CTH, and Partners Healthcare Finance/Accounting, and other assigned MGPO Administration programs. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Be a key business partner, providing financial review to the MGH Center for Telehealth. Develop and maintain open relationships with MGPO departments, PHS Accounting, Information Systems, as well as Practice and Finance Managers. The Senior Financial Analyst will provide high-level analyses for, and research around, a broad range of business issues and will need to be able to independently, and with due diligence, perform work on all areas of responsibility. Working with key administrative and clinical leaders, formulate and assist in the annual budget and forecasts on a modified cash-basis level. Participate in monthly Close activities, as required, to compile the monthly, quarterly, and year-end journal entries, as needed, that will be loaded into the General Ledger System, and communicate with various departments and entities to ensure completeness and accuracy, including revenue and cost drivers, FTE analysis, variance reports and analysis, and deviations from budgetary expectations. Model the ROI for new initiatives and strategic assessment efforts across all CTH programs, including the impact of different volume and payment scenarios. In collaboration with the Professional Billing Office and MGH Revenue, conduct a wide variety of detailed analyses to measure and evaluate payer reimbursement for MGH telemedicine procedures against that of in-person procedures and the overall industry. Assist with the development of fee structures and contractual agreements for regional, national, and international partners and clients. Analyze proposed, operational budget requests; coordinate questions and advance recommendations for discussion, and participate in negotiation of budget issues with management. Conduct a wide variety of analyses and forecasts to track CTH goals and support special projects, such as measurement of virtual volume performance, projection of virtual risk patient population for internal reimbursement purposes, and estimation of provider compensation payments. Develop process flows with key data reporting tasks and funds flow maps to appropriately track and manage operational funds, departmental contributions, and physician payments. Identify areas to streamline and improve existing processes (e.g. payment processes, financial and performance reporting, provider compensation models, etc.); propose recommendations in alignment with department and organizational goals. Manage contractual invoicing and the opening of Accounts Payable purchase orders, and facilitate transactions processing in PeopleSoft. Other duties and ad hoc analysis, as required.QualificationsSKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED: Demonstrate effectiveness in working in complex and dynamic environments and with complex systems. Ability to present and communicate knowledge and information with all levels of clinical and administrative staff in a clear and concise manner that is appropriate to the audience. Must be capable of operating at both the strategic and tactical level. Motivated self-starter with an extreme attention to detail and data accuracy. Ability and willingness to work independently and to take initiative when required. Ability to work with individuals at various levels of the organization. Analytical aptitude, with the ability to create/extract/manipulate/analyze financial and operational data. Ability to manage several projects simultaneously. A strong understanding of escrow, accrual, capital, depreciation, and any other relevant analyses. Financial and operational modeling skills. Ability to work with and learn multiple financial and reporting systems. Ability to build collaboration across the organization.LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, and/or REGISTRATIONS (if applicable): N/A EDUCATION: Specify minimum education and clearly indicate if preferred or required  Bachelor of Arts or Science required, preferably in Finance/AccountingEXPERIENCE: A minimum of 3-5 years of progressive financial and operational planning and analysis experience, ideally in a Healthcare setting required.  PeopleSoft, Hyperion, Cognos Business Tools, all Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access) SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable): The MGPO Financial Analyst has no direct reports. FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable): Financial Analysis, budgeting, planning, and reporting for a $1 billion organization WORKING CONDITIONS: Standard Office Setting, with ability to work extended hours as necessary  Travel to any Partners' facilities to attend off-site meetings  Expected to adhere to all privacy and security rules concerning data access  Partner's Healthcare is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.
