Name: Senior Analyst, Healthcare and Consumer Analytics
Company: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Massachusetts
Description: Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts seeks to continuously improve member experience and enhance member engagement through highly skilled analytic support. The Healthcare and Consumer Analytics Analyst supports these initiatives through ongoing evaluation of member behavioral responses to tools, products and incentives, guiding the refinement of high impact personalized tools and information for our members. They will provide analytical support cross functionally with Consumer Experience and Market Research teams on a wide range of projects supporting business decisions with actionable insights. The Analyst must possess strong analytic, programming and communication skills in order to identify and summarize key findings to help support corporate objectives. Major Responsibilities: • Lead core analysis and reporting activities to support consumer analytics measure development and program evaluation of member engagement initiatives. Collaboratively work with Consumer Engagement, Market Research, Actuarial Analytics, Prevention and Wellness, and Account Reporting teams to evaluate programs' impact on clinical, behavioral and health outcomes in supporting initiatives and support Sales value story and Account performance guarantees.  • Work with consumer data such as Net Promoter Score and CAHPS in order to identify opportunities to improve member experience.Enact program evaluation methodology and process measures of member behavior changes related to consumer engagement initiatives.  • Support consumer experience enhancement strategy by constructing consumer profiles for targeted member outreach through advanced analytics and modeling.  • Communicate findings to business partners clearly and efficiently in a way that tells a story. Facilitate discussion that will move the process forward.Represent Performance Measurement department on interdepartmental teams and work groups.  • Provide general support to division analytics projects that cover and are not limited to health care provider, account, and clinical data analysis/population health. Qualifications: • Demonstrated experience in analysis, interpretation & reporting using large-scale healthcare and consumer data sets to solve complex and strategically important problems.Proficient in SAS/Python/R for data collection, aggregation, cleaning, visualization and analysis.  • Experience with visual analytics and communication with tools like Tableau/PowerBI.Capable of managing deadlines and working simultaneously on a variety of tasks.Strong organizational and problem solving skills.Ability to communicate effectively. Education and Experience: Minimum of three years of experience in data analysis and reporting with either a health care or consumer focus.  BA/BS required, MA/MS in Math/Statistics/Biostatistics/Public Health/Economics/Computer Science or related field preferred  Knowledge of claims based healthcare data and the health insurance industry preferred. Knowledge of consumer data is preferred.  #LI-LH1LocationBostonTime TypeFull time

Name: Senior Analyst, Technology & Business Solutions – Functional Finance
Description: We need someone to come in to fill a gap on our team. We currently have two senior analyst roles open within G&A finance. This person would primarily be helping with support of the IT function, including: Management Reporting, Journal Entries, Account Reconciliations and trend analysis. Job Description : Senior Analyst, Technology & Business Solutions – Functional Finance  This Senior Analyst will manage the accounting and planning for IT functional leaders within the IT organization. Working with each Leadership Team, cost center owners and their direct reports, the Senior Analyst will build a comprehensive annual finance plan, partnering with the cost center owners to manage spend to plan, develop a proactive approach for quarterly forecasting, and implement process improvements to manage and track actual spend to plan.  Key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:  Cost center expense analysis and reporting which includes: Summarizing highlighted areas of concern, accruing for timing issues and working with Cost Center Owners for spending forecasts and budgets.  Facilitate the Annual Planning and Quarterly Forecasting processes ensuring targets and timelines are met.  Demonstrate shared ownership in partnership with Cost Center Owners to comply with, meet or exceed budgetary commitments.  Develop and maintain standard monthly reports that will provide Cost Center Owners with meaningful information required to make informed financial and business decisions. Consolidate all financials and assist in finalizing executive summaries and relevant reporting for senior management.  Conduct monthly cost center reviews with Cost Center Owners to communicate year to date results, prepare for quarterly forecasting and gain business insights.  Actively participate in developing business processes which will provide the organization with improved tools for managing the business. Qualifications : Knowledge, Skills and Abilities - Qualified candidates will demonstrate the following:  Understanding of the operational drivers contributing to department financial performance  Understanding of the baseline budget, and required accounting treatments (accrual, receipting capitalization, amortization) and OpEx levers  Ability to identify process gaps and suggesting ways to improve – improve efficiency, experience, compliance Skills Required: Knowledge and understanding of U.S. GAAP and SOX compliance  Proficiency with ERP system such as Oracle or SAP required, and experience with reporting and forecasting tools such as Hyperion Planning or Hyperion Essbase a plus Qualifications & Requirements: Strong written and verbal communication skills  Proven relationship building skills  Experience partnering with, and presenting to, executive level audiences.  5+ years of financial management experience  2+ years in IT preferably in Biotech or Pharma industry  Expert in Excel and strong skills in other Microsoft Office tools Education : Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline

organizationConscientious, self-driven and a motivated and dedicated team player AboutLogMeIn simplifies how people connect with each other and the world around them to drive meaningful interactions, One of the world’s top 10 public SaaS companies, and a market leader in communication & conferencing, identity & access, and customer engagement & support solutions, LogMeIn has millions of customers spanning virtually every country across the globe. LogMeIn is headquartered in Boston with additional locations across North America, Europe, Middle East, Asia and Australia. OUR VALUESBe Accountable - even when no-one is lookingThrive Together - greatness comes from unlocking each other’s potentialAdvance Confidently - we find opportunity and act on itCollaborate Openly - our whole is greater than the sum of our partsEngage Fearlessly - we speak up and listen

Name: Principal Analyst, Sales Operations
Description: The Opportunity: As a Principal Analyst at Venafi, you'll be part of an extremely motivated, dedicated, and experienced team that contributes directly and significantly to Sales Operations.  We're looking for inherently curious, intelligent, out-of-the-box thinkers. The Principal Analyst, Sales Operations reports to the Director of Sales Operations. Key Result Areas:Manage and analyze sales data from internal and external sources for advanced interpretation and predictive analytics to drive sales/marketing strategy and actions and to inform other functional areas as needed Includes field productivity analyses and the sales funnel contribution in lead to revenue modeling and analysesWork with marketing operations to advance lead to revenue modeling from lead through opportunity evolution to closed won statusSales forecasting for goal setting, using past data and trending indicatorsReport sales resultsWorking with other team members, define sales process steps to improve conversions, shorten sales cycles, and maximize winsWorking with other functional areas as applicable, define sales territories (e.g. named account dispersion)Key team player in defining and refining structured sales and operational processes for efficiency (e.g. ARR calculations for sales reporting, forecast criteria/steps, order fulfillment, etc.)Participate as a key player in sales and overall business operations planningPrimary team lead in gathering and defining business requirements associated with special sales operations related projects, including advancement of substantive operational/business processes in SFDC and other relevant systems managed by Sales Ops; work with responsible team players (e.g. Lead SFDC Administrator) to implement.System administration for AvisoThese responsibilities require effective communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to collaborate productively within the Sales Operations team and across functions, and strong analytical skills.Minimum Skills and Experience required:Advanced Excel skillsAbility to function in a fast-paced environmentTime management/Prioritization skillsExperience using SalesforceUnderstanding of financial forecast and modeling conceptsWhat sets you apart:Advanced Salesforce.com skillsAbility to effectively communicate at VP levels and aboveStrong PowerPoint skillsBI and data modeling/visualization skillsExposure to high-tech sales environmentsUnderstanding of subscription software conceptsAbout Venafi: Venafi is the cybersecurity market leader in machine identity protection, securing machine-to-machine connections and communications. Venafi protects machine identity types by orchestrating cryptographic keys and digital certificates for SSL/TLS, IoT, mobile and SSH. Venafi provides global visibility of machine identities and the risks associated with them for the extended enterpriseon premises, mobile, virtual, cloud and IoT at machine speed and scale.  Venafi puts this intelligence into action with automated remediation that reduces the security and availability risks connected with weak or compromised machine identities while safeguarding the flow of information to trusted machines and preventing communication with machines that are not trusted. Internally, we have an exceptional culture built around our core values comprised of honesty, transparency, leading by example, awareness, risk taking, and team before self.  Come join us!

Name: Salesforce (SFDC) Functional Analyst
Description: 3Core Systems, Inc is an SAP and Success Factors Partner with employees located across the United States. Our organization is dedicated to customer and employee satisfaction. We provide High Quality, Cost–efficient and Competitive Solutions and Resources. 3Core Systems is looking for SFDC Functional Analyst for one of our clients in Boston, MA Position: SFDC Functional Analyst Location: Boston, MA Duration: 12 Months plus Description: • Perform business and systems analysis work; conduct requirements analysis via information gathering sessions with business users and technical staff, workshops and meetings to define business requirements. Develop supporting process flows. • Assist in the creation of wireframes, functional maps and user stories. • Perform impact analysis with other team members to understand front-end feature impacts to existing back-end processes • Develop comprehensive test plans with users, coordinate test activities and/or help execute test components • Configure solutions based on functional designs in SFDC, while following development guidelines for documentation and process to deliver • Other responsibilities as assigned. Education and Experience Minimum Requirements: • At least 4 years of experience working in a Business or Technical Analyst function. • At least 4 years of experience on the SFDC platform. Preferred Skills and Competencies: • Proven ability to provide business and functional analyst outputs • Experience supporting or working within the pharmaceutical, medical device, or any other regulatory controlled industry preferred • Ideally, working on projects related to commercial functions such as field sales, marketing, call center or lead generation. • Strong understanding of how to transform business requirements into functional requirements with corresponding wireframes and Jira stories is a must. • Strong communication skills are critical to convey design options, translate business stories and work with peers • SFDC functional configuration skills are critical • Self-sufficient, flexible, and motivated team player capable of managing several activities simultaneously • Strong writing skills. Must have the ability to document process and technical knowledge in clear, easily understood presentations • Positive, results driven, rational, logical, team player Please send your resumes to: recruiting@3coresystems.com Contact: ( 630 ) 748-8800 EXT: 119 (Ram) Regards, Recruiting Team 3Core Systems Inc 4355 Weaver Parkway, Suite #330, Warrenville, IL 60555 URL: www.3coresystems.com 3Core Systems, Inc Web: http://www.3coresystems.com - provided by DiceSFDC

Name: VBA / SQL Analyst
Description: Key Accountabilities: Key Performance Indicator (KPI)¬ – develops custom performance programs to assess contractor performance. Scores are used to compare and incentivize contractors. • Manage and develop the system to track and report on contractor performance. • Most of our KPI programs are currently utilizing an Oracle Database accessed by SQL using Excel VBA for data collection and creating reports. We are on a road map to transfer the KPI programs from Excel to Alteryx and Tableau. • Manage KPI process, including monitoring and reviewing inputs and producing monthly reports. • Create the database structure, data input interfaces and the reports using an Oracle database, SQL and Excel VBA automation for older programs and develop new solutions in Alteryx and Tableau. Storm Management – When planning for significant events, the team is responsible for procuring and processing external crews brought in to aid in the restoration. A home grown application has been developed to facilitate this process. • Become the owner of the Storm Management System. System uses an Oracle database, SQL and Excel VBA • Become the expert of the Storm Management System both as a developer and as a user. Continue to evolve the tools to support the Storm contract management process as it is improved. • Troubleshoot issues during storm events and provide solutions in a potentially high stressful environment • Support Securing Resources team during major weather events in New York & New England. Responsibilities could include procuring, processing, or tracking contractor crews. • Develop job aids and provide training • Storm support is required 365 days a year and may involve weekend and holiday work as needed. Contract Management • Understand the challenges of each contract. Suggest and develop technical solutions • Develop, manage and provide training & support for contract management tools developed in Excel • Create complex templates and reports in excel using SQL and advanced Excel • Create presentations in PowerPoint and present during Contractor Quarterly Meetings Civil Work Validation Tools – In order to validate work for payment the team developed Excel forms that are filled by the contractors and approved by the field supervisors using buttons created in VBA. The information is processed in batches and is stored in an Oracle database. • Work with the Contract Analyst, Field Supervisors & Contractors to further developing the forms and the code • Track and solve issues with the scheduled batch processing • Update the Oracle Database and Excel forms when changes are made to the unit library or contractors prices • Create reports and presentations for the Quarterly Contractor Meetings Knowledge & Experience Requirements: • Expert Excel user including VBA programming • Expert in SQL • Expert in Alteryx • Expert in Tableau • Experience in creating database structures, user interfaces and complex reports • Experience in developing complex Excel tools Capability Requirements: • Analytical Thinking: Ability to leverage and analyze data to identify critical information, develop hypothesis and make actionable recommendations • Information Seeking: Establishes the facts by digging deeper, asking probing questions and challenging initial responses from different sources • Impact and Influence: Uses direct persuasion to influence others, using basic data, logic or a solid business case • Understanding Others: Understands what a customer is saying, their needs and concerns, even if the customer is not very clear, and can provide appropriate responses to develop positive customer relations • Teamwork and Collaboration: Values learning from team members and other colleagues' input and expertise, actively engaging them in conversation to develop innovative business solutions to enhance the end-to-end customer experience • Drive for Results: Sets and strives to meet challenging, but realistic service efficiency goals to improve the overall customer experience - provided by DiceVBA Code a must, SQL, Excel, Tableau, Alteryx

Name: Client Solutions and Implementation Business Analyst, Global Exchange, Assistant Vice-President
Description: The State Street Global Exchange SSGX team is looking for qualified individuals with strong experience in project management, analysis, workflow design, data analysis, system flows and business architecture in order to create client solutions and execute implementation of the industry’s first ever front-to-back client servicing platform. The successful candidate must be skilled in analyzing complex business models and flows across front, middle, and back office operating models in both an insourced and outsourced model; requirements gathering; have excellent verbal, written and presentation skills; understand global portfolio management, trading and compliance across asset classes along with the associated analytics.  State Street Global Exchange (SSGX) combines our unique capabilities in data and analytics to better serve our clients and build relationship with clients. Through information and insights investment analytics, data solutions, and front office tools our goal is to help our clients zero in on the opportunities and actions that will generate the most value for the SSGX front-to-back solution. We offer client solutions and implementation services that give our clients new functional capabilities that help drive efficiencies and new technical capabilities. We offer information, data management, and front-to-back office tools plus analytics to help clients achieve results and manage risk.  SSGX’s Client Solutions and implantation team in Boston, MA is looking for qualified individuals to fill key roles in implementing the industry’s first ever front-to-back client servicing platform. Primary Responsibilities:This client facing role will be responsible for designing solutions and onboarding new clients onto State Street’s front-to-back platformLead workflow analysis, data analysis, requirements analysis for current and future state models and architectureLead creation and delivery of internal and client facing on boarding documents (client proposals, playbooks, resource and governance models, cost and revenue models)Navigate complex client relationships, build strong business relationships and manage expectations with client stakeholdersConfigure platform UX for client-specific workflowsManage various stages of the on-boarding lifecycle (solution design, integration and testing, implementation and BAU hand overBecome a product and platform SME on State Street’s front-to-back platformSupport business development and sales efforts through consultative client engagement and POC’s as neededProvide regular status updates and supporting project management reports as directedApproximately 50% domestic and/or international travelQualifications: State Street considers all disciplines when hiring for a job and seeks out candidates who demonstrate the following:Bachelor’s degree or above. 5-7 years of financial industry experience across front office functionality along with middle and back office systems, services and data domains.Experience integrating with other industry software providers to promote platform interoperability (i.e. Bloomberg PORT, CRD, BRS Aladdin, SimCorp Dimension, Factset, Fidessa Minerva, Eze Software, etc.)Preferred experience with performance and attribution reportingPreferred experience with alternative investment transactions and accountingClient engagement and expectation management across project life cycleStrong analytical, reconcilement and organizational skillsExpertise in MS Office including MS Visio, MS Project and PowerPointAbility to work in a fast-paced dynamic, globally structured and team-based environment, as well as independentlyExperience in Agile Methodology and tools (i.e. JIRA, Rally, RTC) preferredElectronic trading platforms experience is useful but not essentialExperience in portfolio management theory and application is useful but not essential

Name: Alteryx Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionManager's notes: We are looking for a data visualization expert that has certification and sound experience in both Tableau and Alteryx that can help us build out workflows, connecting our cloud based database to our internal Tableau server. The individual would support development of Tableau dashboards that will provide our internal stakeholders with a visual view of performance, with easy drill down capabilities for additional levels of detail.  Ideally the individual would have strong data analysis capabilities (Excel/pivot tables, etc) that will support ad hoc reporting and data extraction.  The individual would have an advanced level of experience, be able to manage multiple stakeholder relationships, project manage and support workplans.  6 month + contract position. Skills requiredExtensive analytical & strategic experience.Ability to capture and analyze data for various reporting purposes to differing audiencesStrong analytical ability, strong excel skills.Strong stakeholder management and communication skillsSelf-directed with ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously The position will support The company’s Global Procurement organization and will work in coordination with the Global Planning Team. Support and coordinate the maintenance of Global Procurement business planning and related deliverables. Drive development and management of annual workplans across the Global Procurement organization, analyze and report on resource allocation to ensure optimal levels of support for The company’s business and operational priorities, ensure procurement services are delivered effectively and efficiently to expected service levels. Deliver reporting to The company leadership on financial benefits of Global Procurement services and achievement against plan. Position ResponsibilitiesData Analysis:Analyze complex data sets and provide meaningful summaries to drive strategic decisionsExtract and analyze internal systems data to support performance reporting and monitoringPerform deep dive analysis of data for root cause analysis and problem resolution.Evaluate and summarize data into quantifiable measurements/KPIs with corresponding trending and reportingFinancial Management:Collaborate with Finance Business Partners to capture and report on delivery of Procurement valueDevelop and monitor performance metrics and track against targetsProgram Management:Prepare detailed plans to track work plan performance and assure timely completion and achievement of program deliverablesLead projects to drive value and support delivery of documented resultsDevelop and deliver communication and change management updates for broad audienceIdentify and manage risks and issues that impact program progressSkillsAbility to multi-task in a fast paced environmentHighly analytical with the ability to draw conclusions using disparate sources of dataStrong team and partnering skillsAbility to bring creative and innovative ideas to delivering solutionsAbility to create clear, concise communication updatesProgram Management experienceExperience translating long-term strategies into operating plansQualifications Required:Bachelor’s DegreeSkilled in the use of: Excel, Power Point, Word3-5 years prior experience in Strategic / Analytical role

Name: Workday Financials GL/Planning Senior Consultant Technology Practice
Description: CrossCountry Consultings Workday practice is growing quickly, and we are seeking talented professionals to join our Boston Office. Being part of our Workday practice is a unique opportunity to join a Full Platform Deployment Partner that strives to provide a better experience for our premier commercial clients and our team. We combine the nimbleness of a Workday boutique firm with the capabilities and stability of a Big 4 consulting firm. Our core values in action empower personal and professional development through excellence, collaboration, energy and impact. You can find out more about our award-winning firm on www.crosscountry-consulting.com and Glassdoor. ResponsibilitiesParticipate in full-cycle implementation projects within the Workday Financials General Ledger and Planning suites Provide prime deployment, post production and support services to both large multi-billion-dollar enterprises and emerging growth companiesCollaborate with team to help clients navigate the selection, transformation, implementation, and configuration of the Workday Financials applicationAssist Managing Consultants on projects to help convert legacy data into WorkdayPrioritize clients interest and proactively listen to ensure that work exceeds their expectationsImplement performance improvement and cost-reduction initiativesContribute beyond client delivery with practice development, knowledge transfer, operational improvement and recruitingQualifications 2+ years of recent Workday Certified experience implementing Financials General Ledger and Planning Previous consulting experience with a Workday deployment partner Experience deploying multiple Financials projects simultaneously a plusAbility to build and develop strong client relationships Strong leadership skills with the ability to foster an environment of collaboration and excellence Excellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-trainingAbility to travel up to 50% of the timeStrong attention to detail with the ability to think from a big picture perspectiveCreativity, confidence, flexibility and a great sense of humorBachelors degree (or higher)Current certifications in Workday Financials, General Ledger (GL) and Planning CrossCountry Consulting is the trusted partner and expert advisor to leading organizations that are dealing with pressing business needs. We help our clients transform their finance, accounting, operations, risk, and technology functions in order to effectively prepare them for complex change, optimized performance, and accelerated business growth. Our consultants work collaboratively with our clients to provide customized solutions to our clients specific and ever-changing needs.CrossCountryConsulting is built on the fundamental principles of dynamic growth and shared values. Our culture reflects an environment that nourishes and promotes excellent client service, team collaboration, and individual advancement.

Name: Data Analyst / Quantitative Data Analyst
Description: Analyst | Cambridge, MA, United States  Our analyst team gets to work on all aspects of our business, from optimizing user experience on the site to monetization in order to help grow our reach as a media company. We work with MySQL, Python, R, Excel, and more, though no prior knowledge of programming is required.  We're looking for analytical thinkers interested in scaling our business and using big data to give our users the best experience across our platform.  Come help us solve cool problems and grow the startup!  What we're looking for:  B.A./B.S. in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or another quantitative field  Ability to plan out a process and execute on it on a daily basis with an emphasis on achieving and measuring results  Demonstrated ability to learn quickly  General understanding of market segmentation, sizing and statistics  Experience with or desire to learn R, mySQL, Python, and more  Bonus points if you have:  Experience with email marketing (and SEM, SEO, display)  Experience with online advertising / marketing growth metrics  Things You'll Like About HopJump: We value and encourage creative thinking & intellectual curiosity.You'll have a very clear understanding of how your work matters to the company.You'll find interesting new challenges every day on the forefront of online marketing.You'll be given the responsibility to have a big impact on and opportunities for leadership within our business from early on.You'll be part of a passionate team with broad skills and interests.We have fun! Frequent company outings, lunches, and parties.We offer competitive salaries, excellent benefits, and a relaxed work environment with plenty of perks.

Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst (Experienced) | Cambridge, MA, United States The Senior Data Analyst role is core to Hopjump. As a data analyst, you will work with engineers and other analysts to grow revenue, improve processes and find new opportunities for growth. We're looking for analytical thinkers interested in scaling our business and using big data to give our users the best experience across our platform.  Hopjump is a leading provider of personalized travel recommendations and targeted travel content to US consumers.  In 2012, a team of Cogo Labs (our parent company) veterans started Cognius, which has since become HopJump in 2017! Together we have decades of combined experience launching high growth internet startups with a focus on predictive analytics.  What we're looking for: B.A./B.S. in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Economics or another quantitative field; with 2-4 years of intensive analytical work experienceHungry and entrepreneurial professionals who want to influence key business decisions and have a direct impact on the bottom line of HopjumpAbility to plan out a process and execute on it on a daily basis with an emphasis on achieving and measuring resultsCandidates with the ability to operate independently, without being scared to ask the right questionsCandidates who will demonstrate an ability to identify an opportunity, lay out a rational plan for pursuing that opportunity, and see it through completionGeneral understanding of market segmentation, sizing and statisticsExperience with R, mySQL & Python is not mandatory, but is much preferedBonus points if you have:Experience with email marketing (and SEM, SEO, display)Experience with online advertising / marketing growth metrics Things You'll Like About Hopjump: We value and encourage creative thinking & intellectual curiosity.You'll have a very clear understanding of how your work matters to the company.You'll find interesting new challenges every day on the forefront of online marketing.You'll be given the responsibility to have a big impact on and opportunities for leadership within our business from early on.You'll be part of a passionate team with broad skills and interests.We have fun! Frequent company outings, lunches, and parties.We offer competitive salaries, excellent benefits, and a relaxed work environment with plenty of perks.

Name: Project Management Analyst
Description: You're empowered to do your best and to be an integral part of projects and programs managed through the Optum Government Solutions (OGS) PMO! Join us to perform highly visible project management activities. Primary Responsibilities: Manage multiple concurrent projects, delivering implementations for clients  Utilize existing PMO structure and processes to manage projects with appropriate level of rigor following PMBOK best practices  Assist in creation and maintaining comprehensive project plans, encompassing both IT deliverables (if applicable) and business deliverables. Schedule management skills based on industry best practices and use of MS Project or comparable tool  Maintain PMO tools for analysis and reporting for the initiatives  Interact with PMO leadership and other team leaders to coordinate and maintain status updates, project cycle, and expected results.  Facilitate and coordinate team meetings, deliver minutes of meeting and other required documentation  Create PowerPoint presentation decks for status updates

Name: Analyst, Workforce Analytics
Description: Job Description:By leveraging strong analytical skills and an understanding of the business context, the Analyst, Workforce Analytics will be responsible for dashboards and action-oriented analyses. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and a strong project manager.  Key Responsibilities Enable and deliver self-service analytic capabilities to our clientsDesigns and builds workforce dashboards that enable business decision makingDevelop actionable reports and metrics using existing technologyEnsure data integrity by developing and executing necessary processes and controls around the flow of dataInnovate and improve efficiency of managing data to allow for greater speed and accuracy of producing analyses, metrics and insights through cross-functional collaboration with internal teamsProvide input into data governance initiative to enhance current systems and support overall business goalsRecommend and implement enhancements that standardize and streamline processes, assure data quality and reliability, and reduce processing time to meet client expectationsAssist with data extraction, transformation, and manipulation for ad-hoc analyticsStay up-to-date on workforce analytics and data science trendsSupports internal ad-hoc projects #LI-RS1Qualification: Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent4-6 years of relevant work experienceAble to extract data from various systems, perform complex data transformation and analysis with large data sets including some statistics testing (T-Test, ANOVA, Chi-square, etc.), and data visualization/dashboardDetail-oriented and able to produce accurate reporting and analysisStrong organizational, prioritization, critical thinking, analytical, and written/verbal communication skills with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.Demonstrated track record in effectively interacting with multiple levels of employees, including leaders/managers in a corporate environment. Able to build strong relationshipsHigh degree of judgment, professional maturity, integrity, credibility. Able to maintain high level of confidentialitySelf-motivated and able to work independently with a process improvement mindsetTeam-oriented and works well in a collaborative environment.Strong work ethic and able to meet deadlines/commitments.

Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: TripAdvisor provides a unique, global work environment that captures the speed, innovation and excitement of a startup, at a thriving, growing and well-established industry brand. At TripAdvisor, you will be part of a dynamic, fun, and energetic team where you can immediately make meaningful contributions. We are looking for a Hyperion Administrator to join our Finance and Accounting team!  Reporting to the Sr. FP&A Manager, this Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will support two different functions at TripAdvisor, spending 50% of their time working with SQL and Tableau, and 50% of their time managing our Hyperion Planning and Essbase applications. You must have the ability to communicate effectively with both finance professionals and IT server administrators. You must have the experience to listen to a request or issue expressed by the business and design/implement the appropriate solution. Responsibilities:Updating and maintaining SSIS packages that transfer data between our various systems (Workday, SQL, Hyperion)Updating and maintaining SSRS reportsSchedule and maintain jobs that populate finances set of SQL tablesManage Hyperion environment from top to bottomMaintain and develop dimensions, hierarchies, partitions, business rules, load rules, existing SSIS packages, data backups, data transfers and user securityAnalyze, manage, develop and maintain Essbase cubesWrite and maintain calc scripts, shell scripts and MAXL scriptsOwnership of recurring month-end processes (loading actuals from Workday into Hyperion, forecast rollover process, metadata updates, synchronization of headcount tool and Hyperion)Ensure system performance and availabilityEnd-user supportTroubleshooting of critical processesAd-hoc reporting supportSkills: 7+ years of combined experience will all of the items listed belowStrong experience in relational databases (e.g. Microsoft or Oracle SQL)Proficiency in writing queries, scripts and stored procedures in SQLHands on experience with ETL tools (SSIS)Knowledge of SSRS reportsKnowledge of TableauKnowledge of ASP .Net applications is a plusStrong experience with administration and development of Hyperion Planning and EssbaseStrong experience writing and maintaining calc scripts, shell scripts and MAXL scriptsExperience with Hyperion EPM 11.1.2.4Experience with installation of upgrades and patchesBasic Windows and Linux server administrationAbility to communicate and work with both technical and non-technical team membersAbility to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environmentExcellent interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication, teamwork, and issue resolutionA problem-solving mindset; the individual should be highly motivated and self-directedEducation: BS or BA (or equivalent) in computer science, finance, or accounting. Languages/Tools: SQL, Hyperion, SSIS, SSRS, Tableau  *LI-JK1

The DSA seeks to understand the internal clients business as well as their technology requirements. Duties include analysis of business requirements, assisting with business cases and ROI, as well as acting as project coordinator on all systems related implementations. Consulting Consult with System teams and vendors to determine department systems requirements and solutions.Consult with other EUC technicians and DSAs to determine system requirements. Grade-07 #LI-POST We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.  Full time  Boston

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst, Business Profitability
Description: Netcracker Technology, a wholly owned subsidiary of NEC Corporation, is a forward-looking software company, offering mission-critical solutions to service providers around the globe. Our comprehensive portfolio of software solutions and professional services enables large-scale digital transformations, unlocking the opportunities of the cloud, virtualization and the changing mobile ecosystem. With an unbroken service delivery track record of more than 20 years, our unique combination of technology, people and expertise helps companies transform their networks and enable better experiences for their customers.  We are looking to add a Sr. Financial Analyst to our growing team!Job DescriptionReporting to the Director, Business Profitability Management, as part of Finance Global Delivery Support, the Sr. Financial Analyst of Business Profitability Management will provide financial and operational support to General Managers of Regional Verticals and supporting organizations to improve profitability and provide guidance specific to incoming deals and ongoing projects. As a finance partner to Vertical GM team, Sr. Financial Analyst provides insightful, trustworthy data to help senior management make strategic and tactical decisions for the company. Responsibilities include successful completion of strategic initiatives that continuously improve company profitability and efficiency, including but not limited to: deal margin analysis, KPI trending analytics, project profit health checks, revenue and cost trend management against the vertical forecast, business process and system enhancements related to all aspects of global business.Primary ResponsibilitiesPrepare KPI Decks and lead monthly recurring Financial account and project deep dives and Health checks, evaluating financial risks and trends, and providing profit improvement recommendations to Regional General Managers and the teams within the matrixManage monthly cycle including assurance of delivery of accurate and timely profit results across regional GM operationsCommunicate all significant profit, revenue and accounting conclusions to senior managementPartnering with BPM Managers, prepare pre-sales PnL analysis to support Sales organization during pre-sales process and monitoring against vertical specific targetsReview and evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of internal processes and manage risk by identifying opportunities to strengthen, rewrite and implement new risk conscious business processesDefine business requirements, test and implement an extensive ERP-based automated profitability reporting and analysis tool that enhances the accuracy, flexibility and timeliness of profitability forecastingPerform ad-hoc reports and analysis as needed Required SkillsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. SkillsStrong financial analysis skills with ability to manipulate data in excel in the form presentable to managementA team player, with ability to work independently, as well as cross-functionally at all levels of organizationRobust communication skills both verbal and writtenStrong organizational, analytical and time management skillsConsensus builder, enablerAbility to meet deadlines and satisfy needs with multiple and conflicting prioritiesAble to develop and master new skills quicklySelf-Starter, very detail orientatedAbility to interpret a variety of instructions provided in written, oral, diagram or schedule formProcess improvement focus with ability to develop and document policies and procedures Required ExperienceEducationBS in Accounting/Finance required, MBA a plusExperience5+ years combined experience in Financial/Business OperationsProfitability / P&L analysis and reporting experienceAccounting (US GAAP/IFRS) and Revenue Recognition experience a plus Experience working in large multinational software company a plusProficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)Experience in use of ERP system and BI tools

Name: Performance Analyst
Description: About the CompanyA well-known diversified asset management company is looking for a Performance Analyst to join their financial team. This position will support a large endowment fund that will provide critical financial support to the current and future generations of students. Our client is looking for a highly motivated individual who works well in a team environment. Please reach out if interested.ResponsibilitiesCompute and interpret performance metrics at the asset class, manager, fund, and holding level, and explain the sources of relative performance to a suitable index.Establish strong relationships with internal investment and operations teams and personnel at the custodian bank.Calculate, analyze and publish performance results or marketable and non-marketable investments, ensuring compliance with industry practices, to provide relevant, accurate, and timely information for investment oversight and decision making.Understand key accounting concepts and proactively identify research and resolve any valuation and performance related issues.Work with investment and operations staffs to continuously evaluate and improve processes and systems that support investment operations and performance reporting.Produce daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly performance reports, including executive summaries, board reports, and presentations.Qualifications Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years or relevant experience.Excellent Written and verbal skills, including ability to prepare materials for and clearly and effectively communicate information to internal and external audiences, client groups, and all levels of management.Excellent numeracy and analytical skills.Advanced knowledge of financial systems; internet and computer literacy.Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).Expert proficiency in business applications, such as Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.

Name: Applications Analyst I
Description: As a not-for-profit organization, Partners HealthCare is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.  We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Partners HealthCare is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.  Our employees use the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.General Summary/Overview Statement  The Application Analyst I reports to the Manager of the Dana-Farber Ancillary Systems team, and will be responsible for supporting the following Dana-Farber applications: real time locating system (RTLS); VIA Oncology; Act.MD; and other applications where needed. The focus of the incumbent will be to support the end-users of the applications to ensure the systems are performing at the level needed to both maintain clinical operations and support patient care.  The incumbent will be expected to perform site-level testing of the applications s/he supports; work with the end-users and vendors on updates and workflow changes; Epic integration testing; and managing small projects as well as being an individual contributor on project teams.  Principle Duties and Responsibilities Work with senior members of the DFCI IT team to develop a strong understanding of the applications and workflows supportedSupport the end-users of the following systems: RTLS, VIA Oncology, Act.MD, and other applications added to the overall portfolio as new systems are implemented.Answer end-user “how-to” questionsDocument and analyze business processes and help drive business process improvement workflowsHelp identify and resolve issues, and facilitate appropriate escalation for timely resolution.Work with vendors, business stakeholders, IS staff, end users and other required resources to facilitate upgrade and/or implementation of vendor applicationsAssist with developing and executing site-level user acceptance testing plans including creation of test cases, impact analysis, and testing scripts for any affected downstream systemsParticipate in regular team meetings to discuss team and project/program related activities, issues, changes, and communications as neededProvide service to users, according to the defined DFCI service level agreementsAdhere to recognized project management tools and methodologiesAssist in identifying and recommending best practices for business analysis, training, and end user support functionsCommunicate status on various project/program efforts to leadership, internal stakeholders and manage expectationsAnalyze business processes to ensure accurate system configurationUse the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & CollaborationOther duties as assignedPart of DFCI on-call rotationQualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Business, IT, Healthcare, or related requiredMust have 3-5 years of healthcare IT experienceA combination of education and experience may be substituted for requirementsExperience with real time locating systems (RTLS) desired but not required Skills/Abilities/Competencies Required Excellent written and verbal skills with a strong focus on customer serviceExperience in end-user management, preferably in a healthcare settingStrong knowledge of clinical workflows preferredAbility to effectively translate business requirements to functional requirementsPossess strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with cross-functional teams including staff at all levels of the organization; both technical and non-technical personnelStrong problem solving and negotiation skillsAbility to effectively conduct small meetings, both formal and informalRequires minimal direction from leadership and possesses the ability to learn quicklyAbility to successfully negotiate and collaborate with others of different skill sets, backgrounds an levels within and external to the organization Working Conditions Standard office environment with possible local travel to Partners sitesMay require travel for trainingOn-call coverage required

Name: SQL Developer Analyst
Description: SQL Developer Analyst EF Educational Tours (a division of EF Education First) Cambridge, MA, United States Role Summary: As a SQL Developer Analyst on EF Education Tours marketing technology team, you will take on the challenge of making sense of large and complex sales and marketing data from disparate data sources. You will utilize your knowledge of SQL, data warehousing, data integration, and analysis skills to create and maintain customer data store that will be server as a foundation for business decisions.EF Educational Tours marketing technology team is chartered with creating a deep unified view of our customers so we can react to customer signals and connect with them in a timely manner. This small and nimble team consists of technologists, data analysts, and marketing automation specialists working along-side a data scientist to build foundational data models, segmentation, customer journeys, and reporting to measure performance.This is an exciting opportunity to be a core member of marketing technology team working on building a brand new customer data store and get exposure to cutting edge marketing technologies (CDP, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CRM, Adobe Campaign, Google Analytics, Sitecore, Redshift, Google BigQuery). Your contribution will have a direct impact on EF’s marketing and customer experience.Who We AreWe’re travelers, innovators, thinkers and doersWe help teachers and students discover the worldOpen and collaborative - not a cubicle in sightWe’re global - we have offices and schools in over 50 countriesDedicated - we really do believe in “work hard - play hard”EF is a large company with a small company feel. We foster a highly collaborative working environment that encourages ideas from every member of the team. Our team members enjoy ample opportunities for creative experimentation and professional growth. People who thrive here are comfortable working in a creative, flexible, fast-paced and innovative environment. We never stop pushing the boundaries of what we can do and where we want to go.Who You areInquisitive- You love to figure things out, where others may have failed – you find a solution.Student- You love to learn, and have a hunger to constantly improve yourself.Positive- You’re an eternal optimist, and you never give up.Team Player- You want to be part of a team that motivates and inspires you.Multi-Tasker- You know how to juggle responsibilities and are willing to take on any role that may require attention.What you will do in this role:Utilize data warehousing, data modeling, and SQL skills to create a new customer data repository and data mart for marketing organization.Utilize data integration tools and techniques to unify web, google analytics, email, digital, CRM, and customer service data in the new data repository.Use data management best practices to make actionable information available to sales and marketing.Conduct analysis on customer data to guide marketing strategy and campaign planning.Conduct analysis to report on campaign performance and overall impact of marketing on business performance.Support segmentation and list building for cross channel campaigns.Support cross channel customer journey orchestration in Adobe Campaign and Salesforce Marketing Cloud.What prior experience you may require:Education or experience in quantitative discipline.Experience creating front-end visualization or back-end data models for new data warehouse/data mart/business intelligence projects.Experience in using ETL tools such as SSIS.High proficiency in SQL to create views, stored procedures, and queries to unify data as well as conduct analysis.Exposure to variety of data stores and technologies (MSSQL, Redshift, S3, Kinesis, JSON).Some experience building reports/dashboards in PowerBI is a plus.Ability to code in Python or other programming language is a big plus.Knowledge of marketing functions is a big plus.Desired Characteristics:Entrepreneurial mindset as well ability to work independently and in a team is essential.Executive presence and comfortable interacting with VP and DirectorsSolid business acumen to understand marketing and sales objectives and how a well-integrated and personalized customer journey can help drive business growth.Self-directed with positive attitude to continuously improve the automation processes.

Name: Data Migration Analyst
Description: Slalom is a purpose-driven consulting firm that helps companies solve business problems and build for the future, with solutions spanning business advisory, customer experience, technology, and analytics. We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible—together.  Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to over 6,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2016 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 27 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada. Description: The Data Migration Analyst candidate is responsible for analyzing the current method of data migration from legacy on-premise OR cloud applications to a cloud based application and providing recommendations for processing.  In this role, the candidate will be utilizing the data platform to consolidate and design data structures for our clients’ critical business metrics and/or reporting systems. They will working with business leaders and technology teams to deliver solutions that support analysts, developers, and on-going operations. We need someone who can bring their ideas to the table and help drive improvements in the data migration process as the migration may affect how our clients’ measure their key performance indicators, inform their sales commissions system, and track users’ engagement with their products. Responsibilities: · Analyzing the method of transforming existing data into a format for the new environment and the loading of this data into other database structures.  · Reviewing existing migration tools and providing recommendations for improving performance of the migration process.  · Providing necessary change and support documentation Qualifications: · Mid to senior-level data analysts with 4-8 years of experience using SQL and related tools for profiling data as well as mapping from source to destination.  · Proficient in database deployment, change management, version control, and migration tools.  · Experience with designing and implementing ETL processes using various tools such as Boomi, Informatica or Ab Initio  · Experience architecting and building data migration strategies would be a plus  · Experience with using cloud based applications such as Salesforce  · Strong understanding of data quality, data cleansing, data lifecycle, and metadata management  · Strong database design and development experience for very large database applications  · Understands and has worked in an Agile Environment (Scrum/Kanban) and agile application development techniques would be a plus  · Proficient in creating, maintaining, and debugging system configurations and database code  · Ability to code and script a plus  · Comfortable with frequent, incremental code testing and deployment  · A strong focus on business outcomes  · Comfortable with collaboration, open communication and reaching across functional borders  · Ability to communicate and express design models as well as listen to needs  · Good written and verbal communication, including with non-technical people  · Ability and interest to learn new technologies on the fly, as they become needed  Slalom is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Data Quality Analyst : Analista de Calidad de Datos
Company: Titan Human Resources & Strategic Solutions, LLC

We will align employers with the right people that will propel their business to the next level. We align career seekers with business leaders that will utilize acquired skill sets and hone in on developing potential. Beyond the placement and staffing arena, Titan HRSS, LLC is the premier global professional services company in delivering a comprehensive range of operations, strategy, and consulting solutions and services. Our client is our top priority, and thus drives our focus on delivering quality customer service experience, quality applicants and staffing solutions, a focus on our client's bottom line, and timeliness in delivery of satisfaction. LLC se enfoca en aplicar nuestra característica distintiva de una cultura que debe liderar con transparencia, enfoque proactivo e integridad. Alinearemos a los empleadores con las personas adecuadas que impulsarán su negocio al próximo nivel. Alineamos a los solicitantes de carrera con líderes empresariales que utilizarán los conjuntos de habilidades adquiridas y se centrarán en el desarrollo de potencial. Más allá de la arena de personal y colocación, Titan HRSS, LLC es la principal compañía de servicios profesionales a nivel mundial que ofrece una amplia gama de soluciones y servicios de operaciones, estrategias y consultoría. Nuestro cliente es nuestra principal prioridad y, por lo tanto, nos centramos en ofrecer una experiencia de servicio al cliente de calidad, solicitantes de calidad y soluciones de personal, un enfoque en los resultados finales de nuestros clientes y la puntualidad en la entrega de satisfacción. Name: Senior Analyst, Digital Business Strategy
Description: Fuel your intellectual curiosity and professional growth. Forrester is an idea company, where smart, motivated, curious people bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on ideas that change the course of business. Most of all, bring a point of view; here, every voice has value. At Forrester, you’ll work with innovative clients at emerging and established brands; these are the business and technology leaders we inspire and who inspire us. The Forrester experience is built on a singular, powerful purpose: to challenge thinking and lead change. About This Role: Senior Analysts conduct innovative research and deliver advice through written reports, consulting, client inquiries, and speeches. This analyst will be part of our digital business strategy research team, which serves professionals who are responsible for the success of their firms’ digital business strategies.  The successful candidate will write for, present to, and advise digital business strategy professionals at insurance companies, with a focus on both life insurance and property and casualty (P&C) insurance firms in North America. Candidates will need a strong understanding of the business and technology issues facing these executives today and an appetite for conducting and writing research to stay abreast of the issues.  Senior Analysts work as part of a small high-performance team and collaborate with others in all aspects of the job. They are expected to: Develop a deep understanding of what Forrester clients require to be successful as digital business strategy professionals.Conduct research into all aspects of the responsibilities of digital business strategy professionals, including business strategy, digital customer experience, digital operational excellence, organizational design, innovation, and digital business ecosystems.Help define the future of insurance by painting an accurate forward-looking view and predicting the impact of emerging technologies and business strategies.Help clients identify which tactics best drive digital sales success and customer loyalty, including the role of insurance agents.Write three to four long research documents per year that convey new ideas in a rich business context. These reports typically: 1) introduce new thinking about successful business and technology strategies; 2) present prioritization plans of new functionality and strategies; 3) compare new functionality or services and their potential to help digital teams solve their business challenges; or 4) size emerging business opportunities.Deliver eight shorter pieces of research per year on smaller insurance topics, such as customer behavior, market trends, and industry events, to be delivered in a variety of formats such as written reports, teleconferences, podcasts, and videos.Consult with clients to apply Forrester’s research in the context of their specific business environments and help solve their problems.Present at Forrester-sponsored conferences and briefings and deliver client webinars.Establish an industry presence as an influential speaker and thinker. Build relationships with digital business strategy professionals at P&C and life insurance companies across North America, as well as with the technology vendors that serve them and journalists who cover the sector.A minimum of three to five years of experience working in or with the life and/or P&C insurance industry.A strong record of academic achievement: B.A. or B.S. minimum; MBA or M.S. preferred.Deep intellectual curiosity about both property & casualty and life insurance.Solid business instincts and a practical understanding of what makes companies tick and how digital business strategy executives operate.A creative view of markets, technologies, and attitudes combined with a fascination with the future.Superior listening, critical thinking, and writing skills, as well as memorable presentation skills. Senior Analysts are expected to take complex, disparate ideas and distill them into simple, provocative concepts — and be willing to take a stand on vendors and outcomes.The ability to travel 20% to 30% of the time.Explore #ForresterLife on:YouTubeTwitterFacebookInstagramLinkedInGlassdoorFLSA Status: Exempt  Forrester Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity for all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, genetic information, military service, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. Minorities, Women, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans are especially encouraged to apply.

Name: Application System Analyst
Description: Application System AnalystBoston, Massachusetts - Posted on November 21, 2018Published By Dede NickersonApplication System Analyst needed in Boston, MA.  Job Description  The Application System Analyst II possesses experience implementing grant management systems; pre- and post-award, grant accounting, grant financials, and effort certification solutions integrated with financial (Infor Lawson) and payroll systems (ADP). He/She understands the business and workflows of post-award grant management. This role works most closely with Research Administration/Office of Sponsored Research, Finance, and Cayuse ITWorks, our vendor partner.  The Application Systems Analyst II will also work with team members in IT while interfacing with principal investigators (PIs), core facilities staff and research labs personnel to help manage and execute various informatics projects aimed to implement, develop and/or integrate scientific research data management systems such as LIMS, ELN, biorepository management systems, core facilities data management systems, and others. The job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Essential responsibilities are the basic job duties that an employee must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation.  1.
